OiBKTRMNO8pimKiHOVONgQ.text: Love her new location. The service was great along with the ambiance and seating. The bar looks very nice too. Enjoyed the blend of zydeco (cajun) and jazzy (Orleans style) music playing.. wasn't too loud. My favorites are the Crab & Artichoke dip and Gouda Grits w/ shrimp & catfish ... but today we had boiled crawfish for lunch to get our fix for crawfish season. They were boiled to perfection with the right amount of spicy seasoning. They were easy to peel (especially since they're in season right now) and were medium in size. We're so thankful to be able to get good crawfish so far from home. Ordered beignets instead of the delicious Bread Pudding w/praline sauce this time. It was hard to choose.. they're both so good and are a nice way to end any creole or cajun dish. We're SO glad she opened Lola's in Summerlin:)

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beignets (getting coffee with them next time)
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the corn was sweet and spicy:)
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 lb. and 3 lbs. - medium in size. Perfectly seasoned and easy to peel.

CkSowfNJCk4koPmFsEg9VA.text: Food was fantastic! Service was great! I had the gumbo and jumbilaya. Wine menu can use some work but the ambience was lovely.

sdGOEjVI7mOexMEeNxpwBw.text: If you like mediocre cocktails with the smell of burning bread in the background and bartenders that act like they would rather be anywhere else but there this is the place for you !!! Not quite sure how they stay in business but do know I'll never go back !!! Oh we were going to have dinner but the total bad vibe sent us elsewhere !! Hello !!! Hire a Manager and clean house with a whole new staff !!!

2Yei5wcZvnJQG0CWx9tWYA.text: Awesome atmosphere, food and service!  Highly recommend the mamas beans and rice, crab cakes and artichoke dip with garlic bread!  Great wine list.

3P79cCrCy8eiSlrnVtE7hA.text: Five stars for the bread and banana pudding.   Two stars for everything else.  We had appetizers, main course and dessert, and were very unimpressed with it all. My BFF spent most of teen years in Louisiana and I have spent time there as well.  This restaurant offers nothing in comparison to the bevy of delights I have eaten throughout Bayou Country.  Barely palatable, to be honest.  I have returned to get that banana pudding, however. The best banana pudding I have ever tasted, and I know my banana pudding, now. Bread pudding was good, as well.

-P-AU0oy3W8tBwLQ8msxcQ.text: By far best fish and grits anywhere!!!!!! We have all of our friends who come in to town eat at Lolas with us. My girl is the hot mixed girl here in yelp pics! If you want some amazing cajon eats you have to try lolas!!!! Amazing!!!!!!!

ginYh5ntU9SPwn2GMG0XlA.text: Wow. 2nd time here and perfect experience both times!  Bartenders are excellent, food & drinks outstanding. Live music was excellent and the clientele was friendly and having a great time.  I will definitely be back to Lola's!!

xWE26MDvUNKMMEzB9ElwxA.text: Poor service and food is not great.  Wait staff literally ignored us for 10 minutes when we first sat down and it wasn't even busy - there were only three other tables being occupied at the time.  Luckily, there is way too many restaurants in Vegas with good food and service that we never have to come back here again.

jw_EFZp5NBGtIYfmHRwyBg.text: We visit this location all the time and the food is great and bartenders helpful and remember our beer preference . Great place for a meal and to feel like you belong. Try the bread with hot sauce and oysters when in season otherwise too small and not worth what they charging for them.

py2whV8DWZb-LGT_Woun4g.text: I went there once again and its food is overprice for whatever can they get it out of . The staff is unfriendly unless you are of a certain type

DmPabmcWe5PmD-pCXNiAtA.text: My favorite place to eat as the vegetables are grown on site and everything is made from scratch.  I want to try the dessert but everytime I go I eat too much and I'm too full.

BW4ry83gOy55RVJSRgG2zw.text: First time. Food was good. Service was good. Nothing to brag about. The price for 2 people was about average. Cajun/Creole comfort food was a nice addition to Summerlin. We had the popular Catfish and Grits which was really good. Enjoyed the piano player in the bar area.

9HQ-jdOD5MZH2O45heKamA.text: If I only was allowed to eat one meal for the rest of my life, it would definitely be their Bronzed Shrimp and Gouda Grits with andouille sausage and mushroom ragout.  I'm not even lying,  those grits alone are the stuff of legend!  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and a super cute place for date night or brunch.....aside from the bizarre experience we had on Easter Sunday, where we legitimately had to wait 20 minutes (yes, I timed it)  to receive so much as a glass of water and another 10 minutes to order because only 1 poor very pregnant waitress was literally taking the orders for half of the restaurant while a million bus boys and other staff literally wandered around the dining room.  I actually had to flag down one of the bus boys just to get us glasses of ice water and ask if we could please order our food.  Eventually, the food did finally come and I was able to eat my grits and be happy again.  This was by NO means the poor waitress's fault and she apologized all over herself and was incredibly sweet.  She even took the chicory coffee off of our bill because, for the first time ever, it was actually horribly bitter.  Usually, it's delicious.  I have no idea what happened that afternoon with the bizarrely slow service and gross coffee, but every other time has been so excellent that I will not hesitate to return.  I need my grits fix every few months!  And don't hesitate to order their bananas Foster bread pudding!

JlEG0HlQnhRu0HDSjCfojg.text: Bourbon Street, French Quarter, Jackson Square, Garden District, Lola brings New Orleans taste, atmosphere, sophisitication, and spice to Las Vegas, Nevada. City leaders met at Lola's Louisiana Kitchen yesterday following the NFL Football Stadium Meeting and had a delightful time with Lola herself as she presented great gumbos, seafood, sausages and fine wines to the entire party. We didn't want to leave. We were there all night. The last to leave, I have to admit, that the dishes were so delicious that I didn't take pictures of any of the food, we were too busy eating to take photographs of the dishes. The conversation was lively, the interior classy, and conversation intellectual, and as soon as the crab cakes, salads, gumbo and jambalaya arrived to the table with fresh, buttered, toasted bread rolls, we started to dive into our large plates without taking photographs for our friends to see. So you will have to go there, but the community in Summerlin all embraces Lola's New Orleans style Cajun spice as a special treat to living in Summerlin. You have to try this restaurant. I miss New Orleans. Lucky for all of us, Lola has brought her Louisiana kitchen cooking to us so that we don't have to travel far.

eggbl9wb6b0RobPMFIQTDw.text: This is my second time visiting this location and I love and highly recommend the fish and grits dish it is their best item along with the crab cakes. I had reservations and when I arrived the hostess seemed busy and said it would be an hour wait however because I had reservations she would do her best to fit us in, we waited and waited and waited  after 30 minutes past our reservation time and no acknowledgement or keeping us informed of why my reservation wasn't honored we decided to sit in the bar and have dinner there (something the hostess could have also offered).  My disappointment is that is customers are valuable and our time is valuable simple suggestions, options or better communication could have made our experience better during our last visit.  I will return again because I love the food yet I am not not a RAVING FAN of their service and respect for my time.

_MQ1qhlCCwyVlJm5qSEYMQ.text: The original is on charleston. I love this restaurant.  I've been to both locations.  My family loves this restaurant. I have family that comes from out of town.  They insist on going to this restaurant every time.  The bronzed shrimp is my personal favorite. The grits are yummy. The toasted bread is great to finish the sauces.

Ndmru__eOSXe_k2EpsEqew.text: I've never really had southern style cooking but I'm willing to try anything. I did not thing I would enjoy cheesy grits with fish but it was fantastic. Loved it

Yc5tWasLhOqG7ubFXQldXQ.text: My second time here. Their food is fantastic. If you like Creole food the you will love this place. Today the couple next to me asked if it was my first time here, then told me they were from New Orleans and this was a piece of New Orleans in Las Vegas. That being said, I've only been through Louisiana once so I have very little to compare to.  However, authentic or not, their food is delicious. The employees are extremely friendly and the ambiance is nice.

FOOaS4ouYoFYDBL7pjIC1g.text: We came to Lola's tonight for dinner, it was actually the 2nd time coming here but the first time we sat at the bar for dinner. Before I get to the food I have to mention our bar tender Dominic he was f-ing awesome you have to come see this guy. He let us try this port wine that definitely exceeded our expectations, we are actually a bit of wine snobs. Although I wasn't drinking this night my other half ordered a Moscow mule that was made to perfection, outside of the drinks and awesome service Dominic just has a great personality. For dinner we both ordered the fried catfish platter with the same sides of green beans and red beans and rice which was cooked to perfection. This is a really good place to come to in Vegas for southern Orleans style food.

PaJMZmwLnUWX2ySbYs_8QA.text: The good and the bad.  The good. Waitstaff: lovely Atmosphere: Attractive Food: Delicious  The Bad grilled catfish delic but tiny portion, 1 1/2 fillets about 3 inches as I type am still hungry glass of merlot $9 (the least expensive) with a chintzy pour Most local places a glass of wine $5-6 Between the small portions, high price for the wine- a nice place but will not be back soon

S6MF_mocGBs_5a5WX0Ok6Q.text: Taste of the south right around the corner. Excellent!  Fried shrimp were off the hook!

KejPQ8aJYjfXOMHi5dOKBw.text: Highly recommend going at happy hour to enjoy the drink specials and large happy hour food menu. We tried the Tiger Dip (which is similar to cowboy caviar), peel and eat shrimp (which come peeled and ready to eat-bonus!) and shrimp remoulade (this one was my husband's fav). All three appetizers were great. Honestly were were pretty full but decided to share an entree since we have talked about going to Lola's now for a few years since we live within walking distance. We ordered the Roman trio which is somewhat of a sampler entree with red beans and rice, etoufee and gumbo. The entree was just ok....bordered on the lines of "meh", I was definitely more wowed with the appetizers. Will definitely try this place again as bartender was friendly and made a great cocktail. The interior decor is pretty neat, you do feel as if you are in NOLA.

Bx28uJb3vmXztdGtFlCVwQ.text: Waiter with top knot argued about vegan dishes did not even know what vegan was hot wings got three wings and three chicken nuggets got blackend catfish and 8 fries with it  very disdapointing third try same problems

bwsvG5_wXKA81bihXjn7ng.text: Grits and Shrimp is BOMB.    Definitely recommend, reasonably cheaper priced and definitely spreading the word that it's sooo delicious.

PTI8coWCHeZAEc5QHaSsFA.text: Came for a quick lunch and had a taste for Cajun. Order a jambalaya to try it out, not bad not bad at all. The portion is decent and the price is reasonable. Definitely will be one of my regular spots.

2hWEislc4MoySs778z7LFA.text: First time visiting Vegas. I tried the char broiled oysters which were not freshly shucked. The oysters had a very muddy and aged taste I couldn't get around. The house seasoning on them was citric to say the least.   The bronze shrimp and grits was very subpar . Though the shrimp was well cooked, the sauce for the grits was not cooked with the shrimp lacking that full flavor expected.  The grits was over cheesed believe it or not and completely changed the consistency of the grits along with flavor.

OWgbATSDz-vQJ4sS7zazMg.text: Authentic New Orleans cuisine!  A must whenever I hit Vegas. I love the Pecan Crusted trout with Gouda cheese grits, southern like iced tea, and the bread pudding. Extra friendly staff every time.

H5pqt4zKThQs3I6klCwfSQ.text: Been here twice, both times the food is great, service is great, and overall a great experience. The dessert is amazing too.    The soft shell crab is very good, and the low country greens are delish.   Looking forward to returning.  I'm so glad this gem is in Summerlin.

Za8b03ApxFSI1OmWFe7ELQ.text: I came to Lola's with some coworkers for lunch. I made an OpenTable reservation before we arrived but there was really no need since the restaurant was completely empty around 11:45am.   We were seated quickly but service started off slow and remained that way for our entire meal despite the not being too many other diners around.   Our group started with the grilled oysters and some chicken wings as appetizers. For my main course I ordered the catfish and grits. I don't usually like catfish but I wanted to try something different.   The food was ok. The flavors weren't as dynamic as I was hoping for and bordered on bland for some of the items. Overall the food was not particularly memorable. One coworker who had suggested the place for lunch was disappointed with her meal and mentioned she wasn't interested in returning again.  Service was friendly but forgetful often leaving our glasses empty far longer than I would have liked.  I don't see myself going out of my way to return.

cc5__879_GnLB8zdlzH4zQ.text: Great food!!! We have tried just about everything on the menu.  It is a must stop whenever we are in Vegas.  Our favorites are the shrimp and grits & Tchoupitoulas.  Can't wait to got back!

A6reyw8-L0wTrtlXtg70JQ.text: Being from Louisiana, I am always harder on places that claim to have New Orleans or creole cuisine.  I originally heard about this place from Diners Drive-Ins and Dives years ago and that is when I visited the original location in North Las Vegas.  It was ok but the place was a little tight and so was the parking.  After finding out they had a new location, I wanted to try it again.  We were in Vegas this past weekend and four of us went to the location in Summerlin.  The place was easy to find, had ample parking and an awesome menu.  It was so hard to decide what to order so we basically ordered almost everything.  I was happy to see char-grilled oysters on the menu and it did not disappoint this far from New Orleans.  We also had the crawpuppies and crab & artichoke dip to start.  Three of us ordered the Mardi Gras Combo and my brother had the catfish poboy and the roast beef poboy (yes he ordered both).  Everything was great!  Then we ordered the banana foster bread pudding, banana pudding, and chocolate cake (to go of course).  Had that later that night all awesome!    Last but not least I have to mention our server, Seana.  She was a real trooper and so sweet and attentive considering all the food we ordered.  She also recommended Orange Bowl Salad to my sister and we helped her eat it because it was that good.  I even took a photo and when does a salad get a photo op.  We will be back next time we are in Vegas, count on it!  Thanks for a great dining experience and a great taste of home.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish poboy
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast beef poboy, so tender, so good.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mardi Gras Combo. Fried catfish, oysters, shrimp, crab cake with greens, and sweet potato fries

dXHhxlDRgvGQkqJOMHtvaQ.text: This has been on my radar since it opened near where I live.  I've been to the original Lola's on Charleston Boulevard and I wanted to give this place a try.  I was seated promptly and was brought iced tea by a server.  Then I was left to peruse the menu.  Another server came along and asked if my order had been taken and when I said it hadn't, that server took the order.  It was short--a cup of gumbo for an appetizer and the crawfish etouffee.  Then there was a wait for the soup to be brought which was delivered by the original server.  I had not half finished the soup when the same server brought my main course--one of the things I find most disconcerting about restaurants.  The server said something along the lines about being sorry this came out so fast.  Is that OK?  No it's not, but I took the dish.  There was one other table occupied in the dining room and you can't get the courses evened out?  The soup and the etouffee were very good.  There was some Louisiana brand hot sauce on the table that said, "One drop does it."  No it doesn't.  I shook several good squirts and it still wasn't spicy hot but was better.  That has nothing to do with Lola's but Louisiana brand hot sauce would be my last choice in the future.  The etouffee was made with a rich brown roux and had some kick to it, enough that I didn't bother to ask for a different hot sauce.  I enjoyed it the way it was.  There was a good amount of crawfish.  Server 1 also brought me some more bread, thin slices, grilled a brief bit and nicely crisp.  For dessert, I ordered the sweet potato pecan pie with a dip of butter pecan ice cream.  The pie was very good.  It had a very soft texture from the potato and was not a custard-like pie as a pumpkin pie would be.  Very different and very good.  I enjoyed my dinner but I deducted a star for the timing of the service.  That simply should not happen especially in an almost empty place!

YOolmOlEmnir_7T8iPfauQ.text: Well the wife and I thought we would give Lola's kitchen another chance last night and I am sorry to say we won't be coming back. Love the atmosphere and friendly service but the quality of the food is far at best. It's time to refresh the menu and relaunch an opening. We were going to see Lola personally as she was having her birthday party at her Restaurant but it wouldn't have been appropriate.

VYOWY7AY9zpxRObteDeM7Q.text: Great prices, service and ambience. The bartender and busser worked great as a team and made our experience wonderful.

2BSbkm4e-qmueqR7bPns4w.text: I had been anticipating Lola's since I came across them on yelp. Yesterday my family and I patronized them and we can't wait to go back because maybe they were having an off day. I ordered chicken tenders for my child. They were juicy but kinda burnt. Like they needed to change the grease. My spouse had the soft shell crab P.O. boy and  he thought it was the best one he'd ever tasted. I ordered the crawpuppies which were flavored very well. For dessert we shared the sweet potato pecan pie. Which was good, it didn't live up to my expectations. We are gonna visit again and try some other foods at a Peter date

ynv-TYee_Wi_2NB4rDQ56A.text: Tasty food.  Positive atmosphere.  Lola's need more options for diary and gluten free customers (i.e. bread and sides).

-yTHGbmkrnNd7VnSDaxETw.text: Food was okay, nothing really stood out.  I had the catfish po'boy and it was really skimpy on the fish and dressing.  I've ordered this before at the Charleston location, and it was really good and "loaded".  My husband ordered the platter, nothing was terrible, but nothing to call home about.  The kids all had fettuccine Alfredo with either blackened chicken or blackened shrimp.  They enjoyed the food.  The fried okra was really good.  For what we paid, would have rather gone to another restaurant and really enjoyed the food.

KtKqj1_-pocOY3Ox0vEziQ.text: My wife was craving some Louisiana food on our way back to Vegas from Pahrump Winery, so I immediately thought of Lola's. I've never been, but heard good things about it.   When we arrived @ 3p, the parking lot seemed empty so we both didn't know if the place was even open. We checked the hours, and yup it was open. So we went in, the bar, tables, etc empty. We stood at the hostess stand for a few minutes to be seated, but my wife had to use the restroom so as she walked passed the dining area, she finally found a server to show her where the bathroom was.   We were told we could sit anywhere in the bar area, so we sat at the bar and were greeted instantly by the bartender, Dominic. He was great. Very personable. He let me sample a few of their beers before I found the one that was right for me.   We ordered our meals, I had the Roast Beef Po'Boy and my wife ordered Fried Chicken, side of Greens and fries. Everything was delicious.   All in all, everything was fantastic. I gave it four stars because of no one being at the hostess stand to greet customers. Not very professional.   Would I be back? Yes.

gawiRyx5B8Ezr1yG0-zByQ.text: I thought it was very good , the Roast,Beef D Breez was perfect I'm my opinion, also had the crawfish ettoffee was very good almost as good as mama made it. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. Definitely will be back.

PTzJulrLVgMTfwTAu7GhEA.text: Really reminds me of NOLA! The beignets also are really good! Not exactly like Cafe Dumonde, but pretty close! Sooo good to dip into your coffee. We had it as an appetizer, ate it in between our meals, and finished another order for dessert.  We started with charbroiled oysters. It was very good. Esp if you like parmesan cheese. We wanted to relive our meal at Drago's in NOLA. But it was too charred. Left on the grill a little too long I think.  For main entree, the hubby and I shared a jambalaya and the bronzed shrimp and grits. Sooooo gooooood! Very good flavor and perfect spice level.   One less star because the food took forever to get ordered and took forever again to get to you. If you're a in a rush, this is not the place to be.   Overall, great lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer, filler, and dessert. That&#39;s what we did!

RmG3NFvs5x1J_R3VfsLsZA.text: My friend and I had a post birthday lunch here and we love the place, cozy good hearty Louisiana food and love the service especially Lisa our server. A must see must try restaurant!!!

RaxjwBigyCNhhCSNq5dedg.text: I go to New Orleans a lot and been to most restaurant there for many years it's hard to find one focused on authenticity but I kept trying till now. Found one! What a great surprise to find this gem in sumerllin north of Vegas, the ettouffe is spot on as is the red beans and rice try the fig tart with caramel ice cream for something different. Excellent! I'm a retired corporate exec chef and pastry chef traveling the country for 40 years. Trust me on this one.

uEv5YdaNB7QYLhbO5ydSNg.text: Hopefully this review is indicative of an off night, rather than a change from the usual great food and service.  Although greeted promptly, it took almost 1/2 hour before we could get our order in, and another 1/2 hour (and after several assurances that the orders would be "right up" or "next") to get the food.  While we were trying to get the waiter's attention to order he walked by as if he didn't notice and then after he took several steps past our table turned his head back and said "I'll be right back" as he continued to walk away.  And not in a nice voice.  And he wasn't "right back."  The main dishes were fantastic.  Then another delay to get the check.  Restaurant was moderately busy (about 2/3 of the tables in the room we were in were seated).

JyYQ7rXEoiEL93MBr4PERg.text: Pure Heaven In The Salmon   The Service Was A1. Ashley, Our Server/Bartender, Was Amazing!!! Definitely Ask For Her When You Come.

We were at the back of the line of the opening (11:00am) rush so our food was a little slow, but no one was in a hurry and we stayed hydrated sipping the bottomless mimosa's  :^)

za4zWjHCc2NE8QrdfptFKA.text: This place is awesome!!! Fun, nice and friendly staff.  Great food !!! Great ambience !!! A must !

I62UXMc-y-NCAvKAqNr1sA.text: Ooooh my godddd!!!!! This places gumbo is so amazing!!!! I had a client recommend me to come here, and now that I finally did I don't regret it one bit. Holy crap, so amazing. And really good portion sizes for a great price. Tasted fresh and amazing, and I'm from the south so I know good gumbo when I taste it!

61Gzw2EColpwqx_Djwdsiw.text: Had dinner with the kids last night around 5pm. Nice setup and interesting modern Louisiana decor. Grilled French bread I guess was a nice touch. Food and service was great, server was accommodating to our pescatarian needs. Everything tasted and seasoned nice again to our requests. I would come back again, great spot to probably hang out in the summer time. Live music on Wednesday nights.

w04u2__wUJjymqxGYtZCxw.text: Never had a bad meal here yet. Brunch time offered my fiance her favorite chargrilled oysters with garlic butter. I, as always, savored every bite of the chicken and sausage Jambalaya with extra andouille sausage. One of my favorite brunch destinations in las vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best Jambalaya in las vegas in my humble opinion. I got the extra andouille sausage. Just the right amount of heat.

0Ww_TZieaBX3L-PfEkCZfQ.text: Don't depend on the hostess to give you accurate information. I called to see if they had crawfish and was ensured by the hostess that they in fact did! Well, turns out I drove all the way down there for nothing. And I never even received as little as an apology. I was really looking forward to this place, but their lack of communication is clear right when you walk through the front door.

M7ObC3AlYxmvimS7oBkCLA.text: Wow!!!  What a find!  We ordered the gumbo, jambalaya, shrimp remoulade, and soft-shell crab platter with greens and green beans.  The gumbo and jambalaya were flavorful and packed with sausage.  The shrimp remoulade was generous with shrimp, and the remoulade was perfect.  The 3 soft-shell crabs were perfectly fried, fresh tasting, and VERY reasonably priced.  The service was attentive, prompt, and friendly.  Lola's is definitely on my revisit list when I return to Las Vegas.

YKVkWiSaLmddI53MbpjkrA.text: Not bad but not orgasmic omg I have to come back a billion times.  If you're craving some southern food then yea shrimp n grits are the way to go.  The crab cake was a little meh but the soft-shell crab was on point.  Fried oysters were ok too, that bread is to kill for but it definitely needs some type of dipping sauce to send you to the moon.

kNBq99THcaUvyt0gooP1hg.text: It was my first time here and I must say I was pretty impressed. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our drinks never dropped below the half way mark either. I had the shrimp and grits with the andouille sausage on the side. I'm not a huge fan of creole style food. So when I tell you I enjoyed this place, take note. My friend had the fried shrimp platter. And whatever batter they fried the shrimp in, it was light and flaky. We topped it all off with the banana fosters bread pudding. While it wasn't bad, it was probably my least favorite. The bread pudding was a little too soggy for me. But again, it wasn't bad...just not to my liking. Anyway, I recommend this place, and I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

IvookUe5FrwpoSYY9AoZWA.text: We had been to the original one downtown but  this was our first trip to this one. Loved the Crawpuppies as an appetizer. The wife had the catfish platter. Loved it. My choice was the jambalaya. Plenty of meat and very tasty. Atmosphere was upbeat and NOLA style. I would definately recommend to anyone in the Vegas area.

z526CVARrbNbPtpcdkQt3A.text: Went to Lola's for the first time last night and we were so excited, unfortunately it was not such an awesome visit. The prices reflected on the menu were not the actual prices. When my sister asked to speak to a manager she basically said oh well it is what it is. However, the food was really good everything tasted fresh. Just wish they would train their staff to have better customer service.

LrgdEylr5uZ_gEPJasN9XA.text: Overall I really enjoyed my experience at Lola's. My boyfriend loves Cajun food so I thought it would be a good idea to find a Cajun restaurant while staying in Las Vegas for a week. Lola's just happened to be only a couple of miles away from Red Rock Resort where we were staying. The ambiance and decor were delightful with Italian lights everywhere. My entree of fettuccine Alfredo with bronzed chicken was delicious. The pasta tasted homemade which I love and the chicken was tender and flavorful. My boyfriend ordered the jambalaya which he really liked. Lola herself stopped by our table before we ordered, she asked if we needed any help and she steered me towards the bronzed chicken which is not quite as spicy as blackened and was perfect for me. What a lovely, elegant lady! Our server was very charming and nice as well. I just have to take off a star due to the "garlic bread" basket that we ordered. I liked the fact that the bread was grilled but other than that it was plain, I couldn't taste any butter or garlic. I think bread like that should come with the meal and not be an extra charge.

dmJ3hNXQLRq-R2o-y3z3nw.text: I was very pleased with my meal here. I LOVE Cajun food. I've cooked it myself, and I will practically eat the table as well when I visit New Orleans, so I am picky.  Lola's however, was great. My first thought upon walking in was "This place could really use some Zydeco music right about no....", and it kicked in before I could finish that thought.  Their gumbo is tasty, as is their seafood. I tried their crawfish etouffee, and they definitely know their stuff for this selection. The missus got the blackened fish with grits, and that's definitely prepared Southern style.  The atmosphere is nice, the servers were friendly, and the drinks were strong. I had a Bloody Mary, and the missus had a Blood and Sand. I was definitely cozy post-meal.  Cajun places are just hard to find in Las Vegas, but I will definitely return to this one as it's a respectable contender. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the Summerlin area.

wmUBjQ3njEiXK3Ea4brGTg.text: I moved to Las Vegas about 5 months ago and needed a place to watch the Saints play. I'm glad I found Lola's! James is an excellent bartender along with the complete staff who brings out our food! James often recommends different types of drinks and they have not disappointed! The food is awesome as well, I do wish they had a happy hour or some sort of specials during Saints game though.

0bbZrpGjRepIbHei_qVGLA.text: We came here for my father in law's birthday dinner.  Ordered the crab cakes which were great, then a cup of gumbo which I was most disappointed in.  It was very bland and flavorless and just seemed like a cup of muddy mush.  My son had the chicken wings which were too spicy for him to finish.  Dessert was great, bread pudding and bananas foster.  Their specialty cocktails were AMAZING.  Overall the food was just ok.  I like the new location, but the ambience was pretty dull.

U4DHIRI-NnSMpBqZa0WYcQ.text: My boyfriend and I went there for the first time a couple of weeks ago and loved the food! We told our server that we were disappointed that there wasn't any fried okra on the menu. To our delight, she stated that although it wasn't on the menu, she would be happy to order some for us. The crab cakes were amazing and the catfish was just right! The bread pudding was the cherry on top.

mDl8EGOvaG4zrya4fAtWAg.text: I took my husband for his first time and he loved the food and atmosphere, set by Luggnutt, on the piano playing and singing jazzy blues music. The soft shell crab and fried oysters were fantastic. Huge portions of the delicious gumbo and jambalaya. They brought out grilled baguettes that I thought was the harder kind, but it was slightly crispy with a soft center. Big basket, all gone!!!   To top it off, my husband ordered the chocolate cake for dessert. Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty jambalaya!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo, huge portion!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried soft shell crab. Delicious!

Taq0ymK1uwkA-nrUEqykHA.text: Not to fond of this place. First my Queen and I had shrimp and grits also loaded jambalaya. The shrimp was undercooked and the portion was small for the price. I don't think I would come back to spend $18.99 on a shrimp and grits when I could get authentic Louisiana style cuisines else where. My Queen and I left with a unsatisfied appetite and still hungry.

vtmoyF_DnUPvYk35iWud_g.text: We tried crawpuppies, a two-bite hushpuppy shaped ball with crawfish. They were cooked well and you could taste the crawfish. There were 4 in the order and came with a spicy remoulade. After ordering, we were brought fresh French bread toasted with butter. We ordered the loaded jambalaya that had shrimp, chicken and lots of sausage, a crab cake and country potato salad. All were quite good. The portions seem smaller than most restaurants, but the food was tasty overall. Our server was super friendly and fast.

4Umqx8Tn9d2ON5MYvQ44hA.text: I went here with a group of friends for brunch on a Sunday and it was absolutely amazing! We sat out on the patio and enjoyed bottomless mimosas without feeling rushed. Our server was friendly and extremely attentive. I had the soft shell crab benedict and it was delicious, I suggest ordering two crabs instead of just one.

mx7Y4xApvw1dnCeaUtE31A.text: I liked Charleston better than Summerlin.  Seems to be a pretty big disconnect in..taste.

2vUZZG9Rjrii1khWrrtJBg.text: Used to like this place but have had a number of issues lately - bad service, food not prepared as requested ("no spice" turned out to be heavy spice). The most serious one, however, and one we cannot abide is that we were overcharged on our credit card by $2.75. The signed slip clearly shows $47.25 and they put through $50. Have opened a dispute with Discover and won't be patronizing this restaurant again. Beware! Check your credit card statements if you eat at Lola's Summerlin.

LUxEJtw5bpwCQWzEDdMHQQ.text: Back again to Lola's this weekend -had the D'Brees Po Boy-OMG!!!! If you don't go here, you aren't hungry and may be crazy!!!!! My friend had the Shrimp Charlotte -delicious, and another friend had red beans and rice.  We shared the fig cake with butter pecan ice cream for dessert-exquisite. We are told the figs come from the owner's own trees.  I LOVE LOLA's!!!!!!!

Mwno0GekTlnTlpzU8ej2Kg.text: This is a cute little spot with full bar and outdoor eating. The decor is all about New Orleans, which is welcoming and relaxing. Happy hour on Fridays includes musical entertainment-some better than others. The food is very much under seasoned and lacked excitement. The food presentation needs to be enhanced. The appetizer shrimp cocktail was presented like an amateur did it. The catfish po' boy lacked the catfish and any flavor, but the bread was nicely toasted. The fries were not seasoned-not even salt or pepper. The iced tea was a bit too strong with the mint but presented well. Overall, I might revisit this location for a nice relaxing change of pace but I will not return for the food.

onexpFVF6Fxm5NC4AZ0oOg.text: Originally visited once two summers ago and returned for the first time the other night since my previous visit. I can't remember the first visit very much, but I do remember leaving satisfied and enjoying our meal.  This time, I was a little disappointed in the quality of the service and food. Our table ordered oysters, bread, the shrimp and grits, a po' boy, and jambalaya. The food was all okay, but service was SO SLOW. It wasn't necessarily the server's fault- she had a gigantic party and multiple tables with very little support. Not sure exactly what was going on, staff wise. We were starving and didn't receive any bread until our entrees came out (not that bread will make or break your experience, we were just hangry) and our drinks were slow to be refilled. We had to ask for utensils and napkins, but again that's just a nuisance, not a deal breaker! We ordered dessert- the banana bread pudding and the chocolate bread pudding. The banana bread pudding was great, but the chocolate bread pudding was just okay- the vanilla ice cream was the highlight of the dish (interpret that however you'd like).  This is an okay interpretation of NOLA-style cuisine outside of NOLA itself, but I've definitely had better. Maybe I'm just a snob because I've been wined and dined in NOLA, I don't know!

3taomQJ40_oqlPVkrOOG2Q.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy! Everyone so friendly. Food is amazing...bottomless Mimosas. .YES. The staff is amazing and helpful. The place to be when when it is football season and the Saints are playing. Lots of specials!

7VDsFOb6EKMK50H4gYZYMA.text: My boyfriend and I came here to experience that Louisiana good cooking and was disappointed by the food.   We ordered the gumbo, oysters, and crawfish. The gumbo tasted a bit burnt and the appearance was not appealing. The oysters were interesting but prefer raw. However, the crawfish had great flavor.   Overall, I would not return but glad I was able to try this place.

Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V5ds-i4M3mHLKo74LeZQ4Q.text: So so so good. I didn't like grits until I came here. Great service and delicious food. I cannot wait to go back!

ffqA5XULKaljcJLW9IP2pw.text: We were in the area of Red Rock Casino and decided on Lola's for dinner. This place was featured on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives by Guy Fieri. Usually his picks are home runs and this one did not disappoint. We ordered the oysters as an appetizer, crab cakes and salad, and the poor boy sandwich and barbecue shrimp plate for entrees. The oysters were grilled in a butter lemon sauce it tasted good but it was nothing special. The crab cake salad came with two crab cakes about 3 in diameter and an inch thick on a bed of lettuce with a lemon garlic aioli sauce was very good. The po boy sandwich was good but it needs to be eaten as a sandwich or not the individual pieces. I ate some of the meat apart from the sandwich and thought the meat was dry but later was eating it with a sandwich and it didn't seem dry. The barbecue shrimp plate came with five shrimp rice and a spicy sauce. We thought the sauce would be spicier because in the menu it had two fire icons next to it. It was not spicy and kind of small for what you pay.

Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Po boy sandwich.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Po boy sandwich

MX2NgwQnowlmr2hP6tBPKA.text: Brought the family approximately 1 month ago. It was our first and last time. I'm sorry I wasted my family's time and money. The service was so so. I felt uncomfortable sitting at our table. I felt like I was in an under decorated, sparse cold atmosphere, like a gymnasium. The food was fair, but their are so many better restaurants in this town. By the way Burger King is next door. Sorry

pn6q0RSPkzSZc6M_xraB3Q.text: Yum! Yum! Yum! I love some good Louisiana cooking and this place hits the spot. Delicious food and great service! Authentic as Bourbon Street.

egpW7a2nEB03EI_M82szWg.text: We had dinner here a week ago and i forgot to write a review. Best catfish dinner i ever had. Hubby and i both loved our dishes. Even the bread was amazing. Cocktails were yummy too, but, the bread pudding was by far the best bread pudding ever. This will be added to our regular spots.

0tBnuIjjnmEVdH4aNlMOyA.text: Overall I was hesitant to try this place because living in the south plus being born in Maryland my standards for southern cooking are high . The other location was never an easy option to get to so when looking for a fun place to eat I was excited to see this was here .  My rating is solely based on the food because I believe service can't ruin an amazing food experience .. but our server Emily didn't even introduce herself plus she got our drinks mixed up which is a problem since my mother and I both had surgery that makes us sensitive to sugar and dumping . Plus before we even realized the drinks were wrong she brought my children's drinks in adult cups and made me feel terrible for asking for cups with lids my son is only seven and my daughter is ten but with special needs (not visible ) but I didn't even feel right having her switch her drink just had to be a drink monitor   Not only did Emily not apologize for mixing diet and regular but I legit had to ask if she wasn't comfy serving us . Then she just stated she felt like she poisoned us and very clearly it just wasn't a match .  When I return I will make sure not to have her serve me .  I accidently made the reservation thru yelp and I don't know if she treated us this way due to that or she just did not like us but definitely a coaching experience is here to have her be a little more friendly. The food however made up for it .. I saw how Emily treated her other guests and she just wasn't friendly with us which definitely on a tab that is $100 with tip kind of sucks.  I ordered two appetizers and a bread basket to start.   The garlic bread is so delicious but there are so many better ways to fill up your tummy unless your starving id probably skip it.  Next up was the crab cake and crawpuppies both were super delicious and had the balance of flavors I look for in soul food .  I ordered the fried oyster platter and southern beans with bacon and potato salad and it's huge I couldn't finish it all after sampling my family's food but it's so good.. the oysters were fried to perfection and great quality ..  My sons burger was just a party with cheese since he's young but man it was juicy and home made and I even liked it (I don't love beef much ) but this was a win .. which my son eating makes it worth coming here   My daughter got shrimp charlotte which tasted just like the menu states   My mom got the roast beef po boy named after Bree's and honestly it was super delicious too  We will definitely be back to try a bunch of other stuff especially dessert .. looks like they do some fun brunch options ..  I'll just be sure to make sure I don't get Emily and hope I get good service otherwise I will be back to update my review but the FOOD is so good..  Plus I love to support local

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Charlotte super tasty my daughter loved it
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried oysters , southern fried green beans n bacon with potato salad ... delicious!!!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious home made pattie super juicy

ZaCPTLemyUD0exvo4_l4jw.text: Had a wonderful evening at Lola's tonight. Food was amazing. Seafood fresh and well prepared. Kindra took good care of us. You don't want to miss this great resturant!

L25n1VmjeBB8WY6taHLjfA.text: There aren't many Southern/Cajun/Creole in Las Vegas (at all), so I was quite surprised at the quality of Lola's.  It's authentic, and has a great atmosphere.  Our service was very attentive, and our server was very knowledgeable and helpful with the menu.  Their shrimp and grits, BTW, was great!

C2B-_7cHJF_HnZAIB7NoMg.text: AMAZING!! Got the Baked Oysters! DELISH! Cooked perfectly! I got the shrimp and grits. Died and went to heaven. A perfect mix of salty, spicy fluffy grits cooked to perfection. 10

3fZgEf9eJwNwOFOvUG3BVA.text: Came to this restaurant at 11:59 on Mother's Day, we were turned away because we didn't have a reservation and they were holding the tables for Mother's Day, although I understand it's A very important and special day, the restaurant was completely empty and they had more than 12 tables available, they could've very easily sat a party of two...  Guess what Lola's just lost a customer as I will never visit any of the two locations in Las Vegas again.

uB57a4bDfl3dDCVw5UZgvQ.text: I honestly don't even know where to begin. Great food and I loved the atmosphere! Perfect place to eat for anyone who loves Cajun food. I started off with the Crab Cake, which was full of crab meat finished with the perfect crunchy crust. I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy, fried topped with extra spicy seasoning, and my girlfriend ordered the catfish. I also had a side order of red beans and rice. Everything was amazing. We couldn't stop talking about the food and had no leftovers! I can't wait to bring my family and friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cake - Appetizer
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Po Boy with Fries
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Catfish with Fries

isRRudQR2kENZPgEbJEODg.text: If it was not for the poor service I would have given them four stars. The food was really good. We ordered the crab cake appetizer which was full of crab meat! (A must try) for our main course we ordered the jambalaya and the shrimp platter. The Jambalaya was good, it had a very rich flavor. The shrimp platter was even better! The deep fried shrimp was amazing, the shrimp size wad very generous and the badder was very tasty. We ordered that with a side of red beans and rice which were great. I'm truly not a fan of beans but these were so rich in flavor that I was very satisfied. For the second side we ordered Louisiana cole slaw which was super good! It had yellow peppers which gave it a good spin from your traditional cole slaw. For dessert we ordered the Lolas bread pudding. Well that one was a disappointment. It was warm in the outside and cold in the inside. There was really nothing special to it. As I mentioned before the food was good but the service was horrible. It took 35 minutes to get our appetizer! At that point they should have brought us bread or something to entertain ourself. Then we asked for cocktail sauce and that arrived 10 minutes later. And to top it off it took about 15 minutes to get a dessert that of-course is already made! Hopefully they work on it because with that service not even good food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbalaya
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake appetizer!

A7kvftmb5FpB4AxxREZhIA.text: So glad that Lola has opened a second branch in Summerlin.  Bigger space compare to downtown location. Great service.  Great food.   The BBQ shrimp reminds me of my aunts recipe- she lived in Nawlins for years.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing dessert.  Banana foster bread pudding.  It&#39;s so good.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Orleans BBQ shrimp- you will need extra bread to dip on that sauce.

wWRchodgBHaXzfjctASgwg.text: I haven't had much cajun food in the past so I'm no expert on how it should taste.   I love eggs benedict. So, I wanted to try theirs. The server did say the portion is on the smaller side. She was definitely right. Compared to what you could get at several other places I would say it was overpriced for the amount of food you get. The benedict did taste good.   We also ordered the beignets to share. They were a nice treat. Only thing I had issue with was that one of the three had none of the sweet filling, where as mine had a lot.   The other people I was with had more traditional lunch meals and enjoyed theres.   I would like to try this place again.

TQzhPa8WA8UAzte7POJ02w.text: For fans of the Louisiana-style Lola's on Charleston, this second location should please you.  It's a bigger restaurant with a large bar area as well as an outdoor patio.  Located on Town Center Drive near Summerlin Parkway, this Lola's sits behind the Sinclair gas station.   I don't remember if there was ever a restaurant there, but it's definitely a nice space.  We came for an early dinner on Wednesday around 5:30pm and the bar, complete with 3 flat-screen TVs, was busy with happy hour patrons.  We sat in the large dining area where there were two other parties present.  The decor has the New Orleans theme, with plenty of fleur de lis and Mardi Gras masks on the walls.  The menu is the same as the original location's, with dishes such as gumbo, jambalaya, crab cakes, po'boys, shrimp creole, and oysters available.  Dessert items include bread pudding and Bananas Foster.   I had the jambalaya with shrimp.  The shrimp were large and grilled just right.  The jambalaya had a nice little kick to it, but was not overly spicy.  I ate a lot of the boyfriend's grits from his shrimp and grits order since they were nice and buttery.  We had good service from our waiter the whole time.  My only gripe is that I wish they'd serve some bread; give us some carbs while we're waiting for our food, y'all. I just love bread, though.  Other than that, we had a good experience and will come back since it's more convenient at this location.  Also, there's a lot more on the menu I want to try next time, including the dessert.  Who dat!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar area view from our seats in the dining area.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

USuAOandfmRwQdZo6q0aZw.text: I can honestly say never been to Louisiana but since the day went too the original Lola  on Charleston. I feel like jumped on plane right on to bourbon street. Just soaking all the finest things the Big Easy has too offer especially the FOOD! Lola she all about keeping too her creole background and sticking with traditional fare but doing it right way from family secrets passed on from one generation to the next. The original location I have been couple times always end up going with one of the Po-Boys. Too DIE for and the most legit ones find in Vegas hands down!! So hearing that they opened second location one much closer on my side of town. Excited!   Second location sometimes have my doubts. I always think about "is bigger always better". You start to lose focus on the things that made you popular in the first place and consistency of the food more locations add. Lola not only small restaurant but great story (one that featured on triple DDD). I love seeing small business owners successful. Right off the top from the moment walked in the vibe, and everything about the interior design screams at you Big Easy. It has the old school colonial look all around, they have area that assume all clams or oysters on ice shuck fresh too order, the bar area think really nice with the brick back splash look to the many widescreen televisions around it, different chairs around the bar area from bar stools to chairs, piano in the bar area (I went for lunch no one playing but assume they do have live music), and NO doubt part of Lola personal taste not miss. She big Saints fan. Dah! You have big Drew Bree artwork. There this shelf near the bar but it feels more like bookshelf at home. Here you have the little things from the mardi gras masks, beads, jars of candy, and all these little almost personnel items. Just the patio area kind of small but had so much personality. They have big oak barrels around, plants, and not just tables outside in open space. Heck you even looking out through window out on the patio area. Just the theme throughout the restaurant got lot of personality but everything that great about the Big Easy.   The food was awesome!!!! Like I said had my doubts. The Po-Boy went with the Roast Beef. The last time had the soft shell crab. I wanted to knock another one off the list. The bread with any sandwich make or break point for me. Po-Boy had so many imitations that once have the real thing never take step back. Lola is the only place get my Po-Boy on not place comes remotely close. Not just one thing but the BREAD really stands out for me. She gets it shipped in just for the sandwich. It not only the perfect compliment but could get bread all day long. The Roast Beef talk about lot of food. Messy. But nothing better then having the drippings from the beef, sauce, and some hot sauce icing on the cake. It finger licking good. I started with cup of gumbo. Perfect starter! Loved the fact both restaurant felt like the food was consistent. All the things that loved about the first one still are at the original and now the second location. Lola never meet owner that friendly, upbeat, and this passion for food not only saw on the show but in real life. She just happen be sitting at the bar area when I had lunch. It refreshing see owner go around check up on customers and asked my thoughts on my Po-Boy. No doubt plan on coming back again again..

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lola roast beef po-boy. Featured on DDD episode.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of Gumbo

wIzgZmhOsCAV1NjMe80puQ.text: My wife and I have started going to restaurant's we have never been to before and we rely on Yelp a lot for finding interesting and good places. Yesterday, Kathy and I, along with two friends, John and Amy, decided to try Lola's in Summerlin. None of us had been there before.  It seems that the Yelp reviews kind of ran the range but all I can say is maybe some of these reviewers were eating somewhere else and got confused. We found the service to be very attentive and friendly, as well as offering spot on recommendations concerning some of the dishes on the menu. I have to say kudos to Ashley who was our server. She did a wonderful job. And, Lola was actually in the house and took time to go to different diner's tables, including ours, to check on the food. Terrific job, Lola.  I was anxious to try the gumbo because I love gumbo and hadn't had good gumbo since the last time I was in New Orleans, some years ago. I ordered a cup to start my dinner. It was served piping hot over rice and was full of sausage and (one of my favs) okra, but all was blended into a dark, rich, thick stew that started with an awesome flavor I had experienced only in NOLA. Each bite left a slight but terrifically peppery finish. I'll be going back to have this for lunch very soon.  Kathy and I split the 'bronzed catfish' served with 'gouda grits'. The catfish was beautifully dark, without being 'blackened', spicy without requiring the fire department and moist. What was also nice was this was a thick, fat filet that served both of us and not those skinny flat pieces of catfish you see in so many restaurants that serve it.  Being a southern boy, I had no trouble deciding on the 'sweet potato pecan pie'. I was surprised at how large the piece was. I expected smaller. My first bite was heaven and each bite after the first confirmed my first impression. It was crunchy with the nuts and had a recognizable sweet potato undertaste. The best thing about it to me was that it was not cloyingly sweet and sticky, like regular pecan pie.  Needless to say, we will be going back here often since it isn't too far from home. We are anxious to try their special events, like the pre-Thanksgiving dinner, Sunday brunch and their barbeque.

IGjJFyEdv2fJdTU9Q6FkJQ.text: I like Lola's. The crab cake- nice touch with the "L" shaped secret sauce... Or is that mayonnaise? Either way it all blends nicely with the lettuce under it. Kinda like an opened crab cake lettuce wrap. The gumbo was pretty good- nice size shrimp and sausage. The shrimp and grits is the main course every time- I almost think the sauce that surrounds the grits is thickened gumbo soup gravy- I don't know. The shrimp have a nice grilled flavor and they are jumbo. But the "gumbo gravy" makes it go POW! So good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Grits- better then the fish

6-_x_FL0lfE6iS6PhGMjfw.text: Came here with my husband, 8 year old and my inlaws came here for dinner. We are new to Vegas and we were excited to find New Orleans inspired cuisine.   Everyone at our table enjoyed their entrees. I had the jambalaya. It was full of flavor. The others had red beans and rice, chicken strips, sweet potato fries and catfish.   I'd like to point out that my sons chicken strips were very good. Tender breast (white meat) with a nice crisp outside.   We all shared the banana foster/bread pudding dessert. It was warm, not too sweet and the perfect ending to our nice evening.   I would recommend this restaurant and we are looking forward to coming back for brunch to try their beignets.

hgCgVpoyjZLZBN6zpsab-Q.text: Came in less than an hour before closing and every employee who helped us from the hostess to the server and food runner was very kind and attentive. Upscale version of the traditional Louisiana/Cajun style seafood type of restaurant. (Boiling Crab/Crab Hut)  Foods we tried: + Mandarin salad: had everything I look for in a salad. Fresh crisp greens, crunch from the sliced almonds and sweet mandarin oranges and dried cranberries. Can have with shrimp or salmon. Shrimp was bigger than I expected and the perfect addition to the salad. + Ettouffe: Kind of like gumbo (little kick of spice) with a scoop of white rice in the middle. You can choose shrimp or crawfish or a combination.  + Side of sweet potato fries: I couldn't stop eating these. Soft on the inside yet perfectly crispy on the outside. It's a big portion perfect to share.  + Banana foster bread pudding: perfect, warm with a scoop of either vanilla bean or butter pecan ice cream. Highly recommend! :-)

qsCRAFkL38MdayOUhT9nrw.text: The food and service was great. My wife and kids are already to go back. My wife and I aren't grit eaters but it was great at Lola's.

tGlC55_gFpZP26t9uYdR6g.text: Sooooooooo this place is amazing!!! That Shirmp Po Boy is delicious. Highly recommend and will repeat!!

9SPbFrG8RReL_G6ZcnXU9Q.text: Ok - nice place...clean appearance...nice staff...food was very good(greens were a little salty for me but I think most food is too salty anyway so don't go by me on this one)... we(6 people) ate around 2pm so not busy at all... The waiter had all the tables by himself which I believe he was handling ok... one minor suggestion would be to have someone help him with the drinks when seating people - do not wait for someone to ask you to take a drink order or at very least acknowledge the people at the table.... other than that it was a very positive experience...

A8VkDaMCSXiwi2VVKna7LQ.text: I stopped into Lola's for a late lunch. Great Cajun style food. I had the Bronzed catfish (with added shrimp) and grits. Really great tasting flavor. Would definite eat there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F-px_-Tjli7q-KHsYyJ9KQ.text: One word: Delicious.   This is my 3rd time dining here. I haven't ordered anything that wasn't fantastic. The gumbo is one of my top favorites. The banana fosters bread pudding is a MUST!

6LoD7uHgWUW-qpIVfB5GVA.text: Mother's day. We show up to eat at 10.30a even though they open at 11a on Sunday. We understand people are coming in at once. We were told 15 mins then was seated in 30mins. We are not placed together we are a party of 13 and are placed at 5 different tables. By the way there was a party of 6 next to us sitting at a table with 14 seats. They took our order we waited very patiently, received 1 refill then we needed to ask. Seated at 11.35a orders placed 1 of our guest asked for the manager being that now its 12.45p and STILL no food. Matt (the ? manager/supervisor) informes us it is busy and like it was a whatever moment. Then we are told by our server that the desserts are being comp. My cousin notice tables with bread and was told that we are to ask for bread. Our food arrives at 1pm! Some food was cold, some food never came!!!! AFTER all that we then waited for drinks and our bill. A family of 4 was seated by us as we watched they placed their drink order, brought them bread and food was provided within 23 minutes. I asked them if they requested the bread and was told no! Still no bill no communication from the supervisor worst experience ever!! Waited so long some of our party got up and left.... Wont EVER return again. WILL STICK TO THE NICE FRIENDLY CHARLESTON LOCATION!!!!!

AAdCqa8PfsEKgW4fiqB0tw.text: Roast beef de'brees is awesome. A triple D rated sandwich!! Good etouffee! Chewy charbroiled fishy oysters. Andouille jumbalya very tasty. Some other dishes that were brought to the table I didn't try but did look appetizing. Fresh cut fries are good as well. However the ants crawling over my food was a turn off. Management did come over and move the tables away from the window where they already knew there was a problem. Really come on people !!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast beef

LZi5aAOKlu1BXtvYcpfbEw.text: Service was fast and friendly. I think it may have been because we went because it was busy but the shrimp cocktail appetizer was the worst I've ever had. Our entrees were ok but not great.

FnTVNCcpFWntWaY9wNJbUg.text: And the HOSTESS was sooo kind and sweet! Young blonde girl forgot to catch her name but she was so helpful always smiling! She was awesome with my to go!

FizNt3ZJKiymbB57xRpgtg.text: First time here, and will not be back.  We received an incorrect item, were charged for items we d not order. We also did not receive an item we had ordered, and had to ask for it.  Sadly, we didn't notice the overcharges until we left. The food overall was very salty.  Not impressed.

cyY1lWcnjOaP318T6hTEjA.text: Can't say enough good things about Lola's. Great service, great atmosphere and some delicious food! Lola's is a must for anyone who has never tried the food here. I'll be coming back for sure!

nz-fo5Vvcm3YwdHVRmJkzQ.text: I have not been to this location yet and decided to walk there after an appointment.  .5 miles after, I felt I deserved everything I was about to order!!  First, I must say... My server was a man completely void of joy or personality or any kind of zest for "seize the day". No expression. Nada.   I got the crab and artichoke dip first. Delicious but soooooo greasy. There was a whole layer of oil on the bottom of the dish. Jeez. Well, I ate it anyway. Put a ton of hot sauce on it too.   Next, I ordered blackened chicken and a side of seasonal veggies and a salad with balsamic. My server, of course, the conversationalist he was, didn't tell me that their balsamic is basically oil, sugar and herbs. Tasty but super sweet and not what I wanted. The chicken was great, juicy and a little spicy. I added a ton of hot sauce (love it) and the veggies were sauteed well but again, sooooooooo oily. Mother of God. Heavy hand in the kitchen. It was basically swimming in oil. Too much for me. I ate them anyway.   Shrimp Creole was the last dish. Pretty tasty but I am pretty sure the shrimp is farm raised because, o boy, do your hands smell like shrimp butt if you choose to pick them up without a fork!! Gross. But the tomato stew was great with a nice strong creole kick.   It's good stuff, I love it, but a suggestion or two.. Pride yourselves with Wild caught seafood and ease up on so much oil. No need to drown sauteed veggies in all of that grease.   Server didn't get a decent tip, I don't tip faceless, removed and bland people. Sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My delicious but extra greasy veggies
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and artichoke dip. Hot sauce. Swimming in oil.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Still bubbling

tu7ChB9mOxrwMki1n1oxhQ.text: Fabulous food! Service was on point. Comfortable  no rushed atmosphere. Enjoyed hot artichoke dip with freshly grilled garlic bread, Shrimp and grits was perfect, have the Bananas Foster Bread Pudding (with vanilla ice cream & Carmel) so good! Portions are generous, prices are good for quality of food.

piM8KSxwnBOt64dCYTkA8w.text: We really wanted to love this place but the food was just ok. Crawfish were really dry and tasteless. The service was very friendly.

b0IOYBvc2R5HYi0yu38COg.text: The food was just MEH, but the bottomless mimosas, atmosphere, and staff saved this place :)  We have eaten at the other Lola's location, and were pleasantly surprised so we tried this place. I thought their breakfast menu was limited, and I was disappointed with the food that arrived. I ordered the poached egg with grits, it was plain. I got the french toast, it was ok. The staff was great, the mimosas were great, and the atmosphere was awesome. We will give it another shot, just not for breakfast.

UhCTNSw8uBF1H0pITb_8BA.text: Ragin' Cajun eats comes to Summerlin!  Met a rowdy bunch here in the bar for March Madness and enjoyed the atmosphere. The fact that they agreed to host us shows they have style! And tolerance. I had the gumbo and a basket of garlic bread. Loved the gumbo, could have kept eating bowls of that! The garlic bread was just OK, wasn't garlicky enough for me.  The Happy Hour menu is OK, draft beer is $1 off and there are a number of smaller plates for happy hour prices. The decor is festive and reflects the Louisiana roots of the owner. A great place to stop while in Summerlin and try something new.

CcdTBSIEwH9h-kGLwcC3uA.text: We started with Artichoke Dip, followed by Shrimp Jambalaya, Gumbo and I had soft shelled crab and greens! We also shared a bread pudding with Jim Beam sauce! We saw Lola's on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! I've never hesrd so much moaning during a meal!!It was a pleasure meeting Lola too!! Very nice touch  greeting your guests!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing everything!!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Thank you!

DzGyCHP_yYd4gOlEwGn7hg.text: Some of the best food we've had in awhile. Red beans and rice-yum! Shrimp and grits-outstanding! Grits  and gouda cheese--I thought I was in eating heaven!  D'Brees Po-boy--can't wait to have another--my favorite by far! Also had the bronzed chicken Po-boy and added the Mardi grad coleslaw--wow!  Soft shell crab and crab cakes with lemon aioli for appetizers-wet our taste buds for more! Not only was the food terrific the waiter Alex really knew his stuff. He made some great recommendations that did not disappoint.  We also liked the atmosphere. The restaurant was busy. Normally when people are seated next to you on all sides their conversations become part of the dining experience. We were never bothered by that. What we did hear was the best LIVE piano jazz. Truly New Orleans style!  Come for a meal, come for an appetizer-the soft shell crab was to die for with its Creole mustard dipping sauce-YUM, stop by for an adult beverage and great music. Chances are you'll catch the owner  Lola Pokorny helping in the kitchen  All I can say is we've  never gotten a bad meal. True Southern food and hospitality at it's BEST

PDFqZVm__upMh-xeFwAPEA.text: I have an office in Metairie just outside of NOLA.  My best friend, an old cajun who's family goes way back, is a fine Cajun chef.   So, i know my food groups from the area.  Lola's is the place.  Just the right stuff to make your experience perfect.  Who cares about anything else.  Lay back, enjoy the experience and chill.  This is where all things Cajun in Vegas happens. Oh, if you're lucky, you'll get Emily to serve you.

nE2ulmnBFlxeoY2Lc2x5wg.text: I've been to Lolas on numerous occasions. I was in town visiting family and wanted to have some of their food but because of time I could only order in. Well that was a huge mistake! I ordered about $160 worth of food only to be given food that was spilled everywhere. I called in to speak with the manager (Matt) and was completely disappointed at his unfriendly response. Although he apologized he did not take ownership of the way this food was packaged. I suggested they put more soupy items in a container with an actual spill-proof lid and not just the aluminum containers. After stating he didn't even remember my order (his words), he had a bit of an annoyed tone placing blame on the company who delivered the order. Then told me they actually do not do business with this third party company and cannot be held responsible. That's a very confusing statement as it is because how was I able to place the order then? Anyway, no accountability was taken and instead I was met with annoyed management. Unacceptable. Unfortunately my family was very turned off by this and wont be supporting Lolas.

omu1UVz9Hi8BXrayatfpOQ.text: Excellent food great service very flavorful.  Cocktails are phenomenal! Kudos to the bartender! Randall, our waiter, was pleasant, attentive and charismatic.  Thoroughly enjoyed our visit! Don't cheat yourself, Treat yourself.... Get to Lola's Summerlin STAT

nxpFfu2HFiii77Q2CWdT0g.text: I always love coming to Lola's, this is the new location but I do prefer to go downtown location. We always start with the. Asked if bread, crab cakes and gumbo. I love the flavors they have in everything. I recommended the shrimp creole, I get it every time! For desert we get the Banana bread foster!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YUw457fUTmHf5gvjdXjbcw.text: Wow!  This place is busy!  I went here for dinner with my wife last Saturday around 6pm and the parking lot was packed.  When we got there, we were promptly seated in the back of the restaurant and our drink orders were taken.  My wife god a Sweat Tea and I got a water.  My wife is a connoisseur of Sweet Tea and she was extremely happy with the taste.  It was perfect, she didn't have to add any additional sweetener to it.  As an appetizer, we both got a Bowl of Gumbo and a Crab cake.  Crab cake was good.  I don't really like crab cakes but this one was okay.  The Gumbo was delicious!  I liked the melody of meats contained therein.  One thing we both noticed that was it very salty.  Almost instantly our heads started to pound, so we both started drinking more to offset the affects of sodium.  I was feeling fine after a few minutes and my wife didn't finish her gumbo.  What did I do?  Yep.  I ate hers too. It was soooo good!  But my head almost instantly started pounding again.  So I finished off my second glass of water.  Refills here were super quick, even though we were seated in the back.  These servers have hawk eyes and it's much appreciated!  For a main course my wife ordered the Catfish.  I ordered the Salmon Grilled with Fries and the Vegetables.  Food took a little while to get out, but we were busy with our appetizers and the free bread that they brought out.  The bread was nicely toasted and had a nice buttery flavor to it.  When our main courses arrived, my wife instantly loved her catfish.  I tried some as well and it was pretty good.    My plate was grilled salmon with fries and veggies.  The salmon portion was pretty generous.  It was perfectly grilled. Not too dry.  The fries were OH EM GEE good! I have a secret (not now so) love for potatoes and it did not disappoint.  Nice, hot and crispy with the right amount of seasoning.  I almost felt guilty dipping them in ketchup.   The veggies on my plate were an assortment of onions, peppers and mushrooms in some sort of oil.  It was good. I ate it all it was so good!  We were stuffed, we couldn't possibly eat anymore.  So what did we do?  We got dessert! :)  My wife got Bananas Fosters and I got the Chocolate cake with ice cream.  Her Bananas Fosters once again impressed her and I got a bite of it as well.  It was very pleasant and sweet.  My chocolate cake consisted of what seemed really more like a brownie with a scoop of ice cream on top.  I'm not complaining, it was very delicious and definitely hit the spot!  We paid or check and finally left.  The service was great, the ambiance was awesome.  It felt pretty intimate.  The place was clean and thank goodness there is ample parking on all sides of the building!  We will definitely start coming here more often now.  Highly recommended to try this place out if you like Southern food!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert - Chocolate Cake and Ice cream.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert - Bananas Fosters
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish Platter

JPEKDXNrBVlB-VESl91jog.text: Had dinner at this lovely place this past weekend while on a trip to Vegas with the boo thang. We were meeting one of his friends for dinner who recommended Lola's and cited it as one of her favorite places to eat. I've never truly indulged in Creole cuisine so I was really looking forward to eating here after reading some of the Yelp reviews. For me- it didn't disappoint. We arrived to Vegas on Thurs night- around 6:30p...by the time we got dressed for dinner, picked up his friend and arrived at Lola's it was around 8:20 pm and the restaurant closes at 9 pm on this particular night.   We were greeted promptly by the hostess and our server gave great recommendations on food and drinks. We ordered cocktails but the star of the night for me was the cuisine. For myself, I ordered the "Bronzed Catfish" dish (catfish over cheesy grits w/andouille sausage and a mushroom ragout).  My BF ordered the jambalaya and his friend- the gumbo (both which were served over rice).   Our food arrived in a timely manner and I have to say I was satisfied. The portion size was plentiful- it came with four catfish fillets over a nice mound of grits. Now I will admit- I'm usually the first person to grab or ask for salt to season my food (old habit) but my BF always gives me the side eye so that I taste my food first. :)  The first bite of grits had me smitten- I love cheese and Gouda didn't disappoint. Between the grits and the sausage/mushroom ragout- the entire dish held so much flavor it needed no additional seasoning whatsoever.  Sold!   Now my BF and his friend didn't quite feel the same about their dishes. My BF had never eaten at this restaurant but has had jambalaya before- he said the first couple of bites were really good but the overall dish was just "alright" in his opinion. No further elaboration given. His friend said the same about her gumbo- "just alright". Since she frequents this establishment- her offering of why the dish was just okay was that perhaps the chef rushed in preparing our dishes since we had arrived so close to closing time. It's possible- but I'm happy that I was satisfied with my dish. Enough so that the next time I'm in Vegas/Summerlin- I'll try it out again....only in the afternoon this time. :)   Oh and I did hear that brunch on Sundays is a must try! My recommendation is to try this place out...... #happyeating

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Bronzed Catfish&#34; - Pan seared catfish fillets over cheesy grits (Gouda) with andouille sausage and a mushroom ragout.

k_nyqaBtS0FC3Kp-A25UgQ.text: Food: Delicious Service: impeccable Prices: very fair Ambiance: perfect  This place is legit.....go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From the patio. Beautiful
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fig Delight (legit!)

6BeGpg_ntVDz84JyaHCxnA.text: The service was good.  Basically, the food was good.   I ordered an appetizer of grilled oysters.  I have had many, many grilledoysters in New Orleans.  The oysters at Lola's didn't even come close.  I think that they forgot to put the oyster under the cheese topping.  There was a teeny tiny piece as though they cut them in pieces to make them stretch farther.  I sure missed the nice plump juicy oyster that should have been there.

cC9ktWIfvveWWFmVojkdVQ.text: What a fun restaurant! They have a beautiful enclosed patio with cool air!! The food, service and atmosphere were excellent and we'll definitely be back!

06b8YXJfeeiVoYM2KgoeZw.text: Made a reservation, so they stuck us in a freezing back room where our waitress forgot about us the whole meal. Seriously took her about 15 mins to stop by the table for the first time. Took another 15 mins to actually receive drinks. She "kindly" brought extra syrup for my daughter's waffle(that we didn't request or need) and then charged us extra for it. All the food came out cold (probably because she forgot about us AGAIN). Don't order the Eggs Benedict with soft-shell crab. It sounds really good but was awful. The crawfish hush puppies were decent, but $6 for 4 tiny hushpuppies is a rip off. Expected at least double what was served. Their menu said boiled crawfish were through end of June, but actually they stopped serving at the beginning of the month. Definitely not worth a trip across town and we will not be back.

cxf0Bf71OXgKx35dxsuEyA.text: Please please open a restaurant in SD, CA! It's been a few months and I'm still thinking about the Gouda grits and shrimp I had! Oh my goodness

P_5ijjDNsgIRpuf3AUzq3w.text: This place is a great place to dine! The food was excellent and authentic, and our server Zapporah was awesome. We had the shrimp and catfish grits, Andouille hash, leidenheimer garlic toast, chicken strips, and beignets. I highly recommend eating here if you're in Vegas, wish there was one on Los Angels.
