izOnFXaN8bl_xbTH6JGtZQ.text: I had not been to Lola's in over a year because the previous visit was not a good experience.  Lola has been pushing a BOGO on social media so I decided to give them another chance.  BAD IDEA!  The food was awful.  Crab Cakes were lacking crab, were mushy inside with the texture of pre-chewed food  (GROSS).  At 2:30 pm on a rainy Monday we were the only table in the restaurant.  The crab cakes were taken off the bill and the chicken fingers we replaced them with were marginal.  The French Fries were limp and the grease tasted old.  The owner, Lola, was in the restaurant and she couldn't be bothered to say anything to us. We could her.  It was not as if she was in a office doing paperwork.   Lola's needs Restaurant Impossible.  Our server was very sweet.

6rqQGJiugrIK8SZL02DxUg.text: Loved this place, took my mom out to here. We wanted to try something new in the area and we really enjoyed the menu and drinks that we had. Even though we had reservations it still took about 15 minutes to seat us since the restaurant was so busy which wasn't really an issue since the hostess let us know when we checked in. Would definitely come back and explore more of their menu

fw9J-lKCYNxz0R1QZfOyLQ.text: Food was delish! Staff were kind did I mention food was excellent? I had the shrimp and Bronzed Catfish & Grits, and it was mouth watering tasty! My company went with the Gumbo, also another great choice.  Didn't care much for the soft Deep fried Soft Shell Crabs- delish but my taste buds were not as happy.  Overall, yummy food is available for your tummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zVP6W8lou-nSo-5xL5SeMw.text: Perfect weather to eat out on the patio...great to have that option!! Roland was our waiter!  He was very friendly, quick and attentive!!  We had the Crawpuppies for an appetizer, then the Andouille Burger and the Roast Beef D Brees for our entree.   The food came out in a timely manner.  It was so delicious and reasonably priced!  They have live music Friday and Saturday.  Happy Hour Monday- Friday 4pm -7pm and Saturday all day long!!  Lots of great Happy Hour Specials!!  I highly suggest you give it a try.

ENnmLfpRqVAmvDjBeElaxw.text: Great restaurant. Service can be iffy. However, we always enjoy the dinners there. The live music is great. Cocktails are great as well.

PxO0HQjsVSXWYlf5BjkIqw.text: I had the shrimp and grits and it was very tasty. My other half had their steak special which was pretty good too. The service was good.

WCCLv14378gaKis8XwneAw.text: We were excited to find grilled oysters on this side of Vegas. Unfortunately what we hoped would be a tasty experience could very well turn out later to be a diarrhea nightmare. It should have been a red flag that our waitress was the one to grill our oysters for us. Yet it wasnt even the poor cook on them that made it bad or the fact they werent shucked and cleaned. It was that the oysters were brown and rubbery tasted bad and are now turning my stomach. It should have been obvious to the wait staff when there were almost half of our order left on the tray that something was amiss but it wasnt. We left and will never be back EVER!!! Freakin gross!!!

o72yI4K9evpj5W59ePsSog.text: I have to be honest and say I was somewhat disappointed with this place. We went on Sunday, Mother's Day and it wasn't very busy so that was nice. My friend loves this place and has been trying to get me to go here forever. I was hesitant because I looked at the menu and wasn't very impressed with anything I saw. I got the blackened shrimp with Gouda grits and it was pretty good. The fried oysters were disgusting!!!! I told them that they didn't taste right , I didn't eat them, They said they would let the manager know, and I still ended up paying for them! The Praline bacon was probably my favorite thing I tried. I'm not sure if I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ebEwsirVCC7ZjR8HnixO_A.text: I want to start by saying that I was a huge fan of Lola's. And not just because it was on DDD.  I absolutely love New Orleans and especially the food.  I've been there numerous times.  So, to have a place in my hometown that delivers the same quality of food,  well, it was amazing to me!  I've brought so many friends here and told many more about it.   With that being said....  my mom, husband and I came to have lunch on Tuesday.  I had received a BOGO on FB.  And I hadn't been in a while and haven't been to NOLA in 2 years.  So why not.  I'm pretty sure that we realized quickly why there's been the BOGO on FB.  The food was absolutely horrible!!!!  The place was super dark and empty.  I ordered my prior fave, shrimp and grits.  The grits were not creamy,  old and gooey like paste, but not creamy.  Super gross!!!  The ragu was meh and the shrimp were extremely over seasoned.  My mom ordered a salad and asked to replace the shrimp with soft shell crab.  The server never came back and said that wasn't possible.  He just delivered her salad with uncooked shrimp and said it would've been an up-charge of $2.  We would have had no problem paying the extra $2 so she could have what she wanted. That however, wasn't an option given.  My husband ordered a roast beef po-boy,  he said,it was hands down the "worst" po-boy he's ever had.  He was unable to chew the meat because it was so tough.   I actually hate that I have to write this review but apparently,  you guys aren't taking it seriously anymore and it shows.  Unfortunately we will not be back ..... yep,  it was that bad!!!

nnndi0BPNvJ_OsGJUyJn8w.text: Great value and an overall good dining experience.  The food is pretty good it's most certainly not the smallish Cajun kitchen place the name brings to mind. Lola's is a typical bar/restaurant in the modern hotel style, clean, bright and efficient.  The service is fast and professional albeit a little too cold and efficient but that's not a complaint more a reflection of my preference-for a little more warm and friendly service. I enjoyed the blackened catfish platter and my guest enjoyed the crab cakes.

C9I3zsVIhWEH7nbQ3gweVQ.text: Nice happy hour menu.   Dinner is good Cajun style food. Reasonable prices, friendly service. Today we had Shrimp & Grits and Catfish & Grits.

XfUOgThmQhl-vWEbo7mBlg.text: First time here. I had the Crazy Cajun Burger which was honestly the best burger I have ever had. I also had the beignets which are a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EU_I8_Jsoj0ptaeDm_E3hA.text: Lola's was amazing. Mama's red beans and rice was excellent, but the roast beef Debreese was the all-star!!! (Was on DDD's t.v. show) Wow! So freakin good! But after all that, we had to try the grits. OMG now it's a tie! The mushrooms w/sausage mixed w grits was insanely good! Great service as well, Kelly was great! This place is a must-try!!! We will be back. Probably this Sunday to try the brunch, Praline bacon? Yes please!!!

EDDbRkLTLERj5nnAxZ6QZQ.text: My husband and I went to Lola's on Mardi Gras night.  It was very busy, but we still had great service from our waiter Daniel.   We started with the crabpuppies; I was disappointed because the portion was very small and the dipping container was a throw away cup.  It was served in a tiny saucer. The appetizer just looked cheap, although it tasted good, what little there was of it. I have the shrimp and grits, while bae had jambalaya.  These portions were a bit small, but tasty, but never enough to take some home.   It is rare that I finish a whole entree and still have room for dessert...like very very rare.   To finish we had the banana fosters bread pudding and it was to die for. Their drinks are a bit overpriced as well as their menu of food items.  It was tasty, but too pricey. I don't mind paying to eat, we routinely spend a couple of hundred dollars of dinner.  However, for this kind of food....it simply isn't worth the price.

hGhB2Tw27vXhf5OiSMu9sg.text: ordered lunch special chicken wings . fries were hard like they were overly cooked and wings were just , ehh ok. For the 10 bucks i spent i was not satisfied & now visit the grocery store more frequent so i don't have to worry about lunch at work

ET50ZP5k_Zt23eesYq0kLA.text: Where to start, I love everything about this restaurant! Great atmosphere, GREAT food, GREAT executive chef, CLAUDE! He hails from two of the Best strip restaurants in Las Vegas, now featured here at Lolas. Fantastic flavors Louisana, French can't say enough. The fried oysters are out of this world. Lots of salads, seafood to choose from. Desserts are heaven had the flourless chocolate cake, beautiful and melt in your mouth. Banana Foster, exquisitely prepared and beautifully displayed. Art on a plate. They serve Brunch, have live music Thursday, Friday & Saturday. Prices are reasonable. They even have fresh veggies, figs, apricots, peaches, plums out of their own garden there on the property. Chef Claude is a master in every way, can't wait to go back. Well worth the drive from the strip. Great service and everything you'd expect from a great strip restaurant without the price. One quick tip there are 2 locations. I love the one in Summerlin...

op_h6JTkpsBkvuCuGqAiRA.text: We love Lola's! We eat here every time we are in Las Vegas. Originally from Baton Rouge, I'm sure you can understand how difficult it is to find real Louisiana cooking. They do it up right!

KRTafX7GW8y-1_IMcMWpZQ.text: So yummy! Such a cute hidden Gem tucked away in Summerlin! Lots of great options for drinks and food. They have Happy Hour everyday EXCEPT Sunday!

tEuWa7vAi7ne1RE0G0PYdA.text: Food was ok, and they do serve Cajun food.  However the quality and quantity wasn't great but the price of the check was pretty high for what I felt like I got.  The service was great though and the ambience was awesome.  Great for dates, but for people that are just out for food, not so much.

3YZcz_h31XICoaWOudaNzw.text: My boyfriend and I had thee worst experience here!! When we were finally seated we waited 30 minutes before I had to find the manager to take our order. We waited another 45 minutes. No drinks no food. I inquired about the status of our drinks and the server gave us much attitude!! JUST SAY NO NO to LoLo's. The worst customer service in town!!!!!!!!!!

8CusZIAQG8KVMgQLizejLA.text: Awesome happy hour, great live music and amazing food!! Definitely come check them out for your self.

AeiX7oFyHo9A7mQ_DAb5Pw.text: Best shrimp and grits I've ever had.  The staff has always been nice as well as the owner.  The toasted bread is perfect to mop up the left over sauce in your bowl leaving you craving more.

dyKiiMKPDrN6mqXoK7YXkw.text: This restaurant, specializing in Cajun/Creole cuisine, reminds me of many we have frequented in New Orleans. There was a piano player near the entrance that we enjoyed as we waited to be seated.  We shared a Caesar salad that was delivered on 2 plates for us along with a basket of sliced garlic bread.   For entrees which each chose bronzed catfish over gouda grits. The entrees we good, but our fish were spicier than we have experienced at Lola's original, downtown location so be forewarned.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. grilled garlic bread
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 portion of Caesar salad
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bronzed catfish over gouda grits

hl6ag-eZvuY6sr9CAElnqw.text: Food was great! We had reservations on Mother's Day and were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. Shrimp and Grits were so tasty! The waiter was great and very attentive. It was a packed house but we were treated like we were the only ones in the room.

W5qwbYwS-sD7sOQ02UmELw.text: Never disappointing. The shrimp po boy is my favorite. Service has always been good and I've never had a bad meal here :)

_wpWwJE3_mmVInuDdBEuSg.text: First time dining at Lola's in Summerlin and will definitely be returning. We were celebrating our Anniversary AND America's birthday (July 4th). Our waiter (James) was friendly and offered suggestions when inquiring about various dishes. The char-broiled oysters were large & delicious. Ordered a couple of Po'boys, shrimp was very tasty with just a touch of spice and the roast beef (DeBrees) was everything advertised on DDD. Enjoyed a couple of Hurricanes and Anita beer. Couldn't get away to NO, but Lola's is the next best thing.

UvzYHqEcqyLz4U7NEqzqIg.text: Stopped on a Saturday after a beer festival. The staff was accommodating for our moderately sized group. The food arrived quickly and tasted as good as it looked. A little slice of heaven tucked away in Summerlin

lH-ZnhcK_i7eeXv-4a4J5Q.text: I can only say "wow, that was a disappointing meal."  I went with two other friends and 2 of us ordered gumbo. Our other friend ordered barbecued shrimp. My first bowl of gumbo had one shrimp and hardly any sausage. I pointed it out to our waiter and he politely took it back and brought me a fresh bowl. The second bowl had 3 shrimp and slightly more sausage than the first. When I say shrimp I'm talking about small shrimp. I don't know the exact size but I'm sure they are the least expensive, high count size at the butcher counter.  Our other friend who ordered the barbecue shrimp received five shrimp and they were only slightly larger than the ones in my gumbo. He looked at me and said "I can't believe I'm paying three dollars per shrimp for this."  My bowl of gumbo, my friend's bowl of gumbo, and my friend's barbecue shrimp were very disappointing. I basically had a bowl of roux with six slices of sausage and 3 small shrimp.   On a positive note, the restaurant was clean, the ambience was nice and the staff was professional and polite.

yhUzy6r1UxsMWRFVg3T3mg.text: Good food, good drinks, good service, what more could you ask for! Oh yeah, live music too.  We will be back.

zHxUCvYTSWoFEenRmq-WxQ.text: This place was hopping when we went on a Friday night! They had live music playing and with a comfortably full bar and dining room, it really felt like a party. I would definitely recommend getting reservation, though, if you're planning on showing up on a weekend night. The food was tasty and budget-friendly. They have a pretty big happy hour, too, which is worth checking out. I didn't order seafood, though, and felt like the non-seafood still tasted pretty fishy. I'm sure it's all cooked right there together, and I didn't mind it too much, but if you're allergic or hate the taste of the sea, I don't think this would be a good option.

YUJ1d3KVA9DUgdE75TDvQg.text: Unique Louisiana style dishes right here in Summerlin. Service was great and food even better. Highly recommend if you like cajun cooking.

HCF_E0P0p7qWL57EfgKLog.text: Drive by this place daily and finally decided to give it a try.  Service was kind of slow but I chalked it up to it being slightly busy.  The atmosphere is nice, noise level was a little high which I like so I don't have to worry about my kids talking loudly.  The food was very good, love the jambalaya and the grits.  The chicken finger were kind of a weird texture and the fries were insanely grease, looked like they were at the bottom of a fry tray collecting all the loose grease.  I will be returning in the next week to try it again and will update my review if I feel differently.

jrogiDf6UJrUEX-J23ipLQ.text: I've eaten here twice with last week being the second time.  We started off the meal with the char-broiled oysters...so good!  For dinner I had a sample plate (red bean and rice, shrimp gumbo, and jambalaya).  Every item was incredible!  I was also able to taste the salmon and the catfish courtesy of friends...absolutely delicious!  Some of the best salmon I've ever tasted!    For desert we shared a Fig Delight...again, amazing!  On my next trip to Las Vegas I'll be coming here again!

uZwssmJ2zUEDym8Z090iVQ.text: Ugh...I made the mistake of accepting an invitation here. I thought maybe it would be better than the other location. Boy, was I wrong. This place is a disaster across the board. Amateur hour on every level. Give it up, Lola. Lol.

pdqyDJ12nazn0Ll1inJ7oQ.text: This was a delicious find. The place was packed when we got there so we sat in the bar. I still don't know what the restaurant area looks like, but the bar is very nice.  I got the fried chicken salad and I'm telling you...It was delicious!  We got some amazing cocktails as well.  Good place to bring friends or a date. It's kinda tucked away in summerlin, but worth looking for.

JVm6P1Zx_Jbfe97wMKNSQA.text: If you are searching for fantastic NOLA cuisine, LOLA's is AMAZING!!! Food is the best Creole/Cajun in Las Vegas. Service is great, and the atmosphere is comfortable. I have had plenty of food down in NOLA, at the "best" or "most recommended" for local cuisine, and none of them even come close to LOLA's. A MUST if you love spicy, savory, and delicious Louisiana cooking! I recommend the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits!

ZYA7bmt0xi35Jzq7l_UT2Q.text: Yummy! We came here toward closing to celebrate a promotion. The service was great, and the food was awesome!   We started with the charboiled oysters and hot crab and artichoke dip. The dip was good, but nothing out of the ordinary (its a good comfort appy- hard to screw, but hard to reinvent). The oysters were delish, if you don't like them raw.   I had the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits. I tried some of the crawfish Etouffee, which was also good, but my entree was amazing!   Definitely come here if you are starving. A great date place!

YMKOFIn8wID3NpLllMZ81w.text: Having lived in Louisiana and Texas I have had some of the best seafood/Cajun food around and this is about as close to the food that you would find in New Orleans here in Vegas. Only thing is Lola's is pretty pricey, for me and one other person our bill was a little over $160 that's for 2 appetizers 4 mixed drinks and two entrees.

tpokKKFlHH7ylbo6EhFXBA.text: Great food and really cool atmosphere. All the staff was very friendly and attentive.

a2utVosl7YVzJHVlSV1VXg.text: DeBrees sandwich is my favorite.  Great location.   Live piano player added to experience ..  Like this place and would go back.

YTVRyLavZ-tbEc8jbaojpw.text: Absolutely the worst meal ever. The catfish looked cooked but it was mushy. I was looking forward to the green beans but they tasted like they were cooked last week. I will never, ever go back again.

oB8Zd7EQIYttvBsuX_yFfA.text: Had the wort waitress of the year - rude and not helpful. Took forever to take our order, walked off before we are finish. Asked how much longer the food will take , she reply "it's full house"" and the restaurant is half empty.

PInI87-i-_AVd4aa8WRP3Q.text: OH MY!! We came here on a Sunday after finding out the other location was closed on Sunday's and we LOVE this place! The wait staff are so friendly and personable and the environment is warm and inviting. The food.. awesome! I seem to be fixated on the salads but ALL of the food is amazing! Give it a try... we now take friends there who come into Vegas to visit and they love it too!   Support your local businesses!

dfV7gWj9DvfxuQopEjavfQ.text: Finally got around to eating here, food was superb.  We had the crawpuppies, hubby had Tchoupitoulas and I had the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits, for desert the Famous Bread Pudding.  His dish was awesome, he loved the crawpuppies too.  I also enjoyed my dish & the grits was very buttery but I thought was a bit thick.  For me the crawpuppies were salty but again, hubby likes it. Desert was delicious and just enough sweetness to it.   4 stars for great service and good food, we'd return to try other dishes.  However, for a Louisiana type of restaurant, I found the place to be costly and I wish they had binget hence, less 1 star.

HIy1aD7BItw44EWfmchC9A.text: Their food was delicious! Very friendly restaurant. We had fish and grits...absolutely amazing! And their black eyed pea cold salad was good. The pricing is reasonable as this is an upscale restaurant. I would highly recommend it. This place is perfect for wedding parties, bridal showers, dates... just about anything. It's a Southern Soul Food style restaurant with an upscale design. Pretty Fancy... but not too pricey. Even the food decoration on your plate looks like Hell's Kitchen. We loved it and I believe you will too. Apparently, there are 2 locations in Vegas. We ended up outside of the Vegas strip by about 20min's. We thought we were going to the one near the wedding chapels. But I hear that both locations are excellent.

ILV1uRDfebnZKwTcIQRTgA.text: My all time favorite is shrimp and grits.  The gouda grits are to die for, and the andouille sauce with the grits....well, I can always use more of it!  La Louisiann cocktail is my go-to drink but the happy hour specials had me going with one that tasted like a jolly rancher.  Can't recall the name....something "bomb"

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and grits and Hand Grenade. Bartender Randal is very attentive! Good happy hour!!

y4GXcZbZJPzelHn9Gt8-cw.text: Every time we visit Las Vegas I try to visit Lolas and I must say they never disappoint, food is always delicious and service is great staff is very courteous and attentive. My family and I will definitely continue to visit Lolas.   Also note yelp states they open at 11am but at the establishment it states they have new hours and open at 12 so FYI call ahead we learned this the hard way.

oUiBGVDcvKuutjO34MHGjA.text: Followup on suspected FOOD POISONING.  My son called Lola's, the response: "We'll tell Lola, sorry about that".  Nothing else.

Z_qEziKROatePmcfG-6Z8A.text: I have found a new favorite spot! I just had my birthday here and everything was perfect. The good was great (I had the Roman trio and crab cake) and the service was amazing. Kyle was a wonderful server and the rest of the staff was so friendly. Can't wait to come back to try the entire menu!

hVJVvOZH1iDGM3mEvXRGMw.text: The red beans and rice had great flavor and the Tchapitoulas was delicious and a good portion. The restaurant has a cool New Orleans vibe, service was quick on a Tuesday evening. We will definitely be back!

Nr_vsJprLSmEuTd9sfux6g.text: I have never been in Louisiana restaurant before but this place is amazing. Interior is lovely, they have live music. I had char broiled oysters with cheese. I'm a huge oyster lover and these ones tasted great. My husband ordered a crab dish and my parents-in-law ordered fried salmon and they also adored what they got. Oh and their garlic bread is also awesome, we ordered two baskets and couldn't get enough.

29dwD7MbREckpaW6PIWACw.text: The gumbo and jambalaya were great. Service was also attentive, and the area is perfect for brunch. I would recommend if you're missing New Orleans and some of that good ol cajun.

RFZHulbwiKSi8RzrVWTlxg.text: Dirty place. And very bad customer service. Rude.  And. People that work there. Siting. Outside. Smoking.  Never saw them wash hands

w67wgIdTn5adAp4cGsULig.text: My first experience was a 2 star.  I actually never finished my review and I'm glad I didn't.  I think I was having a bad day.  I remember hush puppies being hard little moon rocks and not much else.  I went back to eat at the bar on Friday.  It was early and it was packed.   One bartender was clearly having his bad day but Adam was a rock star.  I just wanted a beer but everything that is popular now is kind of "yucky" by my standards.  They popped one open for me and it fit "yucky" and poured me another I liked.  I would have paid for the one wasted but there was no disagreement, attitude or anything but "let's find one you like"  POOF. It appeared.  I had the shrimp and grits.  Normally I am the slowest eater on earth.  Not only did I snarf it up in an unlady like fashion... but if I was at home I would have licked the plate.  The shrimp wasn't the star of the dish.  The gouda grits with the sausage and sauce... one word... OINK!  The new location just doesn't have the right kind of funk for Cajun.  I wish they could do something to the outside.  They are trying on the inside but it still doesn't reek Cajun to me.  What WAS appropriately funky was the pianist that started at about...uhm... 6pm? (early by live music standards)  I loved everything he played and how he played it.  I sat next to a regular who clearly knew the servers and the menu inside and out.  She was very helpful.  As she waived and talked to other people I realized a good portion of the crowd were regulars.  That's always a good thing.  My only complaint is the bar stools were heavy.  They don't swivel and they were tight next to each other getting in and out was hard.  That was minor.  There were some lower tables and chairs in the bar area close to the piano.  I'm definitely going back for the music and food on another weekend.  BTW, it is smoke free (inside at least... I didn't sit outside).  I'm not a smoker but I could totally see a successful cigar lounge attached, outside or next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Live music Friday and Saturday... Early crowd and fairly early close

B-RfLlyXkgn2tYgJdVDMPQ.text: Going against your initial ordering instinct will get you every time! The Summerlin location of Lola's is beautiful- much nicer than the one downtown. Think upper crust New Orleans rather than Bourbon Street. Service was attentive as well.  But my Shrimp Po Boy ($12.99)  was a misstep, unfortunately. The bread was fine, there was enough shrimp (although the sandwich as a whole was a bit on the small side), but it was super salty. Not spicy, just salty. The tartar sauce even was salty. I definitely should have gone with the catfish and grits, as was my original plan.   The bread basket was good, warm and buttery, so that was at least pleasant. Despite the po boy,  I'll return, but just will order something else.   Perhaps just an off day... Eaux.

0QKlHzQD6-PI0uci7zARlw.text: Had an amazing meal last night with wonderful service. Cocktails are pretty pricey, but that's my only complaint. The banana fosters bread pudding is to die for. Moscow mule was honestly the best one I've had. Loved this place and will be back for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8D_uLXpYoMkIY7EmGQf7UQ.text: Enjoyed my dining experience. There's a first time for everything. Started off with some crawfish. Nicely spiced just too small for me. Didn't like the work for so little. Had the soft shell crab and enjoyed every bite!  Look forward to my return trip.

0zwf-TqIoO79y1zIdKtDjA.text: Do you like your grits cheesy? Go to Lola's! On a diet? Have a cheat day, and go to Lola's!  I always get their catfish n' grits... their blackened catfish is spot-on, and their sauce with mushrooms begs for a side of their crispy, Cajun fries to soak it all up.  And save room for dessert!  Also--I loved their pianist in their bar area. Definitely put me in the right mindset! I need to come back for their happy hour!

Z729vjhlF5miN2ov2yL-2g.text: This place is a little hidden gem. The food is great home cooking and the drink are amazing!

c_NNB5WLhwdoGUMS9zAbWg.text: I have been once for Sunday brunch and once for dinner.  Had I only been to Sunday brunch, I would have knocked a star off because the menu is limited (discovering right before going in the menu online and having my pick ready to go before finding that out).    My first visit, I had a crab cake appetizer (which was very tasty) and chicken wings  - they asked me what level of heat starting with 5 and going way up from there.  I said a "6" and the things nearly burned my lips off but they had really good flavor.  My next visit, I had the bronzed shrimp and grits.  Fantastic flavor but damn spicy!  About mid way through, the spice again started to make me uncomfy.  I should mention I have had grits before and these were the best I have had.  Maybe it was in combo with the sauce which contained andouille sausage - which was nice too, but they were cheesy and tasty.  The staff was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere nice and "New Orleansy".  I think what makes this place a 4 star instead of 3 1/2 is that it's different than the place down the road and that's a good thing to me. I'll come back again

4l4j4PFzcrI2Qzx8uq4sdA.text: You got to eat here. You won't be disappointed. It's the best meal I have had in Las Vegas.  The food, drinks and desserts were very good. We were celebrating my in-laws 60th Wedding Anniversary. The service was great. We will come back every time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying Ann &amp; Rodney&#39;s 60th Wedding Louisiana Style

ZH2PP27q9PzMGskr_MXsGQ.text: Lola's was amazing for dinner last night. We live in Orange County and wow do I wish we had a Lola's in our neighborhood. We started our meal with a cocktail and the Charbroiled Oysters, which were served immediately with amazing bread.  My husband had the Jambalaya and I the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits. Let me tell you, the Ragu that comes with the Gouda Grits was the start of the show! The shrimp and Jambalaya were great but, the Ragu & Grits... Oh boy! With the bread!!! Yes!!! I liked it can you tell? No dessert for us but we'll be back for sure.  Service was friendly and fast, maybe even a bit too fast. Dinner was served before we could finish our drinks. We may have even had two even given the chance. We were in and out in 40 minutes. Great if you're in a rush but we were not.

5FssVLrGiVt3QVpMBKiP3w.text: Horrible services!  Sat in a table for 15 minutes and ZERO services.  Not even a glass of water.  The restaurant was not even busy, 3 tables were occupied.

N__uXKMOLKMkMHc71Z5alA.text: We had the Catfish and grits that everyone is raving about.  What the heck?  A plate full of grease! If that's their best effort- pass. There's other NOLA cuisine restaurants that are much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate full of grease anyone?

BPkBtIu-XV2VgGJKSLJcYg.text: total slop garbage, but nice and quick staff. good employees horrible bland hospital food. we wasted about $200.00 that we couldn't consume nor finish.   never again....no seasoning at all.... Not one Creole, Black, or country cook in the kitchen either.

4dz6FLSZ03DCpMqAwIOvtQ.text: Great food! Last night participated in the wines du jour! Got to sample the Oysters! The grits with shrimp ! Well just look at my pictures they are as yummy as the food! Met Owner/chef Lola and she is very aware of what everyone was doing! Great chef will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Kincaid and chef Lola!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters !!!!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing grits and shrimp!

sSCeVn4bye_9YmLP2qfBLQ.text: I always get either the shrimp & grits or the catfish and grits and also the gumbo is great! If you like po'boys are great too! Love this place

R1Qkz-Eg3Enu9SkiMRxqRw.text: Nice local spot with good food - unpretentious and reasonable. Little bit of New Orleans in Summerlin. Nice staff - Angela provided excellent service above and beyond.

z2dq9-gPjCxgYy6vBYiAag.text: Food was good. But what was better was the service. I told the waiter about my shell fish allergy and he changed from their standard bread because it's heated on the same grill as their shellfish is cooked. Kudos. Good lookin out! Again, food was tasty as you would expect.

9eLhfuODL8Dj8jH8XpiACQ.text: I love it here. They allow me to tweak a dish. . Swapping the rice for gouda grits. And the house dressing is wonderful.

k2rU5I9S8Pl1AFVYO4aBXA.text: Great ambiance. The food was quite tasty but the portion size, for the price, is ridiculous. Had the BBQ shrimp, 5 tiny shrimp for $17.99 and the craw puppies, so yummy but only 4 and the size no bigger than an olive. Left wanting more but not willing to pay for it.

dEMvUJDUoIjbknXGO-na7w.text: The host just sits at the door with a sour face, she did not greet or smile. After being seated I ordered the gumbo and potato salad. The gumbo was good and very spicy. The waitress was terrible, no personality, not attentive, and not at all helpful. I never got my potato salad and never got a refill on my water. The food I did receive was good but I won't be back. That was some of the worst service I've ever had.

gL7lU6B_oOI8BOIITgCIfw.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I got the Jambalaya and thought it was very good. The indoor atmosphere is really nice as well as the outside space. Highly recommend.

GtpBk9RvSG-LglaHCfKp0w.text: This is my favorite place to eat in all of Las Vegas. I LIVE for these shrimp and grits. The servers have always been quick and polite. I recently moved out of town and whenever I come back to visit I make it a point to come here.

kfFSdITPazFhTxdL0uHXgA.text: I'm giving 5 stars because of the food and one particular server my husband and I had lunch there on Monday we come here all the time because of the awesome food but my experience on Monday made me write this review our server and runner and boss boy was a delightful young man named Danny kind respectful and cheerful which was a wonderful change from before thank you Danny for making our lunch special

RGYyl1vxL5AmQ19V42PCfw.text: Delicious! I didn't know there was a second location for the longest time. Went on a Sunday evening, and was not packed. Service was a bit slow but they may have been short staffed. I tried a cup of the gumbo, which was wonderful. For entree, I tried the Shrimp/Crawfish Etouffee; all cooked well and so flavorful! From my family, I heard that the Salmon Fettuccine Alfredo, Barbecue Shrimp, and Shrimp and Grits, were also delicious. Bread pudding for dessert was the best I've had in a while! Will be back

eK_d2eF3sp1b0kOUxRwrFA.text: Great meal tonight! I just love those Gouda grits with the mushroom ragout! The crab cake and catfish were delicious too! Sazerac was the best we've had lately! As always, it's nice to see a restaurant owner working her business and visiting with guests. Thanks Lola and staff!

phs2z6L6i1zjYENHOf3MRQ.text: Terrible wait time...food came out at sporadic times. One person in our party didn't get her food until we were almost done eating.  Shrimp was too tough to eat. Green beans tasted sour. Had to ask for bread, we didn't get the status of the wait time...it took 20 minutes to take our order an hour to get food after. They brought out a wrong side, said would get the correct one never came out. After 2 hours we just needed to get out of there. Longest lunch ever

AOmrzD-6OMuJ15duL7G5Xg.text: Amazing service... hostess Chandler, server Alex. ZD Pinot was so smooth.  Shrimp and grits YUM! The bread pudding was fabulous!  Live music very  talented.  Great night

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my gosh the shrimp and grits is amazing

IQEy4iQx_T7XCtU2DR7P1Q.text: Went there for lunch today for the first time and had the gumbo, while my colleague has the jambalaya.  The food and service were both outstanding, and while we were never rushed, we were in and out in less than an hour.  The atmosphere was comfortable and the prices quite reasonable --very nice for a business lunch.  I'm looking forward to going for dinner.

j--k2eJL_OyJnG1OJ2RX3w.text: This is such a gem!  Its nice to get a reasonably priced little piece of NOLA in LV!  The staff is friendly and the food is very flavorful!

VABnpJvfxgvJfOfJONlKaw.text: Great food and good service. The bronzed shrimp and grits was awesome along with the bread for dredging in the delicious mushroom ragu. Definitely going back to try more of the menu.

9-FSYw4dcfVWxK714oBaYw.text: I had high hopes for Lola's but came away disappointed. I had been craving grilled oysters for weeks, and headed to Lola's to indulge. I went during happy hour and took advantage of their discounted menu, opting for fried crawfish tails and grilled oysters. Sadly, the oysters weren't discounted. The fried crawfish tails were lackluster at best, tasting mostly of fried breading and something vaguely fishy. On par with your average fried shrimp from any fast food place. The grilled oysters that I had been craving were just as bad. They were tiny and overwhelmed by the garlic butter. For $25, I came away hungry and disappointed. I won't be making that mistake again.

RyqPH5JfvQsyqu7lAEchXQ.text: The Summerlin location is only about 3 minutes from our house, but for some reason we kept forgetting it was there.  We finally went for the first time about 4 months ago, and now we can't stop!  My go to dish is the BBQ shrimp with the gouda grits instead of rice, lots and lots of their light and fluffy garlic bread for soaking up the sauce, and a crab cake that is pan fried to perfection and isn't overwhelmed with bread crumbs or other useless fillers.  Just crab crab crab.  Yum-mee.  There's a great bar area for watching the games, lovely indoor dining and perfectly accommodated outdoor seating.  I really could eat here twice a week, although I'm sure my thighs wouldn't love me for it.  The menu has so many amazing looking dishes, and I know I should venture outside of my regular order but it's just so danged good!  But my hubs has had the gumbo on several occasions and raves about it, and our kids love the various po' boy sandwiches and soft shell crab.  Really, there isn't one thing I see on the menu that you could go wrong with.  So glad we finally ventured into Lola's.

m_DsWVuJQb1WnHM9VIgxOA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!!!  Service needs to improve slightly but the food makes up for it. Sunday brunch is not as extensive as the regular menu but still offers many selections.

g8VZJORfxNCQ0pHiopmpxg.text: Service and food choices in the bar were great.  Last time on the patio the food was not the best.  Service was very slow and server was rude.  If I can't eat at the bar I probably wont eat there again.

HNRt0laiJmfKvM3bBUVqYA.text: My husband and I drove to Vegas strip for the weekend and wanted to venture outside to find beignets.. WOW! this place is outstanding!!!! Best meal we have had! My husband lived in Lousiana for a few years and knows good southern food, even he was impressed! We even ordered a few plates to go.. hehe!

ZILR-d71Pb885veYOfcZuw.text: Good food - friendly service     The Cajun food was delicious.     The restaurant staff was attentive and the food was sooooo good

QrZiArqImUL3zreJXKGYoA.text: We have been a fan of Lola's since she opened her first place, and we always told everyone we knew they had to eat there. The food has always been excellent. The problem was that the charleston location is kinda small, and we are impulsive eaters. We rarely make reservations, and once she started getting busy they started requiring reservations. However, I don't think they ever handled reserving tables correctly, which discouraged us from going there as often. For us being comfortable is important to the enjoyment of the meal. There was more than one occasion we were told they only had the small, crowded bar table available. Even though the entire time we ate there were at least 5 tables that sat empty.  We were excited when Lola told us about her new location, it was near us and bigger, she assured us we wouldn't have these problems there. It turns out even in this larger place we have the same problems. We went in on a Saturday, we were asked if we had a reservation, we didn't. We were told it would it be 10-15 mins. We looked around they had about 10 open tables, so we asked not to be seated at one of their awkwardly long two tops, no problem. 40 mins later we were taken right past three regular sized tables to one of those two tops. When we asked for a different table the hostess hemmed and hawed, but then took us to one of the other tables. We were seated for about two minutes when the other hostess came over and told us we couldn't sit there. When asked why she said they like to reserve that table for people with disabilities, we apologized and said we didn't realize someone with a disability was waiting. She replied there wasn't anyone with a disability coming in. OK. So we pointed to another table in the back of the room, to which she replied, "no you can't sit there either." When pressed she refused to give a reason.  Like I stated earlier, for us being comfortable is as important as the food being good. If I am going to spend my money on a meal I want to enjoy it, and there are plenty of restaurants that want my money, and will treat me accordingly. This wasn't the first time the hostesses were less than polite. And we had mentioned it to Lola, which can only mean it is her policy.   Needless to say not only will we not be coming back, we won't be recommending it anymore.

8YcMGQ67-OLTNofeOtxLtw.text: Absolutely delicious!! Hubby and I wanted to try some place new, so happy we chose Lola's!!! We got the crab and artichoke dip, so delish..lots of chunks of crab meat and it came at piping hot. For our main course, I ordered the grits and shrimp dish, literally, my eyes were rolling back the whole time! It was heaven, seriously!! Hubby had the shrimp po boy and he was in love, I tried it also and it was definitely the best I've ever had. We also split a piece of fried catfish. The catfish was huge!! Very meaty, but not seasoned well in our opinion. We saved room for desert, wish we wouldn't have. The bread pudding was nothing to write home about but hey. Overall, the decor, service, and food was impeccable!! Our bill was $61 a bit pricey but worth every penny! A must try!

oYPs27eBUZitKROPrUhzTg.text: Very disappointing.   We read from previous reviews that the service was questionable.   Well that was True.  Waitress approached us 10 minutes after being seated.   The beverage menu was presented in a vanilla folder with stains on the pages.   When my wife asked for a glass with her beer, the response was we don't have any clean glasses but I will do what I can to find you one.   A clean glass was delivered several minutes later.  About 30 minutes after sitting, we had not yet received any food, so the waitress asked if we wanted some bread to tide us over.   When dinner was finally served, 5 of the 6 people in our party expressed how salty (I mean way over salted) the food was.  Lola came out to our table to ask how the food was and we told her ... salty, very salty.   Besides having slow service, the wait staff seemed confused as if they were out of sync.   Sorry but I will not be going back, too many things went wrong and the food quality was only OK.

mfdvYwoS3ops2ThXnKUYXA.text: If I could have given them 0 stars I would have. Staff is good but the food on the other hand is TERRIBLE! It's 60 degrees outside and they don't have the heat on for 1! 2nd the gumbo isn't made fresh it sits in a pot all day so if u get here at the end of the day your getting Luke warm gumbo! YUCK! This isn't how Louisiana food tastes at all please take a trip down south and come back and get it together!

Ro0ALiuO0ELCmtMC6Txffw.text: the food is comparable to the Charleston location.  it's ok.  the ambiance is pretty lame.  finally, I realize they just opened but their staff is laughably untrained.  fixable problems but I don't think service and decor are priorities for lola.

ZzaE1J0-sSIeSwWYgBE_NA.text: Lola's was recommended to me by a fellow coworker and I'm glad I took their advice! The prices are great and the food is authentic Louisiana style. I had the po' boy that was featured on Diners drive ins and Drives and loved it! Getting the New Orleans style bread pudding is also a must with the cream on top! The decor of the place gives it that New Orleans feel and the music was perfect. The staff was really nice!

bLZegwgtC15y32UM49sU_w.text: All I can say is AMAZING, The staff greeted you right when you walked in. When we sat down the order was very easy to read. The waitress was very pleasant and very nice. The building and set up is so cute very southern. I love this place in the area is great. It's right next to Summerlin. Once we order we were so excited, we're going to New Orleans this summer so coming here was a must. My friend ordered gumbo my other friend ordered red beans and rice and I ordered fettuccine with chicken. First off I want to say that the chicken was so well cooked and seasoned I wanted more. They brought out bread and it was delicious. We all decided to split out the males because they're very big in proportion. I had a little bit of theirs and I might add on that I'm not a big fan of a lot of brown spices. So I wasn't really able to enjoy their dish but I did love mine. I do recommend this place to anyone that wants a little southern food in their life.

mb-rG4l-MBSSPx-xXWmAdA.text: Went here last night and was extremely pleased. Worked and lived around New Orleans for over 15 years and found Lola's new location to be as good as top eateries in The Big Easy. Atmosphere and service were excellent   Bronzed shrimp with grits was delicious, just the right amount of spice and consistency.

PDUndY-ZQDRpmc2xH01daQ.text: Sat on the patio which was lovely. We had the bronzed shrimp po'boy and the roast beef D'Brees po'boy. Both were fantastic, but the brown gravy on the roast beef had a slightly peppery heat that was just spectacular. Server Liz was first rate.

nx9BuRGYupkBcU8s9XNa1Q.text: Friends had eaten at Lola's a few days ago, loved it and took us back last night.  They were right - Lola's is a great find in Summerlin.  Friendly staff in a family environment.  Lola was there, visiting each table.  The food was great and I had noticed that some of the produce is grown near the entrance to the restaurant.  Try to save room for dessert - I can see why Lola's Famous Bread Pudding is famous!

jL1J3xy3zt6udNc9V5L2IQ.text: Something's Missing.....  Was excited to try this place as it is near home and somthing different from the chain restaurants.  We went in around 5:30 PM on Saturday night.  It did not appear very busy, with only one other party in the "main" dining room, a few full tables on the patio and some guests at the bar.  Nice re-decorating of the old Ruby Tuesday's.  The hostess walked us right by 10 or so four tops to a small two top -  (we are not small people).   I asked to be seated at one of the larger tables and was told, they were all reserved.  When I said: "Oh, really??" while looking at the lobby and the room, she said OK, I guess I can make adjustments.  Please note that during our hour plus time there, only 4-5 other parties came in....did ALL those reservations cancel?  Our waitress did arrive quickly, and took our drink order ( just water).  My husband ordered the fried catffish platter and paid for the upgraded sides of grits and red beans and rice. I ordered the Roast Beef Du Bres sandwich with just the gravy.  While waiting my husband asked me ift we get rolls or bread, and I said I guess not?  It took some time for the order to arrive.  Hubby loved the catfish and the grits, but the portions were a bit small for the price.  My sandwich was disappointing.  It really had a bitter flavor and the gravy was lumpy.  It was like a pulled pot roast with no seasoning.  I guess all of the other mayo, mustard, etc. might make it better, but I always have my sandwiches/burgers plain - I can really taste the quality of the meat that way.  I got the fries as my side, they were luke warm and a bit limp. So I won't order this dish again, sorry Triple D - not as good as I thought it would be.   We decided to try the desserts which we rarely order dining out as we are usually way too full.  We  had the sweet potato pie and the bananas foster bread pudding.  It took about 15 minutes for it to arrive and both were disappointing.  The pie was hot with way too many pecans on top - it was flat and stringing, couldn't taste the crust.  We both had a couple of bites and then left it.  The menu did not state it was served warm - would not have ordered it.  The best thing about the bread pudding was the ice cream and brown sugar topping - I would order that alone. The three pieces of banana were hard and the bread pudding was more like a piece of stale banana bread and pretty bland.   While eating we noticed all of the other tables were brought a bread basket, some even before they ordered.   Earlier I had asked our waitress for future reference if we had to order bread or did it come with the meal?  She said, it came with "soupy dishes, like the gumbo".  OK, so  why did others with just sandwiches and those who hadn't even ordered gotten bread baskets?  ( I also noticed other reviewers raved about the bread that was brought out right when they sat down.)  I know this seems like I am making a big deal out of it, but I think she just forgot to bring it- why not say so and offer it?  Between this and the hostess, it seemed like a lot of excuses, making the customer feel like they are asking for too much??? The tab was $50 for a meal and a sandwich and two desserts.  The one big thing missing was the "hospitality" piece that makes guests want to return.  Funny, that we found this Friday night at another new spot we tried - they acted like they really wanted us to be there and come back. We will try Lola's again, as I know any can all have an off day - and hubby loved the catfish.  Maybe this time, the "missing" pieces ( seating, bread, seasonings, hospitality) will be in place!  I really hope so, as I WANT to like this spot.

EctWcqrkfZwplT45lGKVew.text: This review is based on my visit on Mardi Gras. It is a very busy night. So I was expecting the restaurant to handle this day better. They are so behind on reservations. We were seated in the courtyard, but it was also raining slightly that night. So when it started to sprinkle, we asked our server how long it will take to get a to go order. He said 10 minutes. I'm writing this review and so far we've been waiting almost a half hour for our order. I'm sure the wait will just be as long if we will be eating here. May I suggest the restaurant invest in some covering for their courtyard.   Also maybe they should invest on some pagers. The only bright thing about this is our server who was really nice. And knowing that I'll have my crawfish when I get home.  Ok, we took our order home, and this is what's in it:

FxLVRmk31Zq_-33B9A9SoA.text: Very strange experience.  Here is a following chronological list of things I liked, and things of which I was not too fond:  Likes: -The exterior of the building is lovely -There is a vegetable and herb garden near the entrance  -They have Louisiana Hot Sauce (thank God) -One of the waitresses switched out the uncomfortable prison chairs for vastly superior, sittable chairs  -They have Fiji water -The staff is pleasant  -The Gouda grits with the mushroom ragout & andouille is delicious  -The bread pudding is magnificent   Not so Fonds: -The interior is painfully dark -The chairs were either purchased from IKEA or are a prison surplus donation -The default water option tasted like I was shotgunning a public bathroom faucet  -Upon ordering the hot crab and artichoke dip, the bread that accompanied the dish came to the table early and was cold by the time the hot dip arrived  -The crab dip had an unpleasant, burned fishy smell.  The taste was fine if you didn't breathe while eating it.  -The portion sizes are not proportionate to the cost per item  -The seasoning on the fried catfish was very interpretive.  We didn't get it.   -Upon asking for a spoon, the waiter set the bare spoon directly on the table instead of placing it on a clean surface  -I can literally still smell the dip as I sit here writing this and I'm honestly screaming internally   May be back, may not.  Again, very strange experience.

pgra94VdRGoiApb5idwz-A.text: The food and service were excellent. The menu was large enough to be interesting but not overwhelming. I choose the Shrimp Salad Remoulade and I chose well. My friend ordered the ham and cheese Po' Boy with potato salad and enjoyed it immensely. I highly recommend it and we will be back.

fxmc4IUKewCMdEoIMt5-8g.text: I can NOT say enough about this place!!!! A few years ago my husband and I went to "Nawlins" (New Orleans) and fell head over heels in love with the cuisine. We've been craving the charbroiled oysters that we got from the amazing and wonderful Felix's restaurant in New Orleans and we found that same wonderful deliciousness here in Las Vegas at Lola's!!!!!! While we were there I made plans to go back! Yes not even out of the building making plans for the next time! The ambiance was great! I hate being cold when I eat (forgot my sweater that I usually have to take to restaurants) and didn't even need it because the temperature in there was great as well! Lola's was the icing on an already great birthday.

pdDnyKlklKsP9gAO2oFL0w.text: My first time visit here. With the raving reviews I gotta try. What did I order? Crab puppies which are surprisingly spicy but tasty. Then I got the shrimp and grits and catfish plate. I would say, the cheesy grits and shrimp became the star on my plate. The sausage and catfish not so much. There's plenty of spices mixed up with this meal so if you are not into spices or if you are prone to heart burn, avoid ordering this. The best part of our visit were two things: the banana pudding with burnt marshmallow frosting on top and our very attentive server. He had a long hair. He was thoughtful enough to get me an extra bowl of grits for my son since the plate with the spice has some kick to it. Make sense why locals and tourists come to check this place out. I would come back for another set of meal for sure.

bwnBIySpVPwsSv5dENUX0g.text: ...it wasn't NOLA...the chargrilled oysters were small and over cooked. The crab cakes were mushy...didn't eat them. It was just ok.

g1O0L0ONfhWfZwl_Y9kiAQ.text: Good food but it was too expensive for lunch pricing.  I've noticed the crowd get smaller.  This may be why.   Good service.  I've always liked the staff.   It's the week of Mateo Gras and I expected so much more.  Disappointing yet good food.

3PdZQN5uQ7RtbDptrlRCOA.text: In the mood for creole? This place isn't bad although I haven't had the real deal so I have nothing to compare it to. I do want to go back for their dessert I got too full last time I went.  I hear the banana fosters bread pudding is great! I'll have to see for myself

MC_BtPb8yZZdQJ106izkCg.text: I am a native New Orleanian. This place serves authentic Cajun/creole cuisine. I had the Tchoupitoulas and the gumbo. A generous, light, crispy fried catfish filet atop a equally generous portion of crawfish etouffee. I felt like I was eating in Louisiana! Our waiter Daniel grew up in New Orleans and we shared stories of our favorite about the city. Wonderful and delicious experience. You owe yourself a visit.

P8dxsP-JDhgqwlTlcX6HeQ.text: First time visiting Lola's. Vibe is ok. Pre meal: we ordered the crawfish cakes. For entree: We ordered the BBQ Shrimp and Grilled chicken breast w/ baked sweet potato & salad.   Food is FULL of flavor but lacks in full portion size for the cost. Crawfish cakes were 4 pieces about the size of large gum balls. BBQ shrimp had 5shrimp and needed more rice to go with the amount of sauce on my plate. Grilled Chicken dinner was also. Bit on the small size. We ordered extra garlic bread (which is also very good) to fill us up.  Bill was about 52 bucks

7htanrJFGseQbzz7Lph6Cg.text: Incredible Authentic Louisiana Food Delicious  Our party of 4 Loved everything  I ate the trio sampler of Red Beans and rice,Etouffee and Jambalaya Yum  We also had Po Boys  And even the Fetuccini Alfredo with Blackened Salmon was Loved  Our server Shawna was a delight  Highly recommended location larger than the original

eEss5KMbG06ukDuoRCJ0Ww.text: When I walked into the restaurant I felt like I was in a quaint restaurant in New Orleans. It was decorated so cute! They had a piano player performing so we decided to sit in the bar area. My best friend ordered blackened catfish and grits. I ordered red beans and rice (classics to see how well they executed). The catfish and grits were perfect in every single way. The flavor was on point and the Gouda grits were delicious. My red beans and rice were really good too. The andouille sausages were hittin. It wasn't quite as good as directly from New Orleans, but it definitely kicked our Cajun craving. We will most certainly be back.

We took my father in law who is from Louisiana and he wanted everything from the menu and literally scarfed everything down and got more to go! Randal was our server and literally was the most attentive and best server I've had at any restaurant! I definitely will be coming back here every time I visit Las Vegas!

Our waitress was just the sweetest helping us with our questions and helping my boyfriend find alternatives to his non spicy palette. The food was great had tons of flavor and spice for me. If your a spice lover definitely check them out.

AJvjE1jCKI27jumOvZTmOQ.text: Since moving from the New Orleans area to the inland northwest, I've been acutely aware that you just can't get good food "around here". So when a business trip brought me to Las Vegas, I was excited to see if this innovative city could produce some authentic creole cuisine.  Service: the hostess was a little bit dry, but everyone else was very friendly and attentive.  Ambience: nice, calm at 11:30am, fleur de lis and other New Orleans inspired decor all around.   We ordered the catfish and shrimp platter with softshell crab with coleslaw and sweet potato fries on the side, along with a cup of gumbo and crawpuppies as appetizers. The waiter assured us that most of their seafood is sourced from the New Orleans area. When the food arrived, I found that the fry batter wasn't particularly flavorful and the catfish was watery. The crawpuppies were good with remoulade sauce, but it would have been nice to see plain hush puppies on the menu. The gumbo was decent, but not as complex as other gumbo I've had in New Orleans. Halfway through the meal, we were brought a crab cake, which had a wonderful crab flavor and was one of the highlights of the meal, along with the sweetened iced tea - no gritty sugar packet required.   Overall, this is a nice place to eat, but the food is not the best New Orleans style cuisine you'll ever have.

Uu9ayYbGjZvSlScMiiVduA.text: So this place is incredible. If you love to sit outside it is a great place to go... Not during the summer month. During the summer months the interior is just as fun. They have a very lively bar with fun drink combinations. A grand piano with music almost every night. All different kinds of music. It has a very New Orleans feel obviously from the name LOL. The food is absolutely stunning. It is the best New Orleans inspired food I have had outside of New Orleans and that includes the Orleans Casino. I love everything on the menu however I could wallow in a tub full of their Gouda grits. The staff are always very professional they're happy hour is between three and six. The menu is decently priced but the happy hour makes it even more worthwhile. This place can be as intimate or is boisterous as one would want. I love the spot it's just around the corner from my house :-) I will be back.

qj_7AQnJSLikXDviRA4XPw.text: Really good Cajun food!!  By far the 2 best things we ordered was the Red Beans & rice as well as the grilled oysters!  I really wanted raw oysters as I'm not really a fan of oysters any other way but these were delicious.  We ordered 6 and wished we had gotten 12! Yum!!  Had the catfish po boy which was good but nothing mind blowing.    I like that Lola's offers all the Abita brews!!   Man I can't stop thinking about those oysters that I almost forgot to mention that the fire grilled garlic bread is also to die for! The bread is so light and airy!  We had the bananas foster bread pudding and the regular bread pudding.  Both were delicious.    Servers were great!  Yes, I'll be back to watch a Golden Knights match with a couple Abita brews!

a6ZrpBmpobWmpC7hsSSI8g.text: Great happy hour menu. We had Cajun nachos with blackened chicken, Tiger dip and poppers. Only complaint was the house white wine was a Chardonnay that had a weird chemical aftertaste. Ordered the Lohr Sauv Blanc which was fine. Service great.

JLJ9QrGcy_tvU6G8RnkOeg.text: Lola's Gouda grits and fried catfish filet.....I get both as sides ....are the best thing north of Louisiana . The catfish is crisp, sweet, and not at all greasy. Red beans and rice are also excellent.  It's always hard to decide

5buwfKOOkoMwA3VzHL9qdg.text: Bronzed Catfish & Grits, Crab Cake, French Bread, Southern Hospitali Tea, Shot of Tequila w/pineapple juice back aka #Lunch  I treat myself to lunch at a new spot at least twice a month & today Lola stole my heart..

EeIYuapIXgnU-VFzTlxR1w.text: One word, AMAZING!   Christine W. and I were meeting up for dinner and decided on Lola's after reading the reviews. We made a reservation just to be on the safe side but when we walked in the place was virtually empty, we were seated in a matter of seconds so that was great.  Items Ordered: Gumbo ($4.79) Bronzed Shrimp and Grits ($16.99) Bananas Foster ($7.99)  I started off with a cup of gumbo, it was very thick, hearty, and flavorful with a good amount of chicken, sausage, and shrimp. After finishing the gumbo I moved on to the shrimp and grits,it is definitely a must try, I really enjoyed it. I'm not a huge fan of grits but they really do know how to make them right here, they tasted like gritty mashed potatoes with cheese. We ended our meals with the bananas foster which was good but too bitter for my liking.   I can't wait for my next visit to Lola's. The food was great, the staff was very courteous, and our waitress was attentive and helpful. I think Lola's is as good as it gets in Las Vegas for cajun/creole food.

The have have Sunday brunch with a some yummy bottomless cocktails. Definitely recommend this place if you want awesome Louisiana yummy ness. Oh a don't forget your Mardi Grais mask .

QmQYgzq2FpPcKIcLcbJcxw.text: More like 3.75 stars. Really good, authentic tasting food and good service and ambiance.. Only problem was that we were still hungry after an appetizer, (don't get the hush puppies, they are so tiny..) entrees AND dessert! Bump up the portion sizes a bit and we will return! Cheers

C5lAqduAM2npCaZGNpSE6Q.text: Lola's never disappoints. We went there for our anniversary dinner and had a great meal...again. We had the crab cake and hush puppies to start.  The bronzed catfish with grits for me and the bronzed shrimp and grits for the wife. Had a couple of cocktails which were really good. The sazerac was really smooth. We ended the dinner with banana pudding and bananas foster bread pudding. We are stuffed. So glad there's one closer to us now. It'll go into the "local" rotation.

nLIYXHCROTkEgKACtDKSYQ.text: Tonight's visit to Lola's was a double event-my first and last.  A lovely venue, well appointed, with ambiance & attentive staff but the food was disappointing. The taste was not authentic New Orleans flavor-highly seasoned with heat & salt did not quench my anticipation of the savory blends of seasonings known in NOLA cuisine. Soft shell crab PO-Boy was cooked to perfection although lacked the "full-dressed" experience. Nice quality of French bread just needed that extra touch of remoulade sauce. The jambalaya was another disappointment. Overly seasoned tomato-drenched rice with a few shrimp & cut smoke sausage resting on top is not jambalaya. Cheesecake Factory or The Grand Lux have a much better product with a more generous portion with a similar price point and neither boast of being a Louisiana restaurant. A visit to either one or both would  be beneficial to help tweak your recipe. The live music was on point & augmented the inviting atmosphere. We don't drink but others in our party said your mixed drinks were tasty! Lastly, we spent good $$$ to come home hungry.

2ZDmhQ3BWHcsQHvJjCS4Fw.text: Amazing! We had a fabulous date night there. The bartender was extremely helpful and made a perfect cocktail recommendation for my wife. Additionally, the ambiance made for a perfect date night with a talented piano player who put a personal spin on pop culture. To top it off, their Cajun dishes had all the right spices and portion sizes. We enjoyed the crab cake appetizer and then the shrimp & grits and red beans & rice. I cannot wait to go back! Well done Lola's!

tQCADa94Wtwjm0MczmdaPQ.text: I think i love the Summerlin location  the best (buy both are great) Summerlin's location is a biy more spacious,  good is a bit more spicy, and yhe atmosphere is js awesome.

9bNYTXHOWBriBLl6hRdK-g.text: Delicious.  Had a really good time,  pleasant experience,  great customer service and environment.  Had the mamas red beans and rice,  crab cakes,  grits and bread pudding banana souffle. All were very good. We all enjoyed our meals, no complaints what so ever.  Definitely check out if you can.

1j_7yKUn27oWCSypVXlq_w.text: Cute place to have brunch or if you just want some good cajun/creole food.  Southern charm decor as it should be.  Lola's is its own separate house, and there's plenty of seating.  Southern creole is one of my favorites.  Looks like there's a good menu here for brunch, but I was really craving for some Crawfish Etouffe.   I got some craw puppies to start.  They weren't kidding when they said craw puppies: 4 very small pieces of hush/craw puppies.  Very tasty, but I don't think the 4 is shareable, unless your party of 4 doesn't mind having just 1...tiny...craw puppy.    Then came the crawfish etouffe, served on a big hot plate.  Since I was served with a huge portion of this, I took it home to go.. Typically, I don't do leftovers, but the flavor was so delightful, that I had it for lunch the next day.     Between the Summerlin location and the downtown location, I would go back to the Summerlin location for better parking and bigger space.

lwMtkNPE4weT1x43XN_kbw.text: I really love this place, great food, great location, great service. What more can you ask for ? This is a very classy restaurant, it's an ideal place for a date with that special someone or just a night out for dinner with your friends or family. I highly recommend Lola's to anyone looking for the ultimate dining experience or just some good old southern, creole dishes ... I promise you will not be disappointed.

mB-N9Uv864yjsJEe2UqFsg.text: It's crawfish season!  Lola's get their live crawfish flown in on a Thursday and is ready to be served to customers that day and Friday.  If you are lucky and there is still the supply, you can enjoy it on a Saturday, but don't gamble and just rsvp for a Friday to be safe.  That's what I did, so Earl and I dine here on a Friday.  The price per pound of crawfish is $10.99.  I ordered 2lbs for myself and Earl ordered the catfish plate with garden veggies, sweet potato fries, an gouda grits.  Each lb of crawfish comes with a potato and a corn on a cob.  Since it is still the beginning of the crawfish season, they are still small in size.  So yes, it's more work to peel each one, but the meat is still sweet and full of flavor.  It got a bit salty for me so I had to eat it with a bite of potato/corn on the cob to balance out the saltiness.  I also had the delicious sweet tea with my meal...I had to.  2lb of crawfish was enough for me.    While I was still finishing up my pail of crawfish, Earl ordered the Fig newton with butter pecan ice cream.  I took a bite of his dessert and I halted my consumption of crawfish to ensure I get my share of this delectable dessert.  It was so good!  It's no ordinary fig newton...it was fig newton on steroids!  But that combination with butter pecan ice cream was genius.  After we finished the dessert, I went back to finish my crawfish.  It was a delicious dinner and it satisfied my crawfish cravings.

9pt4CSO-_i-LDEoEhPmzNw.text: I have been eyeing this place for a very long time!   I'm no expert on New Orleans food or anything but I have heard from friends this place is worth a try.   When we walked in for lunch it was empty and so of course we were seated right away. The server we had very nice and friendly. I forgot his name and its killing me!   The place is very clean and uniquely decorated.   My boyfriend and I tried the crabcakes and a cup of gumbo all to share. The crabcakes were tasty with lots of lumps of crab. The gumbo however was very very good! I enjoyed the flavor a lot. They served it with the grilled garlic bread which I liked a lot. I really didn't want to share the gumbo with my bf because I could finish one by myself.   For main dishes, I got the jambalaya and he got the catfish with green beans and potato salad. The jambalaya was really good and lots of andouille sausages which is so yummy!  My bf dos enjoy the catfish and it wasn't fishy at all but we opted to get it pan seared with their Cajun seasoning, and we both agreed we prefer catfish deep fried. The sides we just ok to me nothing to rave about.   The service is excellent, they were constantly tidying up our table of empty plates. The server even gave us sweet teas to go when we were leaving.   Coming back for sure just to try the oysters!

Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish

YyTwx75rXYRacclgdCKpxw.text: Pretty good.  We have always eaten at Lola's on Charleston but they were closed on Mother's Day.  I ordered Gumbo, which was excellent but my dinner was disappointing.  My friend Catfish was watery not crispy as usual.  My husband loved his poor boy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We were here on Mother&#39;s Day but not for brunch.  I have always loved Lola&#39;s on Charleston but was disappointed with my Sunday selection.

HjTzEpLUEKg5T5y2ALi6wg.text: I love the feel of this restaurant and appreciate the Cajun recipe's by Beth. Just walking up to this restaurant is amazing with their wide variety of vegetables and herbs growing outside the restaurant doors.  My favorite item on the menu is the mushroom ragout Gouda Grits. Honestly, I could eat them with any item on the menu. I usually get them with the Bronzed Catfish or the Bronzed Shrimp. People who are not from the South might wince just a little at the thought of having this southern porridge. I know, I understand - I dined with someone who couldn't withhold his grimace that I ordered catfish or grits. In spite of this, I managed to talk him into a bit of my food and won him over on the entire meal combination.   If you have never had grits, it is ground-corn porridge with Native American roots. Beth takes this Southern meal and adds her unique mixture of diverse elements that include mushrooms.  The draw backs of this restaurant are: The hostesses like to cram everyone in a central location unless you request the bar area, as they close down sections of the restaurant seating when it is not a busy day. This is not always a pleasant feeling for guest that would like some quiet time or want to have a conversation. I personally don't like to sit next to overly loud people, yet their central room has a huge family picnic style wooden table that divides this central dining room. It glows with lights from above and is usually occupied by a large party/family that have to yell to be heard from one end of the table to the other. When, I asked to be moved to another location when seated near this table - I was told the other room was closed. This did not make me happy. Thankfully, I was quickly accommodated by my amazing server Aaron. Good save.  The restaurant also charges a "split plate fee" of $5.00, which is tacky. I understand the business end and reasoning, but it's tacky to read on a menu and personally not a good way to win over a newbie customer. Thankfully, I didn't see that before enjoying a couple meals at Lola's.  With that said, you must try their Fig Delight for dessert and fresh brewed sweet tea with your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed Catfish and Grits
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed Shrimp and Grits

4HKYaP2ES8zcG3o4eauEqw.text: We have been to both of Lola's locations.  This visit was to the one in Summerlin.  We had an exquisite dinner.  The food was absolutely luscious and the ambiance was wonderful.  They also had a live combo singing and playing in the bar which was very good.  We actually stopped to listen and sing with them on the way out.  We highly recommend this restaurant so if you're looking for a great place for dinner that's not your ordinary dinner fare (unless you live in Louisiana), this is the place for you!!

2ARsilEc7rmko-c8x7a1UA.text: Love this restaurant! We usually dine in for dinner. Our usuals are definitely the Bronzed Catfish & Gouda grits and the Bronzed Shrimp. I would advice not to order any gumbo as, both dishes are served with it as as. First off, the grits are amazing! If you love cheese you'll get a cheesy bonus as these grits are made w/Gouda cheese! The catfish is great not too much of a fishy flavor just the right amount of seasoning. The shrimp is grilled perfectly not over cooked.  For appetizers we ordered the pull n peel shrimp basically shrimp cocktail. They were huge and super juicy! We also ordered the Crawpuppies. They were amazing, just like mini crab cakes. For dessert we had the sweet potato beignets. Baked to a perfection sprinkled w/powdered sugar. This place is one of my top favorite restaurants. If you're looking for a taste of Cajun this is definitely the place!
