c3bbh6VIM_8n5_bmiqfTrw.text: Went here for the first time. Love the atmosphere. Clean, fun and has a cute outdoor patio. The food was flavorful and great service.

1umTLQ1Dge_6aRksxgiSng.text: Very nice place. My husband and I are visiting from Southern California and we love Cajun food. This place has a nice variety of menu items and really good food. We came for lunch. The service was great and food was awesome. I got bronze shrimp and grits and my husband got bronze cat fish and grits. We finished with bread pudding and chickory coffee. We have reservations for a fancy dinner at Cesar's palace tomorrow but I think we might come back here instead.

1MwV3OiXooYsr0wEV6IOfw.text: It was my girlfriends birthday, and I wanted to take her there. Overall it was a poor experience. When I made the reservation I noted that we were coming for her birthday. When we arrived I mentioned to the hostess that it was her birthday, and she said "Make sure you order dessert." We sat down and ordered drinks, were told they would be right up. The waiter was working on 2 other tables before he went to make the drinks. They finally showed up and we ordered. The char grilled oysters were extremely small. Not even worth ordering. We were told by the waiter our food would be up 5-10 minutes. He told us that 3 times. Really? I ordered the bread pudding for dessert. No candle, no whipped cream. The waiter came back later and apologized for not knowing that it was her birthday. $100 dinner and they charged for the dessert. we were both really disappointed with the entire experience. Won't be going back.

b14PRY24i4WrGV11QJwGqA.text: Being a southerner I was really looking forward to my first visit. The space, atmosphere and servers were great.  The food was hit and miss. The Bronzed Shrimp & Grits were very good. A nice mix of spice in the ragu and shrimp against the richness of the grits.  The Shrimp Po' Boy was okay but too salty. The Oyster Po' Boy was inedible because the oysters tasted so strong ( as in boardering on being spoiled). Fries were delicious.

g35oU07ogGGo8UM6TsjJpQ.text: Honestly love it here. I need gluten free options, and this place delivers! The chicken platter with sweet potato fries and green beans gives me serious cravings. The atmosphere seems really fancy with a strong New Orleans jazz theme in the entrance/bar area/adult seating area, but the family seating section is more casual. It's a real relaxed vibe in this restaurant, so it's perfect for going out casually with friends, but definitely not bad for a nice date.

R-dkUZfXwhK9u3zWCuDw0Q.text: Simply the best Cajon food this side of the Mississippi!  The choices were so good it was difficult to decide what to eat. After the meal we decided this would be one of our go to restaurants.  The food is flavorful, delicious and presented well. Service is fabulous.

wKjiZMPUbx-vJA1AHBovYQ.text: I am not a New Orleans transplant, and I don't know anything about what good cajun/creole is "supposed" to taste like, so all I can do is tell you that the three of us enjoyed what we had. One of the three of us lived in N.O. thirty years ago and he thought the food was pretty good so that might mean something. Garlic bread--plentiful, but not very buttery or garlicky...not really a hit (except it was inexpensive). Catfish PoBoy--I wouldn't eat catfish if you paid me, but my friend with the N.O. background enjoyed it, and my wife sampled the fries and reported them to be good. Shrimp Creole--wife liked it, I didn't try it. Jambalaya (with added shrimp)--I liked it--good amount of meat, and a nice taste with some blackened-like flavor. Mr N.O. tasted it and said it was good, so that might mean something.  The real hit in my book was the dessert. The fig delight was WONDERFUL.The fruity fig taste elevated every bite. That dessert I would confidently and happily recommend to anybody.

oRnJczqZRGxPRZ1pL3gHhw.text: Wow...... and that is NOT in a good way. We attended a birthday dinner for 8 last night. Walked in to pleasant surroundings that are mildly reminiscent of New Orleans. Sadly, that was the last positive thing I have to say about Lola's. The joint was dead at 6:30 which seemed like a big ol' warning sign. But hey...it's almost Christmas so maybe?  Service was friendly but amazingly slowwwwww. I ask the server for suggestions on the menu and he did my big no-no...."EVERYTHING" he says.  Come on dude, there are better items that you can suggest instead of letting a new customer throw out a line hoping they are going to find the big one!  I also wonder if they were trying to emulate their idea of the big easy with this "going in reverse" kind of service. If so, it ain't workin'. Odd that you sit around a dead restaurant twiddling your thumbs with absolutely nothing to nibble on. Oh well....maybe the dinner will make up for this. NOT!  Dinners arrived with absolutely no mapping by the server so the expediter is wandering around the table asking where each (different) dish went. The funniest part of this was that some of the dishes had the wrong sides so nobody knew what was really their dinner. That is where the entertainment ended.   We had a very eclectic array of dishes and NOT one of them was up to par so let me point out the worst of the bad. Crab cakes....They looked so promising. They arrived looking like a crab cake should but when I/we took a bite they were absolutely mush.....not cooked through and not warm all the way through. EEW!  I NEVER send food back but this was a food poisoning in the making. Sure enough....the crab pinched at my queasy stomach all night. The other guests said their crab cakes were mushy but they ate them anyway....... out of shear desperation for food I suppose. Wonder how they did last night? The shrimp on my grits was tiny and tough. My hubby's catfish was mush. Looking around the table, not one thing looked good. In fact, no one said a word out of politeness but it was apparent this was a huge disappointment for everyone. Jeez...eight bad dishes. Well...I guess Lola's is consistent and NOT in a good way.  Almost forgot to mention. We brought a birthday cake and they wanted $1. a slice to cut it. I brought all the equipment, plates etc. so I cut it FOR FREE. God knows a dead restaurant with bad service doesn't want to cut a small cake. To top it off, they served the worst coffee ever. (dessert) I was expecting a lovely blend of chicory and french roast but instead they served a watery substance that they called coffee (thinking swamp water)  in the tiniest cups with no refills. What a joke!!  Commander's Palace....you got nothin' to worry 'bout........and my prediction is Lola's Summerlin will not be around long. My predictions have been spot on so far but I will eat my words if they are a resounding success. BTW... my words are tastier.

1OzlAfGjKsv6HPWvZBrlFA.text: By far the best option for Creole cuisine. My favorite is the Shrimp Charlotte. Ask for Lola when you come. Good chance she is here to visit!

3oddnAMv_9BHqGHBJfqSlA.text: AMAZING food! AMAZING service! Shrimp and grits are to die for! The blackened catfish was so tender and buttery with a lite crisp on the outside. Both locations are fantastic, but the Summerlin location is more mellow while downtown is more the party lolas our server Ashley was the best! We will be asking for her again... love this place!

8vGZHUAmwPLBe9tWWZfYng.text: Love this place!!! Staff is awesome !!! Love Randal !! Food is awesome!!! They have a great variety of cocktails too which is a bonus !!!  Portion sizes are perfect... not sure how people can complain about that.... perhaps supersize ur meal at mcdonalds instead

Qtr9xrgGFd1x22bJDpll0w.text: 1,822 miles north west of the French Quarter of New Orleans, and in the middle of desert mountains might not be where you would expect to find an authentic Cajun-creole meal. That's exactly what they serve up at Lola's of Las Vegas- southern hospitality included.   Once you pass through the the glass doors you are greeted by an ornate fleur-de-lis and drawn in further by the savory aroma of Cajun blackened dishes and distinct creole spices.  Subconsciously you (along with the other patrons patiently waiting for a table) start licking your lips in anticipation.  For those visitors seeking just drinks or don't mind sharing a table, Lola's offers a full bar along with a beer-hall-style long-table immediately upon entry.   For Lola's 2nd location in The greater Las Vegas area the atmosphere and decor modestly highlights some stereotypes of NOLA but doesn't overdue it with kitschy stuff thrown on the walls. Instead, the cuisine is allowed to dominate your experience and memories.   The menu offers a hearty blend of Traditional Cajun dishes and classic creole fare from fried oysters to gumbo to etouffee to jambalaya and beyond. Staying True to The Big Easy; the selection of fish dishes are plenty and how you want your fish prepared keeps Lola's authenticity pure.   For those who seek out new dishes and enjoys discovering flavors this place offers a whole new worlds while keeping you comfortable in knowing familiar choices are ready for plating.   This food doesn't disappoint at all.  Rich in spice, alive with freshness and packed full of authenticity.  This food is so authentic New Orleans my father ( who was born and raised in just outside of NOLA in Bogalusa) became full of nostalgic feelings of his grandmother's cooking as he savored bite after bite. He especially recommends the red beans and I the Etouffee!    The staff is very attentive and offers great descriptions of any dish that you might not be familiar with- without making you feel foolish for asking.  For me, at the end of my meal, my plate was licked clean,  my stomach was full of great foot and my mind full of new knowledge. I'm ready for my next Cajun meal.   Overall, if you're in Vegas looking for something you won't see on Iron Chef and if you want great food that leaves a lasting impression, get your belly to Lola's.  It's a Mardi Gras for your mouth!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool wine racks offer homage to the religious foundations of NOLA
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of several dining room choices. Cool lighting keeps the French quarter realness going.
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple decor keeps you reminded of Mardi Gras without distracting from the smells and fresh food of Lola&#39;s

On9pC53Y4gucIOc5e1fKOw.text: Sooooo good!!!! Found this gem on yelp while in Vegas getting married. Had a good size group show up to meet up and it was delightful! We'll be back next time in town!

upfR1hJqtUSWKGDaTKt6fw.text: Another season of craw fish is upon us and if you haven't had them at Lola's, you're missing out.  They are spicy and perfectly seasoned.  They are never greasy,  as we have seen with other crawfish places in Vegas.  The atmosphere is relaxed and the staff kind,  helpful and fun you be around.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crawfish season is here and Lola&#39;s is the only place in Vegas that does them right. If you haven&#39;t had the pleasure,  you are missing out.

gLesBGo_P5uVm9DZSGbmQg.text: Locally owned and loved, this second location of Lola's is head and shoulders above any other eatery in this food desert location in the north part of Summerlin. The bronzed shrimp and grits is a dish they're known for. It's an excellent dish with five large shrimp atop cheesy and creamy gouda grits with a spicy ragout full of bold flavored andouille sausage and mushrooms. The crab cake platter was decent. Like most other items here, even the crab cakes have some heat. They're pan fried with little filler but also lack the big jumbo lump pieces of crab that make crab cakes meaty.  Desserts are quite good. The signature bananas foster bread pudding is large enough to share. It's a massive brick of custard soaked, creamy bread atop caramelized bananas and covered with a sugary sweet sauce. The sweet potato pecan pie was a balanced display of sweetness with a crust that's thin and flaky.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster bread pudding ($7.99)
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed shrimp and grits ($16.99)
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed shrimp and grits ($16.99)

E31gFt-iu7P3a959eE7k2Q.text: I lived in New Orleans for a while and loved the food culture of the city. After moving to Las Vegas, i was hoping to find a place to get authentic Cajun and a creole food. I was told by several co workers that Lola's was the place to go.  Overall food quality was great. It was probably the closest thing to NOLA that Vegas will offer. My favorite part of the meal was the bread- it is truly authentic New Orleans. The red beans and rice were not as I am used too however they weren't bad. I had a Chicken Po Boy and the chicken was blackened and amazing! The fries were house cut and looked to be twice fried. ( not my preference )  Service was a bit slow due to our server having a 10 top party right after we ordered.  I would go again and you should at least try it for yourself.

y6U01oaJAckmiyShF_DvLA.text: Not great.  Not bad sort of inbetween.  Small portions.

teyXaLSVHsGa6nWIbqrmhA.text: We left the hotel after a quick nap and headed out for a good meal. We were having a rather late dinner-8:45 p.m. We were staying on the Strip and were a little exhausted, suffering from very little sleep and a long commute from Cali. SO, we looked for something tasty and CLOSE to the strip and happened upon Lola's Charleston (outside of downtown) location.   The results were great-my hubby had the Bronzed Shrimp and gouda grits and I had the blackened catfish, homemade fries and greens. My husband raved about his meal and I enjoyed mine too. However, I am a collard green lover, so if you order the greens keep in mind that they are turnip and mustards and you must like those types of greens. HUGE upside-they have peppered vinegar, just like home!    Try this place with an open mind. I will go back to try several other things. Unfortunately, I was too full to try dessert, but the banana's foster looked tasty!!!!   I liked the available parking lot and the ability to eat outside on the cute little patio if you chose.  There were families and couples dining when we arrived and everyone was so friendly. The service was GREAT-thanks Dianna!!!!!  We had assistance from the busboys as well. They scooped our plates up when we were finished (after asking politely if we were finished). As you can see from the empty plate they REALLY did not need to ask my hubby if he was finished! LOL!!!!

hyDl7bP0SX1iZPWNPWySdA.text: Were new to Vegas, part time residents, we are so excited we found this Cajon delight! We ordered the crab cake appetizer, it was amazing! I ordered the bronzed shrimp with the grits and sweet potato fries, all of it was the best Cajon combo I've ever had. My friend ordered the etufie with shrimp and craw fish and rice, also awesome and delicious! We even meey Lola the owner very impressive she cares about her resturant and created the menue and recipes! We will be back! Wish to try the down town location next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes appetizers!
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OPLCHXrFmPxuzeAgtuuwMA.text: Mmm Mmm Mmm!  Came here on a Sunday evening-- glad to know this location remains open versus the one in Downtown which seems to be closed on Sundays.   Made reservations which, while there was a few open tables, it was definitely still busy.  Ordered the following:  -Grilled Garlic Bread (definitely recommend-- the char paired with the garlic and crunch was delicious)  -Appetizer Bowl of Gumbo (enough to share with my husband-- great for warming up your appetite and to get a nice taste of their gumbo without being full for dinner)  -Catfish and Grits (DEELICIOUS!)  -Roast Beef Po'Boy (SO SO GOOD! Might not be your typical fried seafood po-boy but the mix of meat, bread, and dressings was so flavorful. The gravy was the best part-- especially sopping it up with your fries. Can get a little messy but don't be afraid to lick your fingers!)  -Bananas Fosters Bread Pudding (Perfect for sharing-- hearty, warm, and a great ending to the meal)  Generally I can't do spicy (hot sauces, sriracha, etc.) but the way this food is made is a good spice that brings a nice warmth of flavor to your mouth. We will definitely be coming back... hopefully to try their brunch!   Service was awesome also :)

OU8DJ3dvi1AB3-Hc2IiuxQ.text: I took my husband here for his birthday. We were really excited to finally be able to try it since we had heard good reviews. Unfortunately we did not feel the same way. The Gumbo reminded me of the beef gravy you get in a jar at the grocery store with 2 tiny shrimp thrown in. No chicken or sausage to be found.  My husband had the jambalaya with chicken and shrimp. It was mush. There were 3 shrimp and again we were hard pressed to find any chicken. Needless to say we both left without eating very much On a positive my husband did say he really liked their house made whisky and my sweet T was good. My husband is now requesting a do over on his birthday dinner at somewhere he might actually enjoy.

Rg5sNYLjaBW8RwsdTwf1Pg.text: Shared poutine and bean/salsa dip with the hubby, and they were both very good. They use creamy gouda on the poutine, and that adds lots of flavors to the dish.  We had the banana foster bread pudding and creme brulee for desert. The bread pudding is served warm with ice cream, and it's a generous portion. It was delicious! Our friend had the white chocolate bread pudding (seasonal) and loved it.  Overall, great experience. The place is clean, nice decor, and the service provided by Ashley was outstanding.

9qzhpZkn5frcbcGkqdVf-g.text: This place was definitely a disappointment for my wife and I. We went based on the amount of good reviews it had on Yelp, which honestly, I don't understand how based on our experience. They had only one server, which was the only good thing at this restaurant. We ordered the rice and beans, which supposedly had sausage, and we also ordered the chicken breast with coleslaw and potato salad. The rice and beans has 1 piece of sausage as decoration on top, but other than that, there was no more sausage. It was also tasteless! My wife's food was the same. She claimed that the potato salad and coleslaw was full of onions and peppers, but no flavor at all. It took almost 1 hour for us to get our food. There was a couple that came in and waited 20 mins before they got up and left because they were never approached at any point, or even got water. This doesn't mean it was the waitress's fault, that poor lady was even the one making bread! It was the management's fault for not staffing the restaurant properly. Overall, it was a terrible experience for us. We're never going back!

NnCKDn4iB3KSGkPndgVZcA.text: This place is near my job but I never thought to stop by until today. I had a grilled chicken salad which I was kind of concerned with the price being 10.99 but then portion was huge. The salad did not disappoint and the service was equally as good. This may be my new lunch spot.

en1bQH9cjIY0bzap1o_DMg.text: Went there yesterday for dinner with friends. My family is from New Orleans and I was excited when a friend recommend this spot. The ambiance was nice. The food not so much. They advettise lump blue crab cakes on their menu, but they served us salmon croquet. The gumbo was thick, too thick and desperately needed some fi'le. Then the waitresses accidently spilled water on one of our guest wetting him and his bowl of greens. (By the way the vegtables and fish were also bland). Instead of offering compensation they OVERCHANGED him for the meal and explained that complications with their register prevented them from doing a price adjustment. On top of that she took it upon herself to include a 20% gratuity to his bill. The nerve! Needless to say we won't be back and I couldn't in good consciousness recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lola lump blue crab cake...NOT!

OrjWLf7hLZQn5Uvhrhb1lg.text: Awesome Soft Shell Crab! Easy atmosphere. and Comfortable environment.  Plus: Easy parking.  Service was friendly and good the food was so good + so much = no opportunity for dessert. Price was fair and friendly. Menu had numerous appealing options.

WED8XMIoqHJk8YTKyPty9A.text: Amazing food. Shawna was the best waitress ever and friendly.  Made our experience great! New Orleans hospitality at it's finest.

1sLWp6zvKq5uvvZLCyH36Q.text: The service was okay the food was warm I don't know if the food was per made but it's was dam near cold I got shrimp and grits and the flavor was ok really small portions the best thing about Lola's is the food presentation

EF3w0lfLAyNZDtRPagwDFw.text: Wasn't sure what to think of this place, we pulled into the parking lot and there was only a few cars.  Walked into the place and got seated right away, there was only one table of seven.  We weren't sure what to think but ordered anyway.  So glad we stayed everything we ordered was so yummy.

SP2MKsCwbK07cHEPaw96GQ.text: Very poor service. Unless you know the manager and/or staff, do not bother going to this location. Unless you somehow enjoy mediocre service. Went with my mom and was instantly disappointed by the absence of warm, sincere service. Bartender randomly appeared and demanded my ID, then left. No greeting. Manager looked right at us but was as friendly as a rock. Only those that seemed to have prior relationships with staff were treated well.  Food was nothing to write home about. Sweet potato fries were good, but anyone that makes poor sweet potato fries has a problem. Mom ordered gumbo and was sorely underwhelmed, as it lacked flavor. Nothing created a mosaic of stirring, breathtaking flavor in our mouths.   But above all, service was a fatal blow to the visit. Trust me-you can get far better service from the guys at the Burger King right outside the door.

x4C_mdU92LsN9hC2vkldqA.text: Always wanted to try Lola's,, glad I did . Went with my daughter for lunch and it was fabulous.  Best crab cakes in Las Vegas  The decor is fun and classy.  Makes it feel like you really are in NOLA service great, prices fair ..  enough food for a to go box Love this place!!

ThMcfWkf6epo4Dl95ccb6A.text: Honestly the worst place I've ever been. Unfortunate because the location is actually super cute and I was excited to eat here as the Charleston location is fantastic. So we walked in and the host was off in another world and didn't realize there were two humans awaiting to be seated until she finally got a clue from the bartender. I should have known this was going to set the tone for our visit. We were seated and literally waited for 20 mins to have our order taken. There were maybe two other tables occupied. It wasn't even busy so we can't even point the fingers at how busy it was. Meanwhile, the servers are just chitchatting, laughing, sharing memes and fighting in the corner. Only attentive person was the guy that brought out water. After waiting for 20+ long and annoying minutes and not being even acknowledged we had to walk out. No one even batted an eye. The absolute worst customer service. Not once did either server come say hi I'll be with you in a few or whatever needed to be said. Truly upsetting and a complete shame.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bwvgcbkDGqdBAtW24M03qQ.text: Great meal every time. Wait staff makes you feel at home and they're fast and competent. We love the music as well.

4EwRCM3CJAzLwVueo1pdZQ.text: This place is amazing. The restaurant is spacious with a full service bar inside. Plenty of parking space outside. I love the Mardi Gras style decoration.   Food is great as well. Upon order food, you will get served garlic breads (free of charge). I tried the Tchoupitoulas and it's famous Roasted Beef D Brees. The Tchoupitoulas was a little light on salt and didn't taste that good per my opinion. The Beef D Brees is however very good. I'm still new to Cajun cuisine so definitely it's going to take me more than 1 visit to fully understand the menu and food here. Will be back again.

-nCVaDKivNkOE9mP1CzPzw.text: Stopped by on a Sunday while on a date with MM.  The bar area was busy with looming Saints game, but the dining area was relatively empty and this lead to quick seating.  Tyler would show up as our server and he remained attentive through our the dining experience.    It was a cheat day and the tasty bread (free) that showed up at the table was quickly devoured.  So were the craw puppies ($6.99) we ordered.  These tasty little orbs dipped in a cajun mayo where a nice treat before the meal to come.  To wash the pre-meal down, I ordered a flight ($12.00) of Abita beers.  Headquartered out of Louisiana, the flight consisted of an Andygator, Turbo Dog, Purple Haze, and a lager. LAISSEZ LES BON TEMPS ROULER!  The meal consisted of combo plater ($25.99) loaded with a catfish, skrimps, fried oysters and a crab cake.  Tasty!  What I really coveted was MM's shrimp and grits ($18.99)!  It was just the right amount of spicy Cajun love!  Since it was a cheat meal....for dessert....we both enjoyed some banana pudding ($5.99).  Not your traditional sort of pudding, but a more modern take on this southern classic.  A great experience and we look forward to returning in the future!

8p-flTJyXWHP9HFF1EOj3Q.text: Where's the 10 star button!! People you don't know what your missing!! Started this off with the Bloody Mary and Charbroiled oyster!! Slap yo momma now! Moved on to catfish, shrimp and grits and the Mardi Gras platter every thing was delicious!! Did i say EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS!! AND our server Kyle had great suggestions and awwwwwwsome service!! Definitely on our list to come back to on our next visit Al and La

wKN1gdmBg5XnykDpZN2i0Q.text: First time visiting the Summerlin location which is in a newer building compared to the original in North Las Vegas. The interior decor is full of southern charm and Saint memorabilia.  Being a Sunday, the restaurant offered unlimited brunch mimosas, a brunch menu and beignets. Unfortunately they ran out of fresh crawfish.  I inquired what was popular and my friendly waitress suggested the Drew Brees po boy sandwich - in addition, we had a order of jambalaya and beignets for dessert. Overall, the food was solid and satisfied my Cajun craving.  I enjoyed the atmosphere of this location over the original not to mention this is spacious inside even at the tables in the bar. I'd recommend Lola's if you're in the mood for some southern hospitality.

cAmLxoV1sBEcJMcGldZ_iw.text: This our 3rd time, but this time we brought some friends.we started with some beers and some fried oysters, both were on happy hour. We all ordered lots of shrimp and catfish dinners. A couple of the dishes came with rice and couple with grits and they were soooo good. We finished it off with a banana foster bread pudding...decadent. The ambience is fun and service from Kelly was excellent. If your in our part of town you must enjoy it as we did

NhkRoGQ1JGC9zst6YwaEgA.text: I have to admit that I was looking forward to coming back to Lola's Kitchen.  The brunch was magnificent this past Sunday.  The drinks were flowing of course and the overall atmosphere says you are welcome there!  I loved the charbroiled oysters (had a dozen that was shared) along with the pecan maple bacon.  I was stuff by the time I left out but nothing overboard.  I stayed for a few more mimosas and live music.  I recommend it if you have time to relax & enjoy your meal.  This is not a fast-casual place so it is priced accordingly.  I value the experience more than the final price though....it was well worth it to me!

HflAqBGGfSo1Tq2RRIbP3A.text: The food is very good but the portion for take out is almost as if they hope you dont look at it until you get home and are too whateverto do anything about it once you notice that they charged you $10.99 for an a la cart signature orange salad that they should of charged $.50 for. $15.99 for 2 crab cakes, ok, they are very filling for just a couple of them. Add a drink and you're at over $30 for your meal. All this and no vaseline? No thank your for repeat business

Olrv07ud-waVA7vCkxPgTA.text: Went to Louisiana Kitchen. Place was busy. Service was promp ,prices were decent and food was ok, nothing spectacular. Wouldn't make an extra trip out there but it nice to experience Southern cooking

-iNVxJQwR8BNmLtzeTUnNA.text: We had a noon reservation for Mother's Day. It's now 1:10 and we have received a basket of bread and our appetizer (at 12:56) Out waitress has promised more bread. Nothing. Our salad is supposed to be on its way, clearly they haven't grown the lettuce yet. And I'm starting to get concerned I will be late to work at 3:30. I hear they have good food. I'll let you know when it arrives.  Clearly the manger did not staff the restaurant properly for a holiday.  Update: The manager came over after my brother complained to the hostess. He was very apologetic. Brought us and extra appetizer and comped half the bill. My family's food was good. My Alfredo was soupy with mushy noodles but I was too hungry to care.   I appreciate the effort the manager made, but he has his work cut out for him.   Added two stars for his effort.

hyI8QKEDQYAKJKd_EvfKew.text: Clearly I have a thing for Cajun food. I got the shrimp and grits this time and my friend got the chicken Alfredo. Next time I will try the shrimp etouffee. The food is on point for Cajun/creole cuisine. And not enough can be said about the lively atmosphere and friendly staff. It truly feels like your stepping into a restaurant in NOLA! Okay I have to finish writing this. I'm hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yO3aO-w3UF2sox9q8Bv98g.text: It was my birthday a few days ago and my gf and I had just came back from a road trip. I wanted dinner in a nice place (not fancy but nice). Just like most of the places I end up visiting, Lola's was saved in my yelp bookmarks. We arrived and were immediately seated at a table of our choice - huge plus. I remember seeing bronzed shrimp and grits mentioned literally by every person on yelp, so I ordered it anticipating something amazing. My girlfriend ordered crispy catfish po'boy. For an appetizer, we ordered chicken wings. I was shocked to learn that they served either naked or Buffalo wings despite the name "Cajun wings" . Every creole/Cajun restaurant I've ever been to, serves wings crispy, generously battered in Cajun seasoning. When I asked the waiter, he looked at me as if I asked him to serve me the Moon lol after explaining everything, I asked to find out if the kitchen is willing to make the wings my way, I also asked that only flats are served, can't stand drumsticks he came back saying yes to both. After a while, we got our wings. I have to admit, they were crispy and really well made, very flavorful. The only bummer was that they served mostly drumsticks as oppose to flats as I asked. After the appetizer, our main course arrived. Everything looked really good. Taste wise, everything was just not bad. I finished my shrimp and grits but to say that I want to come back again for it, it's a no. Everything felt kinda dark and heavy. Don't get me wrong, I'm ordering grits, I'm not expecting a light meal. But I guess I was disappointed that absolutely everything on the plate felt heavy. Seasoning was okay but without a kick. I couldn't taste mushrooms in the sauce and Andouille sausage was lost in the dish. My girlfriend said pretty much the same about her poboy - not bad. Her sandwich came with a potato salad and it was inedible. She didn't finish her sandwich and didn't touch her salad, she didn't express any desire to take it home neither. For dessert, I ordered Lola's special bread pudding - another disappointment. The dessert was heavy, chewy, and warm outside but completely cold inside. I'm not coming back. 3 stars is for our waiter and the wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish poboy. Potato salad was inedible. The sandwich itself was not bad but not good either. Skip
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lola &#39;s Famous Bread Pudding So disappointing. Heavy and chewy. It was warm outside and completely cold inside - unforgivable

Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed Shrimp &amp; Gri Very heavy. Mushrooms and andouille sausage are lost in the dish. Seasoning is okay but without a kick. Not worth it

TfGEGSPf79Tj_iFTNRIOMQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the Las Vegas area. I heard about it two years before I went to eat there. I would meet people who disclosed they were born in Louisiana or lived in NOLA and I would ask them, "Have you ever been to Lola's?" One I remember, grabbed my arm, stared at me wide-eyed, saying, "That's my favorite restaurant!"  Today, I ordered, "Lola's Traditional Jambalaya." It came in a perfectly sized portion. It was flavorful and subtly rich with intricate spicing that made me wonder why I liked it so much. How do they cook this???   Patrons and relatives have been begging Lola to write a recipe book. She has interesting stories for many of the dishes. She learned how to cook as a little girl sitting on her Grandma's knee. Brothers in her family had restaurants that she worked in. She has been working extremely hard trying to do "this" her whole life.  Everything, the polite and buoyant help (they saw me coming to the front door with a cane and ran to open the front door for me), the tasteful and beautiful decor. The large French Doors to the "Private Room," the outdoor seating area, even the bathrooms!!!...All have been designed with attention to detail. Even the menu is fun to read. You'll want to order everything.  This is the best dining experience I have had since I moved here.  Now, if you want to compare restaurants, you have to mention Joe's on the strip for their fresh seafood, and others that fly in their ingredients. Lola's is so authentic, she only uses fresh genuine Louisiana Leidenheimers French Bread straight from New Orleans. The same bread is also an ingredient in her legendary Bread Pudding.  Lola's is the 'Real Deal.' This is how dining should be done. If you are lucky, when you leave, a beautiful woman with her name on the building, will sincerely thank you for coming, "Thanks, Y'all!"

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w5QWrzN6TVaAm0kGh2BJyA.text: Excellent! Service and food. Sea food was great  catfish, oysters, shrimp, soft shell crabs etc.

As82oefJ0Jppd2vAd6EzwQ.text: Constant messages on Facebook from this company. It's clear they are desperate for business. Due to their poor and obscure marketing tactics, they will not be getting a dime from me.

H7aqvARtH14wKipNsPVSvQ.text: For someone who has lived in New Orleans for a really long time and values the food, this did NOT live up to my expectations what so ever. I ordered the fried shrimp platter with fries and greens (the perfect down south meal)! The fries were unseasoned, with the exception of a ton of salt. The shrimp was unseasoned! The greens were the only thing that were truly decent, and I do mean decent at most. The was extremely over priced for something that was not half as good as the food in New Orleans. I was let down and felt like I should have taken my money else where. The only reason I am going this in-depth is because I have lived in New Orleans for years before coming here, and their food is one of the things that makes them unique and different and I was just let down. On a more positive note, the service was good and they were nice.

kJxLXYKSX4gXQozfRzlDpg.text: On Sunday Jun 30th we visited Lola's because they have great food. We have been there several times. However, on this particular Sunday we were in a rush to leave town, we live in San Diego. We took our Mom to enjoy a lunch. We thought nothing of it.  When we arrived home I realized I'd lost my wallet. After calling everywhere we'd stopped we called finally called Lola's. Low and behold, the person who answered the phone said they had the wallet. They described it as a Tommy Hilfiger wallet and the server had found it under the table we were sitting at. I was so relieved. This is where the nightmare began.  We asked our Mom to go to the restaurant and pick up the wallet. Upon her arrival she was told the manager wasn't in and they could not open the safe. She went back when the manager was in and was told that THEY DIDN'T HAVE THE WALLET!!! My heart fell through my stomach. I was sick. I asked my man to call and he was a bit more calm then the rest of us. He spoke with the manager and asked if they had cameras on the safe. Maybe even cameras in the restaurant that could be reviewed to determine the source of the problem. Maybe the wallet wasn't found in the first place. The manager said she'd call if they found the wallet. They never even called to say what effort they made to get to the bottom of it.   This was handled extremely poorly. I understand that I was the one who lost my wallet. But the chain of events that occurred showed complete irresponsibility and ever worse customer communication. I'll never again spend my hard earned money in this establishment again. It's a shame too.

4IvbYXBPbSa3h2xe30OSCQ.text: I really loved the way this place was decorated it was a beautiful presentation especially the outside seating unfortunately what made this place up 4 star for me was that the service was very slow as well we ordered red beans and rice which is supposed to be according to their waiter one of their main signature dishes the beans were so close to being overcooked you could tell that they sat too long in the pot because they were over thick even the small pieces of sausage where very very soft compared to the extra sausage that we ordered which was a lot more crispier and yet greasier on top of the rice and beans now my husband did order the soft crab po boy which isn't one of the main favorites on their menu but we thought we try it unfortunately couldn't get pass the baity taste that it had. What was the main favorite for us was the artichoke crab dip and it was served with garlic bread that was an amazing dish I was pretty disappointed that it was such a small portion and something you would think would be a little bit bigger especially for the price but it was cooked to perfection and I rather pay for Perfection then pay for a bigger dish that doesn't taste well the coleslaw had no flavor at all even if you were to put pepper on it very very Bland it was a very very safe coleslaw I do like to come back on a Sunday for their brunch since that's when they do their unlimited mimosas and that's the only day they serve beignets.... so stay tuned

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GZgpQZbjTpy0UXfOk8rkUQ.text: I have visited Lola's at the Summerlin location three times and have not had a bad experience with service or food.  Everyone worked hard to make our dining experience wonderful. Happy hour in the bar is well worth it, the drinks are well executed and martini's are served in large glasses filled to rim.  The happy hour menu is light and tasty.  The Gumbo is excellent and served with a dark rouge. For our dinner experience, everyone at the table was very pleased with their meal.  Cannot go wrong with the shrimp and Gouda grits.  My husband had same dish but with catfish. The menu is similar (or exactly the same) to their Charleston location.  Summerlin, please go and support our local restaurant! This place is a gem and worth a visit!!!

DiFn9qvU3qz2ZJgMSg9NRw.text: This place is so amazing I'm writing this review while I'm still sitting at the table. Hurricane. Shrimp and Grits. And the Pumpkin Bread Pudding (seasonal). We will definitely be coming back here. Sooner than later.

LsWoEttKfhi0lYOGIPyGIw.text: We had an out of town guest and were looking for a new restaurant to try with her that we thought she'd enjoy. As she's from Georgia I thought Lola's might be a good choice. This was based on reading on line reviews and two recommendations from friends, not personal experience. The look of the place is NOLA authentic. We were seated at a nice table in the large dining area but could still enjoy the live music from the bar area. The menu is pretty varies. Between the three of us we had the gumbo, hot wings and fries and the golden shrimp and grits. The shrimp dish was pictured on the menu and in my experience that is a good sign; I was correct. The gumbo was very good, the hot wings were crisp on the outside but juicy on the inside. The choice of sauces range from 1 5 which is a little hot to a 10 which is omg serious heat. The shrimp were delicious and the grits with the mushroom and sausage ragout were spectacular. Had we not had a freshly baled pecan pie at home waiting for us I would have tried the bread pudding. Something for next time. Lola, the owner, was there and making the rounds to the tables in play. She is really friendly and spent a lot of time with us discussing her restaurant, the food, her plans etc. She made us all feel as though we were her friends who had stopped by her house for dinner. She's very warm and engaging. The service was excellent from hostess to waitress to attentive bus boys. We had a great time. This was our first visit but definitely won't be our last.

UUJKL30Zo9ZwXwgu79_vlQ.text: The food is ok and my family loved this place. My brother got a shrimp po boy and he loved it. I had there pasta and I did not like it.

nz5rrleoK1d5ftGGLk2SYw.text: I got the Spicy BBQ Shrimp. You get a total of 5 shrimp for $12.00. It had absolutely no taste except heat. My husband liked his Po' Boy. It was pot roast with gravy on a bun. The two best things were the bread and my Colorado Bulldog.

0NXtq0Dqs5tN8BH9dr25Gg.text: Awesome, awesome and awesome. Do yourself a huge fave and enjoy some down home cajun cooking. This place is as close to nawleans as you can get! Their specialty cocktails are unbelievable and the bartenders are great people. The staff knows how to treat you right and always nice. Thank god they nestled up in Summerlin!

pMWUn19Naf5MlT7VuAiPiA.text: Delicious doesn't cover it, it's the best I've tasted. If you've never been you should try it. I got the blackened shrimp , yum. Roast beef debris was great also. Best Cole slaw ever in my life!!! Chicken strips & fries were also great. Chicken didn't have a lot of breading which was good so we could taste the chicken. Sorry no pictures this time ,, too excited to try the food!!! Great service very attentive. Server Amber, all smiles & very polite .

3uKyFKw-laso4tK2fjizng.text: One of the best restaurants in Summerlin.  You cannot go wrong with the shrimp or salmon dishes.  They also have the best fettuccine alfredo in Vegas.

smITIQbyf0iond6SCqXWLw.text: Nom! Nom! Nom!  This place is so good! We always sit at the bar and we always receive great service! The food is incredible! You can't eat here and not get the crab cake and of course the gouda grits.  I love everything on the menu!

KeW57yt_O6zuzKkf4pePhA.text: Love the Charleston location but this one is so-so. I was excited to have my mom try this place after talking about it so much. Had the gumbo, good, but there was a massive chicken bone in it. The shrimp and grits were also good. I asked if it was possible to get a little more of the mushroom sauce and the waitress said sure. When I got the bill apparently the 2Tbs of sauce I got extra was $1. I would have like to have been told of the extra charge. My mother ordered the etouffee on my suggestion. When it came out it tasted of nothing but thyme. Horrible. I'll probably give it one more shot, but I'm afraid they've spread themselves thin with two locations. Can't beat the Charleston one though.

gJhV_VLiEmGG_K2VshiGlQ.text: Authentic Cajun food! I m from New Orleans and know the best! This is Las Vegas best kept secret to good food. I almost cried, I haven't had food this good in 30 years! Thank you, I' lol be back again and again. Hey La Ba!

AmkY17_Q4ropQizu4dVOKg.text: Every friday during crawfish season, Lola's servers up a fabulous crawfish boil. You order it by the pound and its just so perfectly spiced. Really put a new appreciation for crawfish after going through about 25 of the little juicy critters. Plus the potatos and corn on the cob hit the spot!

WMuAuN4MvviXufqYH6-wqA.text: This was probably my fifth time here as I live nearby.  For starters, I would like to state that this is a very attractive venue that has a separate room for private parties.  In addition, out door patio seating is available as well.  Also, they have an amazing specialty cocktail menu with a talented staff that prepares them consistently well.  However, I was let down on my recent visit.  My wife and I came by for a late lunch and the first thing we noticed is that their prices have gone up quite a bit.  My wife started by ordering a "House Bloody Mary" - $8.00.  For lunch, I ordered a "Family Favorites," Gumbo - $12.29.  The color, (Dark brown) and consistency of this dish was not very appetizing to me.  It came in a shallow soup bowl with a scoop of white rice in the center.  I was expecting more of a stew and it was the consistency of soup.  Flavor was ok.  I would not order this item again and do not recommend it.  My wife ordered a "House Specialties," Shrimp Charlotte - $15.99.  This dish came with medium size sauteed shrimp and mushrooms over angel hair pasta in a light broth.  She enjoyed this dish and would order this item again.  Our meal came with their specialty bread and was quite good.  Bottom line for me, there was a lack of "bank for the buck" considering that $47 was spent, (including tax and tip) for lunch for two on a $8 well Bloody Mary, $12.29 for a bowl soup and $15.99 for a simple shrimp and pasta dish.

AX3I4sRF3qZYlI7FiBA20w.text: All I can say is EXCELLENT.  I found this place on Open Table the night before Valentine's Day.  What a find!  Authentic Cajun food with a New Orlean's environment.  Plenty of ambiance inside, but if the weather is accommodating, I recommend the patio----beautiful.  The food was excellent, we were a party of 3 and each ordered something different, every dish was very tasty.  Waffles and chicken, strawberry and cream begniets.......yumm....Excellent service and a bit of live music as well.  I think of this place as a best kept secret----enjoy!

XFfSwrK1uu-897OdOzDIvw.text: Came today for the first time and really liked it! The decor is cool, the music is great, and the food is fantastic! I had the bronzed shrimp and grits and will definitely order it next time! Creamy, cheesy grits paired with spicy shrimp and andouille sausage - yum! My husband ordered off the brunch menu and got the French toast with a side of praline bacon. He said it was terrific and I can attest to that, at least as far as the bacon is concerned, because I stole a piece! We will definitely be back and would like to try sitting outside in their nice courtyard (too windy today.)

cpZJO_W4fELTWznOi9hjbg.text: First dine-in experience:   Hostess was friendly & engaging. We chose to sit in bar area for happy hour & time restraints. Bartender abruptly approached to card my daughter ( 29yrs old), commented on her age then asked what we were drinking. Never said hi, even though I looked at him and said hi, just waited for my daughter's id then left.  Five minutes later I approached the hostess, explained to her it was our first time here, didn't know if someone was coming to take our order, if I had to go up to the bar ? She walked over to bar area, bartendar showed up shortly after that. Food was prompt, cup of gumbo lacked decent flavour. Shrimp in gumbo looked of the frozen variety, roux without flavour, okra cooked to that consistency which makes people not like okra. Asked another server passing by for check. Proprietor walked around chatting with patrons, but said nothing nor smiled at us. That is rude behavior in the eye of a dining, paying patron.  The hostess opened the door for us as we left, thank you. Her's was the best service we had from here. Did not feel welcomed. Will not return. The stars are for the Hostess.

uWm1sVVmQdFbzV4rZ0mjyg.text: Ive been wanting to try this place for a long time now after doing so was not happy at all i ordered the crab cakes with the hot wings the wings were great crab cake was horrible my friend tried the shrimp an grits i had to get a quick taste an yes that was horrible also an portions were very small for the price but a 10+ for the wings .....

t-32rFRznNJjUpHhE79Nig.text: Beware of take out menu misleading. We ordered the catfish plater from Lols's online menu. It stated three pieces, in which any person would think that you get three filets. Not so, in fact when we opened the containers at home we called the restaurant and we were told that "three is the number of pieces we cut one filet into".  And yes we spoke to the manager. Disappointed at such misleading menu.  Taste was okay but won't be eating here again, $14.99 for one filet and small sides.

bTZBeFusTu54bbmVa02QgA.text: I've lived in Vegas for 4 years & I've been wanting to try Lola's since hearing about it/seeing the Charleston location. Since that location is a little far from our side of town, I was excited to try the new Summerlin location. My husband and his family are from Louisiana and I much prefer New Orleans cuisine over where my husband and in laws are from (sorry mom in law). However, I have to admit I was slightly disappointed in Lola's.  First we ordered the crawpuppies. They were just ok, you only get 4 TINY crawpuppies and they are definitely NOT worth the over $5.00 they charge for them. For my main course I ordered the red beans and rice. It was good, didn't knock my socks off, but decent. Not enough sausage, although I could have ordered, and been charged for, extra sausage. The thing that really irritated me was when we asked for ONE extra side of ranch dressing (cups were tiny) for my kids chicken strips we were told there was a charge for the ranch. The server apologized and was clearly embarrassed to have to tell us that because we all looked at her like, "you're kidding, right?" Now, is 50 cents breaking us? No. However, it's the PRINCIPLE here. I felt like I was being nickled and dimed. Most McDonalds' don't even charge for an extra side of sauce!  I really don't know if I'll be back.

I_MVMLEmlxEIYhRWTlhE0Q.text: For spur of the moment this was an okay. We had the soft shell crab app and it was underwhelming as was the garlic bread. The fries and chicken basket was the best thing but a bit over priced for being in Summerlin, from my perspective. The caesar salad was a bit over dressed but about average. Overall it was all meh.

xrhTk2kASqdKrUMzJbJ21Q.text: If you only order one thing, order the poutine (gravy fries) - usually only available during happy hour, but oh so good! We ate them so fast, I forgot to take a photo!  Other recommendations - the roast beef d'brees (featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, one of my fave Food Network shows). Basically a roast beef sandwich smothered in gravy. Can you tell I'm a fan of gravy? Lol  Also the Shrimp Charlotte, which was incredible! The sauce was not too rich or heavy, but still very flavorful.

EJviJXoI3ZNkrrtjeIH9mw.text: The best salads!  Always fresh.  The fried chicken tops it all off!!  Service is always over the top.  I look forward to my weekly visits!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2JfNhPSCqZvps8KirXvywQ.text: I've always wanted to eat here especially after hearing the great reviews and spending a year in NOLA. I had high expectations. There's a po'boy that I used to order all the time, roast beef dressed and wet so when I saw the D'Brees roast beef po'boy I was excited to say the least.   The bread was stale! My companions were trying to explain that the bread is toasted but the reality is that the bread was stale! The picture makes the bread look crusty and the expectation is that it has a little chew. The answer is no. It was like eating the sandwich with a dry sponge. :(. The gravy was also not warmed up enough as you can see in the picture and very much on the salty side.   I also had their grits with Gouda cheese. It was good. A bit too cheesy for me...   The sweet tea was awesome tho. !

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. D&#39;Brees with not so warmed up gravy and stale bread. :(

rSUsgSDJKMmxzRhNJvuZTw.text: Amazing food & service! One of my favorite places. The Shrimp & Grits is my favorite, but honestly, everything I've tried there over the years is great!

nYKAZRMMjfS5ikA_-Z9d0g.text: My family and I were looking for a place to eat on our side of town this past Saturday and my mom suggested Lola's.   I am so glad she suggested Lola's because we had a great dining experience with the service and food!  We came in around 5 pm right before the dinner rush and were able to be seated right away.  I think this used to be an old Ruby Tuesday's or Rubio's but regardless it was renovated very nicely.  They have a large patio area and garden with real herbs and vegetables out front.  As for the inside, it is a nice mixture of rustic and New Orleans Mardi Gras decorations.  Our server was extremely friendly and efficient adding on to the overall experience.     We ordered: -Crawpuppies ($5.29) - deep fried crawfish balls, a little on the salty side probably wouldn't order this appetizer again -Shrimp and Crawfish Etouffee ($15.99) - served over rice, the shrimp and crawfish are smothered in a flavorful sauce, really liked this would order again     -Oyster Platter ($14.99) - mom ordered this, the oysters I was able to steal from her plate were fried to perfection and were juicy, came with 8 oysters and 2 sides -Fried Oyster Loaf ($12.29) - dad ordered this, didn't have any but it looked tasty and good portion size as well, dad said he enjoyed it   My family really liked this place we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Crawfish Etouffee ($15.99)
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Oyster Loaf ($12.29)
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crawpuppies ($5.29) a little on the salty side

tQhs-8h6Q-ZtKc1O8nzzUA.text: Lola's is a hidden gem.  I have visited both locations and the food at both restaurants is worth the visit.  The Summerlin location has ample seating at all hours.  Regardless of what entree you get, the banana pudding is a must have after your meal.

zoOXs-2TA2YfGbk5n3eXrA.text: Having a ball at Lola's. As one who lives for the ambiance, I'm loving the piano player and yummy crab cakes. It's a great Valentine's Day with my honey. My husband ordered a Shrimp remaulade. He says it's great. Our waiter Randall is very attentive. It's worth the trip here to rock out to the music and enjoy the lovely ambiance. Bus boy Morgan is also loaded with personality and ready to help with the amazing experience. We will definitely be back.

LxBHCnEPoRfEzGjll6yhbQ.text: Was welcomed into Lola's and instantly knew I was in for a great dining experience. Shrimp and Gouda grits did not disappoint. Bananas Foster were superb. Entire staff was warm, friendly and made for a most memorable evening - special thanks to Lola and Tim. Highly recommend Lola's!

YtftlH0oClhyuBXQKyrDrg.text: I think being featured on TV can be a curse as an establishment has to live up to its reputation that is presented to the masses.  I've been meaning to go to Lola's for awhile but the Charleston location just isn't convenient. We drove to the new Summerlin location as the first Friday crowd packed the Charleston location with a 30-45 minute wait as told to us by the hostess. Since Vegas is small the drive wasn't long.  This location is really cute. Who ever did the decorating did a good job. It looked very comfortable, random (in a good way), and not tacky. We sat outside even though it was cold and they had heaters on to help.  I always like to try a variety of things the first time I visit a new place so that I know what to order next time.. If there is a next time.  We got a few appetizers to share: gumbo cup $6, crawpuppies $6, and crab and artichoke dip $10. I'm 99% sure the prices are accurate. I thought these prices were fair for the taste, portions, and quality except the crawpuppies.  As in not from the south I am no gumbo expert but theirs is probably the best I've had. My friends dipped the bread that came with the crab dip into it and really loved it. The crab dip had a lot of real lump crab meat in it and onions. It was good with the toasted bread. The crawpuppies were good but only came with four small balls. It's literally fried dough! I guess the craw fish in them is what makes the serving four.  I got the platter for $25. It came with fried cat fish, 2 fried oysters, 2 fried shrimp, one crab cake, and 2 sides. I was pretty full after our appetizers so idk if that's why I didn't enjoy my food so much, but I was a little disappointed in what I ordered. I'm not sure if the crab cake was the same as the appetizer one or the dinner one but it wasn't as good of a crab cake as I hoped for. Definitely average. They may have just over mixed it but it was a lot of filler. The one in the picture on the menu had big chunks of lump crab meat in it. The portion of cat fish was generous and it tasted good. The fried oysters were good and so were the shrimp. My friends both got bronzed catfish with Gouda grits and the sausage and mushroom ragout.  The last two things I got were the Gouda grits with sausage and mushroom ragout and then the bacon seasoned green beans. I really liked the grits dish. It wasn't life changing but it was good. The ragout really made it as plain Gouda grits would have been lame. The bacon seasoned green beans were over cooked and mushy.  My main gripes were the service and experience. The outside seating area sucked as people stood by smoking at times, the service was slow, and the chairs sucked. It took a long time to get our order taken.. The food was good but not good enough for me to want to go back soon. I think our server was alone so it was not good being seated outside. Overall I was a little disappointed and underwhelmed with the food after getting my hopes up seeing it on tv and them doing well enough to get a second location. I would go back but not anytime soon.  After looking at other's photos I believe we may have went on an off night as our servings of bronzed catfish were significantly less than the photos I've seen.

Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crawpuppies
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab dip with bread

poAqlJEz0Z3X0Miq_NjKzQ.text: Not original louisianna food. Waiter needs to review bill before giving it to the customer! Charging for each fill up of the drinks! 3  months ago

ytexeMiZNt0FhK2mCGhVuA.text: I visited this restaurant last night with a friend 45 minutes before closing. I normally love this restaurant, but not last night. There were no cars in the parking lot. We entered and there were no patrons in the restaurant. The hostess told us there is only seating at the bar and only bar food available because the kitchen is closed. She didn't explain why. We left.

fCl1zM0dbfxBsw7ja7kmOQ.text: Ok let's start off with a simply basic "Yum". The food is tasty. The ambiance is catered to NOLA with love. The menu has arrangements of poultry, seafood and steaks. Our waiter was handsomely charming and provided great service. Should definitely be a spot to try when craving some southern Cajun makings. So why the 4 stars and not 5? Ok so the menu is huge but my portion was a bite shy of a kids meal. I mean, I know I can put down a hefty plate but ONE chicken breast and a half serving of grits? Reminded me of a wedding dish sampler. It was great....but I needed more bites to be sure geez. Slightly overpriced unless you pay for flavor "shrugs". Also, it's supposed to be NOLA styled but they played country music. Ummmmm. Granted it was 4th of July so mayyyybbeeee that had a hand but it was surely awkward. Blah blah blah, will be back for some bronzed yumness but I may eat a sandwich beforehand.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

479cm3VT7VE_3Va9kF1Qpw.text: my last review of Lola's was back in 2014.  We have continued to go to Lola's on a regular basis.  It is our go to neighborhood spot.  The atmosphere:  often there is a piano player who is great.  the bar area is always fun to sit in and the restaurant area is open so you can sit at a table but still see the bar and hear the music.  The food:  amazing.  my favorite is the blackened salmon.  i order salmon a lot and i think this is some of the best I have had.  It comes with your choice of 2 sides - the grilled veggies, the cole slaw and especially the grits are all great.  Shrimp creole is always good.  Really anything you order is going to be great.  service is quick and food comes out quickly as well.  lots of beer on tap.  sweet potato pie or bread pudding is a must.

63GoVXFtNxlZxXN88qOppg.text: First time visiting and it won't be the last!  Besides the delicious cuisine, the hostess and waitress were very kind and knowledgeable of the menu!

blYgoJwxiRZtBbcI92-GZQ.text: This is a great restaurant, in Summerlin. I was here for a function, which I missed but stayed back for dinner and drinks. The reason being the ambience, great food and service Tuesday evening and it was busy, with piano player playing some old southern music. It was just awesome.  We dined at the bar, the service is spot on and the food was great. The bartender explained their house specialty which we ordered - Shrimp Charlotte - names after the owners sister - thin noodles in mushroom and spicy sauce - was super delicious. We followed that up with I believe a Louisiana  classic - Shrimp Creole spicy shrimp stew- OMG what a dish - we could not stop eating it - just the right spice level - ask for 6 out of 10 on spice level Overall it was a great dinning experience and we will be back. Strongly recommend   this spot

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ynCAgtpk0B1EwbcWvZ61Ag.text: Okay.  It will do if I want cajun food close to where I live.  I typically get food orders for pick up.  Some of it is good while part of the order is bleh.  I've dined in twice and both of those times everything was good.  However, I always end up with something in my pick up orders that has either texture or taste issues (such as an item being too salty, or the bread of the poboy being soggy from the contents).  The staff is always courteous, but I've been disappointed with the food too many times to give a higher rating.

lJpVKGj_vbKLg8qh2vf0Qg.text: Lola's was okay. The staff was friendly like the other reviews stated. They did seem understaffed.  Crawfish puppies- were extremely dark in color and I almost thought they were burnt. The dipping sauce was cold. Like unable to dip, had to be scooped out with a knife. Crab cakes-were good. I'd recommend ordering them  Gumbo-the roux was extremely dark and almost burnt. It wasn't served hot at all.  I ordered  Shrimp & Catfish bronzo It was close to be being burnt but nonetheless it was flavorful My family ordered  Alfredo(yes I know, it's a southern restaurant) It was just okay according to them. The salmon came with the skin on which I didn't understand. The Alfredo sauce was overpowered with garlic. The portion weren't huge. My 13yr old daughter finished her entire plate. The good thing about the desert is it comes in a huge portion.   The service was subpar to say the least.

5tuRLDZu4UUa9xU4kvPt1A.text: Terrible service, greens were so dry like welted grass. The service was bad and the manager was asked to approach us after we complained . This was our first trip to Vegas and we chose the spot.

i9fNnuMaDwV00Wb4K0SNmg.text: Bad customer service and over priced mediocre food. The owner is rude, I'm assuming it's Lola, if not my apologies to the actual owner.

MtRLD9bhs9osOg3ojtmIQA.text: Dined here for lunch yesterday with a friend. It was my first time here and I was excited to try it because I love Cajun food. We decided to sit at the bar thinking we would get faster service. The bartender didn't have the best customer service he initially ignored us and we had to ask him to take our order so that knocked off a star. Other then that the food was amazing I had fried oysters with greens and potato salad on the side the greens were a little bland definitely needed hot sauce and salt. My friend had the jambalaya which was really good. I'll be back im going to try the other location next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried oysters were a hit
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya with shrimp was so good
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BB_L_Js_OHBKTtHdQBpdpQ.text: It's been several years since the last review and my craving for New Orleans cuisine takes me back to Lola's in Summerlin. We arrived for lunch a little after the peak lunch time. The dining room was not crowded and service was prompt. The dining decor remains unchanged. It still has that Mardi Gras atmosphere and interesting wall art.  Shortly after the arrival of our refreshments, a basket of warm, grilled garlic bread appeared. The bread was soft and had a hint of smoke from the grill. We ordered the Breaded Chicken Strips from the appetizer menu and Shrimp and Grits from the list of House Specialties. Food service was timely and our server Jaime was friendly.   The Chicken Strips come with French Fries and a Ranch dipping sauce. The chicken was crisp outside and juicy inside. The fries were just fries nothing special. The chicken was large enough to take some home for a second meal. The Shrimp and Grits were fantastic. Five medium size shrimps were pan bronzed, served over smooth and creamy grits that were surrounded by andouille sausage and mushroom ragout in a hot and spicy sauce. Just the right amount of heat for my taste. None left to take home. Remember to use the garlic bread to soak up the remaining sauce. Yum.

h5xYEySQ9XEc7lguBirK1w.text: First time trying this place, we saw the southern theme and how catchy it looks.  Our server was nice and knowledgeable, we enjoyed the ambiance and the food was very flavorful.   Will definitely be returning, our experience was great, and the food was too!

bOnN7b_FHpHr6rZvybPOBw.text: Came here for  casual dinner with live music and I was so disappointed!..  The food is over priced and has small portions.   Come here if you wanna spend your money on frozen seafood, frozen vegetables and bland coleslaw.  Also I had to spend $ for a doctors Appointment after getting sick after eating a mushy cold crab cake.

n8eob-AquTkuCtbt7MsJpw.text: This place is teetering between 3 and 4 stars, hopefully next time I come by, I'll be able to give them a 4 or a 5.  Food was very good. If you like that southern/cajun and spicy flavor, you'll like this place. I ordered the Bronzed Catfish and Grits and it was delicious! Super savory grits and the catfish had so much flavor. My other 2 favorites were the oysters and banana foster bread pudding with vanilla ice cream. My family enjoyed their meals as well, but we had a couple instances where they forgot pieces of my family's order.  For example, my boyfriend ordered a cheeseburger with bacon, they forgot the bacon. Manager offered to take it back to add bacon, but we didn't want to go through the hassle and wait time to get another burger.  They also forgot my dad's sweet baked potato that is supposed to come with the Mardi Gras plate. Unfortunately, we did not realize this until the end when the manager stopped by to give us a free sweet potato pecan pie. Which is when my dad realized he never got his side of baked potato. Lol. But we gladly accepted the pecan pie.

MnI0gyPTNLe8c6JUcvIvyA.text: This place was actually better than I expected. The restaurant was very clean, well laid out and decorated. Service was prompt and courteous, and though the food took about 35 minutes the chicken was well prepared. Overall a great dining experience, would definitely go back.

xCqLctNBv5UflW5jfxpOjg.text: Been here multiple times and just ordered here via postmates. Is this authentic creole cuisine? No. But it's probably the best you'll get in Vegas as far as I know( send recommendations) .  My family is Creole and they cook better dishes on their worse day.  Crab patties and hush puppies burnt on the outside but cold on the inside. But I  don't know another place for "creole " food here. But this Becky place ain't it. Plus it's expensive!! Find another place, I'm still on the lookout...

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt crab patties and &#34; hush puppies&#34;.

fhd2yLp78RmW7cjjhwNY1Q.text: My family had a great experience here the other night. We were sat immediately and had a wonderful server named Lexi. Lexi informed us that she was fairly new but she was attentive and personable with us the whole night, making us laugh on multiple occasions. She checked on us often and did not rush us out when we were the very last table sitting there past closing time.   The food was phenomenal as well. Between my family and I, we ordered the crab dip and bread, shrimp pasta, shrimp and grits and the etouffee then shared the bread pudding. The bread that came with the dip was so delicious. Toasted and butter and melted in your mouth. The crab dip was great too, we were all pleasantly surprised how much they did not skip on the crab. There were chunks in every bite.   I had the shrimp and grits. So so good! The shrimp had amazing cajun flavor and was cooked perfectly. The gouda grits were delicious and compliments the shrimp very well. The bread pudding was great as well!  Overall great experience, the food was 5 star and so was the service!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Etouffee
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Gouda grits without the sausage

Jbsm3uC9iUzlGIl8jsDJlw.text: The place was in a cool little spot and very clean. The customer service was cool and it was a 15 minute wait. I went with a girl friend of mine around noon. I got us both the crab cake appetizer, our own, which was a mistake because it wasn't that good. The white sauce was kinda tangy and the flavor was just there. My friend didn't eat all of hers either, but it did look yummy! Then I had the shrimp creole since there was no pork in it. Omg that was so damn disgusting, the shrimp tasted so uncooked and plain! The the red sauce tasted more like an oil taste than a spice to it. It was so weird because it looked so good but it was awful! I was so hungry and my mouth was watering when I saw it but it was horrible!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ISMIEGE6i60JVzr3GzXd_Q.text: Love, Love, Loved it! I had the gumbo and the fried catfish. I love this place and the food is delish.  I was disappointed one time because my catfish was fried too hard in grease used too many times and my fries were stale! The dishes I've tried have been my favorites and I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great Cajun, Creole, & Southern dishes and Yummy, yum!!  Po'Boy heaven!!! The service was exceptional and everyone working there was personable and friendly. They will help guide you through the menu if you're unsure of what to order. Parking is plenty and the facility is spotless. We will definitely be back!

2xjp17BHintgu4twy-YWng.text: Ok y'all let's talk crawfish etouffee. One of us was disappointed and the other thought it was tasty. The roux was too dark in my opinion, and was more like gravy. The other half has only had etouffee a handful if times with me, and doesnt understand what it should taste like. Was not the cajun, creole taste that I have been craving. No begneits or fried green tomatoes either.  The amazing server who was the bartender took great care of us. I would come back for service, maybe try something else? But lawd help them if they mess up shrimp and grits for me. The garlic bread is real good. Here is another gripe. The restaurant has the cutest outside sitting area that reminds me of my southern roots. I could really do without all the bungee cords holding the windows open though. I know we are a bit trashy in The South, but c'mon! You have got to find a better way to tie those windows open.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crawfish etouffee

ZYPj9nGdSBmVzcldfCGO1A.text: Damn that's some fine tastin' Cajun food!  So, Lola's might be what one can hope to expect from a visit to New Orleans?  If so, man I wanna visit Louisiana to find what there's in store!  I love me some spicy food, and Lola's is no exception!  Spicy & tasty!  Made a reservation for dinner with the wifey on a recent Friday night.  Date Night, y'all!  Got to the counter and was welcomed in with some sweet light jazz noise from the background.  Lively atmosphere!  Upon being seated, our hostess was the most helpful in explaining the menu to us, so nice!  We ordered:  *Combo Platter ($24.49) - 1 catfish fillet, 2 fried oysters, 2 shrimp (fried), and a crab cake *Bronzed Shrimp & Grits ($16.99) - seasoned & pan bronzed Gulf shrimp served over Gouda grits with an andouille sausage and mushroom ragout (served on the side for me)  Wifey's combo platter also came with 2 sides - she chose the Hoppin' John (rice simmered with sausage and blackeyed peas), and a baked sweet potato.  While waiting for our order, we were treated to a basket of grilled French bread - apparently Lola's imports Leidenheimer's fresh bread from Louisiana regularly!  This bread is fantastic, I can see why many of the restaurants use Leidenheimer's for the famous Po' Boys!  Our order didn't disappoint either, BRONZED = FLAVOR!  Their bronzed items are good - spicy with a kick, but somehow still with a very nuanced flavor.  You get the hot, but you also get the spiciness that works with your tongue in harmony.  Bits of umami everywhere!  Wifey liked that bronzed catfish fillet, and the shrimp and oysters were of a good size & fried just right.  Great batter, and I believe dusted with some of Lola's Cajun seasoning.  Wifey didn't like the crab cake that much so I ate most of it, but I rather liked it.  Quite a bit of crab, very little filler.  Good!  Lola's specialty of Bronzed Shrimp & Grits were pretty stellar!  The shrimp were so good over that bed of tasty, rich Gouda grits!  The andouille sausage and mushroom ragout added more unctuous goodness!  I sopped every last bit up with an extra basket of Leidenheimer's French bread!  No butter necessary!  My only gripe was the portion, but I do believe these are industry standard sizes.  But..I'm not an industry standard kinda guy!  I wish my bowl of Bronzed Shrimp & Grits was BIGGER!  This stuff was tasty.  Prices are a bit on the high side - we are in Summerlin after all, and we are in a little bit fancier casual restaurant.  We did have a coupon though for this visit of buy one entree, get one entree free - so that did help our bill a lot.  More tip for our fantastic server!  Lola's was a great choice for Date Night, and we will be back!  Very inviting atmosphere, very inviting comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VKvBRhDBRdwYvaL1LcC4Mw.text: I loved New Orlean's when I travelled there in 2016. I've been craving Louisiana food for a very long time and so I've been dying to try Lola's. They had a special promotion on Facebook that gave us buy one get one free entree, so we finally gave them a try.   We opted for their beer flight for $12 and a sweet tea for drinks. We ordered shrimp and grits and the tchoupitoulas for our entrees. They gave us a few slices of the garlic bread while we wait for the food. The garlic bread was yummy. It was crispy on the outside and soft inside. The sweet tea reminded me of being in the south. My boyfriend enjoyed the beer flight. The shrimp and grits were delicious! The grits had this light cheesy flavor which paired well with the blackened shrimp. The shrimp was cooked perfectly! The tchoupitoulas was also very flavorful! I snuck several bites off of my boyfriend's plate.  I really wanted some beignets but unfortunately they're only served during brunch.   Service was great from Tyler. The ambiance reminded me of New Orleans. The food was flavorful and delicious. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tchoupitoulas
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Update menu prices - 02.10.19

AstK_KiUkt9oFPObUzpNzQ.text: The mood - my family homecooking  I knew this place would not disappoint. And when you walk in your first greeted by smiling faces. I didn't know they only had table seating no booths, but it was very nicely decorated made you feel like your in New Orleans.   We ordered the garlic bread - which is imported from Louisiana ( after my heart), hot tea of course, the gumbo, the red beans and rice with extra sausage, and of course their famous bread pudding.   All of the food was amazing. I felt like I was in my grandmother's house. Which I can't say I normally feel.   The customer service was amazing and very attentive. They brought out fresh bread when ours got low. This was a great experience. I will be back to try their Sunday Brunch where I can indulge in their beignets.  Location is Town Center/ Summerlin Pkwy - ample parking.
