tF_vE6n8SS0zdG6oK7JurQ.text: Ive been here many times and each time there is something new on the menu.  This time it was the  savory crab cheesecake. DELICIOUS is the best way to describe this appetizer!  I wad so happy to  hear it will be added to the regular menu. Thank you for another wonderful dinner

kK6YKcQyFiTjyl74WdNwLQ.text: My husband and I celebrated our 6 years wedding anniversary here, though the host said that Yelp Reservation does not show up on their ends she kindly assist us, I still showed her my notifications that I made a reservation a day prior. Our dinner was amazing as well as our server Daniel was absolutely great and did an outstanding job, he even made it extra special for making our dessert with celebration, very well attentive and friendly! Our food was delicious! Very good job Lola's!

xB4jV4dyiG5BlH7jnH6kQQ.text: I came here on a Wednesday night and was able to get a seat right away.  This restaurant is one of the best Cajun restaurants in town. I wish I would've found out about this place a long time ago, because I would come here a lot. It's not a cheap place to eat at either, but is worth coming here enough.  Service 4/5: There server was really cool and attentive, we talked about football. He made sure our waters were filled. They did forget to bring out our appetizer, but it's okay because the main course was huge and filling.  Main dish 5/5: They brought out large pieces of garlic bread that that throw on the grill which has loI got the blackened shrimp and grits on the recommendation of the server. I love spicy food, but I felt it wasn't as spicy as advertised. It did have a nice kick though. The grits were cooked perfectly and were extra cheesy. The shrimp was cooked tender and not over cooked.   Dessert 5/5: The banana foster bread pudding is the best dessert I have ever had. If I was a kid, I would ask for this dish to replace my cake every year. It's a huge piece of bread pudding that sits in a caramel sauce bath with bananas and vanilla ice cream on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackened shrimp and grits
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana foster bread pudding

ufB1KIaaSn9UCSse0jSgFw.text: If you're in the mood for home cooked southern comfort cooking, come on down to Lola's! Where the food is full flavor and the employees are like family. Stunning southern vibes, with a great selection of premium cold beers. Whenever I have the hankering for grits, there's only one thought that comes to mind---Lola's, baby! The creamy goodness from the Gouda in their Blackened Shrimp Andouille Sausage dish is killer! I can't even begin to explain how mouthwatering the spice combination is; the perfect blend, w/the proper amount of heat, make this dish a top notch winner. I don't often consume shrimp or andouille for that matter, but this is the one dish that I cannot get enough of either of them. Wow! How can I not mention, their Banana Foster Bread Pudding! Yumm! Whenever we're in Vegas, it's no question that we'll be dining here. Enjoy! Xoxo

FaeUSt1guwzEJ-ZJXbHohg.text: This was such a great experience! The food was sooooooo good. We started out with the fried oysters and a couple of draft beers. We then ordered the Mardi Gras combo and the Catfish and Shrimp with grits combo as our entrees...both were fresh and tasty......all the flavors were there! Great service by Randall and the ambience certainly has a New Orleans flair.....fun and easy! We will be back.

8GLIL2wW7qC6sZTGn0oFeQ.text: Went here with my out of town family for appetizers and drinks. Sooooo worth it. They wait stage was friendly and the food was amazing. I wish the drinks were a little stronger but they were still good. I highly recommend this place.

lxb2zm75oYXExpxpRubDBQ.text: Awesome place to eat for delicious authentic cajun food! It has a chill and relax atmosphere. I ordered the crabcakes with greens, salmon dinner and Poor Boy sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cake Dinner

OiZb7GQRNK5gYEQKBB_rcA.text: Lola's is my FAVORITE restaurant in Vegas, bar none! The owner is a sweetheart, I Love her! When anyone comes to Vegas to visit us, we take them to Lola's, they've all loved it too!! Usually we'd take them to the one on Charleston, but the new one is closer to home, both are great! I'm going tonight, can't wait!  What's GOOD?! Catfish or Shrimp and Gouda Grits!! Damn! Fried shrimp!! BOOM! Gumbo.. Jambalaya... Fried oysters... All the sides... Desserts..Ahhhh...the bread pudding...ohhWeeeeee!!! I haven had anything at Lola's I DIDN'T Like!!!

Ol8ElleOkYEvrpBQTPyosw.text: I had heard rave review about this place and checked it out for lunch and we both got the Roast Beef from DDD, thinking it would be the best thing on the menu and it was just fair, especially with all the hype.  The place was clean and the service was good and the sides were really good-We got one order of fries and one order of grits ($2.99 extra).  I would give this place a try again, but not my favorite place is summerlin.

yVWKxDVV1YpM2E7bLbgUdw.text: Food was just ok..but the hostess and servers??? 7 11 has better customer service. I don't know that we would go back, the girls up front were talking about certain customers. If you don't like your job..don't come in. How hard is it? One star is over rated

Lb6dNPPLi5m6Gvx-_VDW8Q.text: This is my first visit to Lola's . Both my boyfriend and I had the gumbo. Good size dish with the mound of rice in the middle of it. Comes with a side of bread. It's not quite the gumbo I'm used to but it was tasty nonetheless and had a little kick to it. I will definitely go back and try something different next time maybe jambalaya.  I really enjoyed the New Orleans atmosphere there . Great music I've never been to New Orleans but I definitely want to go now. We ate on the patio is a little cold at night they had heater set out and it was very comfortable. We were definitely catered to and they made sure that we were all comfortable. I will definitely go back hopefully I can get four stars.

Yj_Y93S47DR0_LWLEdlQmA.text: Authentic New Orleans cooking.  The gumbo and red beans is the best I've had.  Deserts are amazing. They know how to do bread pudding.  Wait staff are friendly and attentive.

EaPzBoMU2YYF9VaiURjh8A.text: Went on spur of the moment and was excited to try some Cajun seafood. We had the catfish and soft shell crab. The catfish was great but the soft shell crab was delicious!  We also order a side of the Gouda grits...friggin amazing!  The bread pudding and the chocolate cake are worth a taste as well. I will go back for some more!

7GROX3F22UvRax4osszjsg.text: Had lunch here today. Food was excellent. Very authentic. Great atmosphere in a stunning location. Lots of herbs and veggies growing around the parking. I'm sure it will smell amazing once they all fill in. I didn't have any today but based on previous trips to the downtown location, the king cake is delicious. Also, I thought prices were pretty reasonable for very high quality food. I didn't look at the drink menu.  I can't wait to go back during crawfish season. I wish this place great success.

RzuTTkctYhkaYcZJGvVUiw.text: The food was amazing!  The service outstanding.  I was a little upset by the size (or lack there of) of our appetizer.  We got the crawpuppies or something like that.  You get only 4 and they are the size of large marbles.  While they are very tasty, it most certainly wasn't worth the price.  Other than that, I highly recommend this place.  I had the Shrimp and Grits and it was so good!!  We will be back.

W57gdC0mVwzXfia_3gjXbg.text: This place is fantastic ... Great people, great food all giving you the feeling you left Las Vegas.

oZ0z8JWTFeuFAnLjybxNTA.text: Authentic Louisiana with a twist. A must if looking for something different in Las Vegas.

u3IXrQ5M_TztNOVNX8gyUQ.text: OMG it was like being back in The Boot! I am a super Creole/Cajun food snob and side-eye any place outside of Louisiana or my family's kitchens that claim to serve this cuisine. But Lola's is the truth! From the Gouda shrimp and grits to the decor, everything about this place is authentic and delightful. I can't wait until football season starts so that I can spend many Sundays watching the Saints and eating beignets at Lola's!

kWJbBIgHJsrB_tBZ7BM_uw.text: Meh - skip this place - service was not good and the decor is cheap - the food made me and my wife not feel good after and it wasn't that good taste wise.

gSBgGJ1hRtDSLkKZMj7M_Q.text: Love this restaurant. Excellent variety of Louisiana dishes and tastes. Wonderful place to relax and enjoy.

Jc8ZA87a8nRxMIOdhovGcw.text: Don't order the chicken strips.  Smallest portion ever for 10$.  Menu also needs more diversity

_NjVxV81WzBCKgT_OlpdAw.text: Delicious and spicy! The crawfish puppies are yummy. The gumbo with shrimp is amazing and the gumbo is great! Worth every penny!

tISG6pEgQsSqXJ1G_W_wdA.text: Awesome place for a Louisiana style food.  Great atmosphere and people.  I had the Jambalaya and it's perfect.  Best bartender

N9aP6hSvU7-5XdNW_UYEpg.text: I've been to the Charleston location several times and it is always a must stop every time I'm in Vegas so I had to try this new location in Town Center. I brought 3 of my friends and as usual, Lola's did not disappoint. First of all the new location is absolutely gorgeous. Loved the decor and open feel of the place.  Very inviting. Finally got to try the crawfish and they were the biggest I'd ever eaten. Amazing oysters too. We were fortunate to have come on a day when Lola made some special cobbler which was amazing even after stuffing ourselves with several menu items. And of course the Banana foster bread pudding was a must as well. Highly recommended. Very authentic New Orleans cuisine. You're doing yourself a grave disservice if you don't stop and dine at least once at one of Lola's locations whenever you're in town. Until next time!

ZV-h56Ze-NpyolU73ynCYQ.text: Can somebody say, "Coon ass"? Holy Atchafalaya River Basin! In my travels, I always Google the haunts of Guy Fieri's Triple D, and found the downtown Lola's location. Unfortunately it's Christmas Eve, but some folks hanging out front told us to go to the Summerlin location - and I'm glad they did, because this East Texan who knows Louisiana cooking misses this food. I've been out of my element too long. Char-broiled oysters on the half, low country greens, smokey Gouda grits and an Oyster Po Boy dressed for Fat Tuesday...washed down with a Dixie Blackened Voodoo...can't wait to come again!

TjZwO3Re4ZY2eocyH72jpQ.text: Unbelievably good. I'd come back just for the fries. I had the fried catfish po'boy. It was the best po'boy I've ever had. Also tried the beignets, which were freshly made and better than the ones I've had at Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.

Sqt6lTF1vqzaoioouKBWyw.text: We enjoyed lunch here and the food was good and the service average. We had the hush puppies with crawfish and while tasty they were really small. For the main course I had the Catfish with Gouda Grits which was great. My wife had jambalaya which was just okay. The portion sizes were just right for lunch, not too big, but not small.

1s24jqAjXgp807PxpBBXMg.text: Hands down best place to get shrimp and grits! Great balance of spice and savory goodness.  Be sure to also gobble down Lola's red beans and rice (love mine with Cajun spice, adds a great kick!) Awesome place to enjoy the cozy atmosphere with friends and fam.

01OYQAla6d-sykA0s8WScw.text: Great food.  Fast, attentive service.  Good prices.   What more can you ask for!

5j-xTQ7_wDdXIRCTdqcrdQ.text: I've never liked crawfish, or gumbo. Leave it to Lola's to have the best!! Cutest decor and friendly staff

IZ3_AaQ-VskEZW79U7fnGQ.text: Get your britches in here, order the shrimp and grits AND the beef po' boy. Shut up, don't argue, just do it. Split both with someone, get a sweet tea too and then commence yummy sounds... No dinner convo required,  although a tums might be.

T6v3Pg8ByeVai0TLyIeKIw.text: Lola's is quickly becoming a favorite place for my husband and I. We have been several times, tried different dishes each time and never been disappointed. I am from Shreveport/Bossier Louisiana, so am kind of snobby when it comes to Louisiana cuisine. Everything I have eaten there has been wonderful and reminded me of home. The gouda grits are absolutely amazing!!! The ambiance is wonderful and makes me feel like I am sitting in a restaurant in my home state and service is fast and friendly. If you love Louisiana cooking, go! you won't be disappointed.

PNuSVbDYEgeX1lGyCNeUdA.text: The most amazing Cajun food in Vegas!  For brunch they have praline bacon!  What!!  The red beans and rice are so amazing and authentic.

6IdtQjPZ0faLiZ8Q3-s5NA.text: Great soft shell crab and fried catfish. I love having classic cajun food less than a mile away from my house! 10+ stars

vJWt7a0sUkHxrCcBtrCPjw.text: Came here on a Tuesday night around 8 pm. We were asked to wait for about 10 mins because there were no seats available. As we were sat down, I noticed at least 2 other empty tables. Why weren't we sat earlier? Whatever, we were hungry and tired. We ordered the Jambalaya and the Gumbo. The Jambalaya was very flavorful but a bit too spicy. I was sharing dishes with the boyfriend so I had the Jambalaya first. As I moved on and had the Gumbo, I tasted nothing but the texture from the Okra. But I really enjoyed the Jambalaya. Though it was a bit spicy, it was good. So food wise, it's a place to try. As for the service, let's just say that the bread was not given to us until our food came out.

e5L1Au7RQukWLwOKUNtiJg.text: The food is par to sub-par in quality. It was sloppy and rushed and in no way memorable. We were excited to have a nicer local restaurant so close by, but this was so blah-I don't know I would be back.  However, the banana pudding was pretty good-I'd try that again but nothing else to write home about.  I'm editing the review because my neighbors went and got food poisoning. Not a neighborhood gem, more like a dive with sub-par food. Beware!

bbdieOzGkfB-ls1-emrSig.text: Average, at best.  Service is slow.  Servers are generally not efficient or overly polite.  Worst problem is everything is over-priced.  Plus usually the place is freezing cold and nobody seems to notice.  It's obvious that the owners do not pay much attention to their business operation.  Hush Puppy is a much better option with much larger servings and better prices, the only reason we occasionally try Lola's is because of its location.

Fd8rOGKlDIuh0Dh7vSa7Kw.text: One of the best and reasonably  priced brunches one had in a long time.  Waffle was awesome with a variety  of flavored butters...

BUAe7mZR_5jGGTnSzwKQCg.text: My cousin and I wanted to check this place out (I was craving gumbo) so we did. After, we decided we'll go back. The price was right, the atmosphere was very nice and relaxed, the service was good and knowledgeable. The food was yummy, everything each one of us ordered was cooked well, seasoned well, and tasteful. I only gave four stars because even though the food was good I feel it wasn't "OH MY GOD GOOD"!

NFjIsirVc8C6HfZzkxSUEw.text: I took my husband here for Father's Day. Kendra was my server. I order bottomless Mimosa. My sever didn't provide me bottomless because of some weak excuse about only having 1 large container for the entire restaurant. I will not come to this location again. I live in Henderson and I drove on the other side of town to be provided with poor service. I tip accordingly to my service this will be a 5% tip. So disappointed. Oh and the food was not the greatest. So disappointed! Very Sad.

K0YxhR4ktIUyaf5V3k-yqg.text: We had the best time.  No rush, just a very enjoyable evening for four.  The hanger steak special was the BOMB.  Loved the shrimp and grits.  Best grits in Las Vegas.  Service...wonderful.  go, you won't be disappointed.

4B7n6c_gPbnsmAJ046BAMg.text: ONOLICIOUS!!! The first time I came here i tried the Jambalaya. So far, it's THE BEST Jambalaya I've ever tasted!!! It is a great place! The staff here are friendly and this place looks great!!

_Ovn7LoeOUEU7c28FPBdgg.text: This place is way better than I expected.  Red beans and rice is phenomenal. The fries are absolutely the best anywhere, super crispy and actual potatoes! This is definitely a great little piece of New Orleans in Las Vegas and a welcome independent experience in Summerlin.  Everyone should try this place!

pYXD7emB-H3IYYwxKVQcfQ.text: The jambalaya was delicious, but the bananas Foster bread pudding was incredible! Service was very good and the ambiance was nice.

w8rXIizhTIkF1J3aXv0-2Q.text: To be fair we ate there the first day they opened so there was a lot of issues. The A/C was not working properly so it was hot and steamy...maybe they were trying to replicate summer in New Orleans but it did not make for a pleasant dinner. Service was ridiculously slow and they could not get the credit card machine to work so we ended up paying cash after waiting nearly 40 minutes to track down our waitress to find out what the hold up was. Food was ok...crab cakes were really good but the rest was mediocre. So I went back a few weeks later and they still have issues with the A/C. Service was better but not what it should be. We asked for bread and it did not come until nearly the end of our meal. Eek! Had the crab cake again...I really liked it. My husband thought it was so-so. The shrimp and grits were amazing. Our son had the Crawpuppies and they were bad...none of us enjoyed the over cooked, fried mess. The gumbo was yummy and our son also enjoyed the red beans and rice. We tried Bananas Foster for dessert and hubby loved it, son and I thought it was just ok. Their wine selection by the glass is miserable. Overall there were a couple stand outs but not worth going back for.  Maybe they will get their act together as we were hoping to get a really good new restaurant in Summerlin. I'm still over the moon about Jacques in the Trails in Summerlin.

ucYlWyMieWiGTBcT7frWtg.text: Came in tonight for some food after watching the boring Jason Bourne movie.  Our server by the way gave us great service and was very attentive with my Arnold palmer refills.  I started with the wings and French fries.  I have to say that I have never paid $8.59 for only 5 wings.  They were of average taste and served over a bed of French fries.  I probably won't order the wings again. The wings did one with their homemade blue cheese and that was excellent.  I had the bronzed shrimp and sausage with grits for the first time.  That was an amazing dish and I will definitely try it again.  Amber and her team gave great service.  They were right there if we needed anything.  They also did a great time with prebussing to keep our table clean.

uUH0mlVn8TFkwcF2X14rLQ.text: I don't know. To be fair I was disappointed. I was so excited so maybe that's part of it.   The good - the grits. They're very good. My wife had the shrimp and grits which was excellent. The side of grits with cheese that my mom had with the oysters was also good.   The great - the service. All of the staff busted ass. They were attentive and polite.   The bad - the gumbo was very over salted. So was the shrimp po boy which is what I had.   For all the good reviews I was left missing Chicago and a place called heaven on seven.

zYl0FAMVSR6Mu6Y-88DV6Q.text: So happy to have one of our favorites in the neighborhood! Gumbo, crawfish etouffee, shrimp creole, shrimp n grits, po' boys and Abita on tap! Little bit of Nawlins in the hood! Whoop!

9LkMCA9uC5nXgul4INP0sA.text: This has to be one of the most disappointing meals I've had.  It certainly isn't real Louisiana food.  The portions were so small, the wine pour was tiny and the food had no taste - I had to put a lot of salt and pepper just to taste something.  What a waste of $.

b2nuTmEeO8X_4mj9GFOItQ.text: I came to Lola's Summerlin on New Year's Day because the Downtown location was closed.  I absolutely love both locations now.  Summerlin is much larger than Downtown but both locations serve excellent food.  Every time I have gone to Lola's I have experienced good food and good service.  While all of the food is good my favorite is when they have the Crawfish, after this I love the catfish, gumbo, crab cakes, greens, crawfish balls and Etouffee and of course excellent bread.  This is my go to place every time I visit Vegas.

o9tu7WndHfOzWXZAZm1a0g.text: I have been to the original Lola's which has great food but I was not at all impressed with their service. But the new Lola's in summerlin was amazing. Loved the building and the fact that they show the LSU and Saints games. We went there for brunch and bottomless mimosas, the food and service was wonderful. Highly recommend this place to anyone who knows southern cooking.

9IE_q-UMhazzh4rUkmjDBg.text: Sorry, not a big fan. I had been to the original Lola's on Charleston where I had their shrimp and grits. That was amazing! My kids had chicken tenders then too. Surprised how tasty the tenders were. Could swear they were fresh and not frozen. Fast forward to the present. As a frequent visitor on foodie trips to New Orleans, I was excited to have that great cooking right here. Tried Lola's after they opened on Town Center a while back. Food was good, but I found their prices to be expensive relative for the amount of food received. I was disappointed. Revisited the place a month ago at happy hour. My overall impression was unchanged; service was adequate, food good, and drinks standard. This place is okay, but does not rate high on my list of places to return to as there are many other wonderful places to enjoy. Guess it's still the closest New Orleans cooking you're going to get in Vegas.

jn0Ps0Xa_PY5OokB5F17Tg.text: The ambiance was pretty good for a Vegas resto.  Better than the usual franchise or strip mall setting... still a little too dark for my taste.  The service was mediocre, we sat in the bar so I didn't have super high expectations on that front.  The crab cake was pretty marginal.  There was more cake than crab and seriously... squirting mayo on as a garnish is something I would expect to see at Red Lobster (not that I have ever eaten there) not a garnish I would expect from someone that calls themselves a "chef".  This appetizer was served on a small saucer barely large enough to hold the crab cake so that each time I tried to take a bite the sad looking leaves of spinach (not bed of mixed greens) slid on to the table.  The gumbo was a salty cup of brown sludge which was mostly rice and somewhat grainy.  The sweet potato fries were dry.  The bronzed catfish & grits presentation left a lot to be desired.  On a positive note the fig delight was indeed just that, a delight.  We got out for $170 with tip for 4 people.  When considering this included 2 HH drinks and only 3 entrees and factoring in the quality of the food this didn't feel like a good value.

jZxeMUTLlvyG87Vm9-CJcQ.text: Pretty bad experience . My wife and I went there the other night and had a bad experience. First off, we are both from New Orleans and live here now. I do understand that the food might not be just like we would get in New Orleans, but was hoping for something close. Ordered cocktails, then appetizers. Wife got the crab cake and I got a cup of gumbo. The waitress then came back after a bit and we ordered dinner. Shrimp and grits and an oyster po boy. Waited a while and the food came before the appetizers. We told them that we didn't get our appetizers yet and then a guy walks up with the appetizers, but it wasn't our appetizers, wrong table. So, they wanted to leave the dinner and we said we would like to have the appetizers first. Then we were concerned our dinner would just sit in the kitchen and get cold. She assured my wife that "it will be made again special, just for you". So, they bring the correct appetizers out and the crab cake was ok. The gumbo was nothing close to a real gumbo. The flavor was all off and even the okra was CRUNCHY!! I'm not a chef, but I do know you have to cook the okra down. So, I added some seasoning and hot sauce and had just a couple of bites, and guess what? Our food comes out again!! So, we finished our appetizers and my wife bites into a shrimp and the food is cold. She sent it back and did not want it again. The oyster po boy was pretty bland, no seasoning and too much corn meal. However, the French Bread was good. So, we then order desert. Decide to go with bananas foster, which is pretty simple to make and can't really screw that up. Wrong!!! They put a raw banana in the sauce with ice cream. You are supposed to cook the banana a bit in the sauce. We cut into the banana and it was probably just peeled and put in. Then later, I got sick, just me, not my wife and had stomach issues until the next afternoon. Needless to say, we will never go back. I hope that someone from Lola's does read this and can address these issues. If you are going to represent being a New Orleans style restaurant, it should be. The atmosphere and decor remind me of home, but not the food.

bQ0idIObFjq77ukOXfDrSw.text: I love Lola's! We usually eat at the downtown location as it's between work and home but I also have eaten at this location (town center drive). Both have great atmosphere and good servers but the food is why I go (and I often get "food to go").  My favorite is probably the house salad (actually called "Signature Orange Bowl Salad"). I usually get it with the grilled chicken. Great proportions so that each bite has most of all the ingredients (dried cranberries, orange segments, lettuce, candied almonds, good house vinaigrette, celery, and that grilled chicken - might be missing some ingredients but you get the picture). YUM - literally delicious and nutritious.  I also love their hamburgers (fully dressed of course) with fries. Good heavens those fries are good and the hamburger is juicy and well seasoned - simply tastes great! My husband loves their chicken strips and the house-made ranch dressing is outstanding. I also absolutely love the chargrilled oysters - and that bread to sop up all the juices. An amazing dish - just a great mix of flavors. Their desserts are great too (chocolate cake or banana foster/bread pudding are my favorites - both moist and full of flavor and I usually share (but sometimes we each get our own chocolate cake (and comes with delicious vanilla ice-cream). I am making myself hungry just thinking about it.

yRSucWIWJO22Pud9LgNJwg.text: Visited soon after the place opened on September 19th. Was really excited to have something different near the house.When we got there we noticed that it was really hot inside. We had previously made reservations and requested a round table. Hostess proceeds to take us to a long table that had more chairs than what was needed. We asked the hostess if we could please be seated at a round table as requested. After 5 minutes they took us to a back room that had the round table. This room felt even warmer but we didn't want to leave since we were all hungry. The good thing is that they had fans. Ordered 3 cocktails and 3 waters and it took the waitress 10 + minutes to deliver the water and cocktails. To top it off she had to carry it all because she didn't know how to use a tray. I know they had tray's because I saw other staff using them. As for the food, it was not good. Maybe I should have waited for them to get the kinks out. Might give them one more try just to see if what I experienced was because the place had recently opened.

Bn_2tAdnky-YQW6NP3kZ1Q.text: outstanding gem in summerlin.  if cajun food sounds weird  just try it.  the flavors a great.  you can get a really good lunch for $15 and the service is fast and good.

0GYGsdHUIQmdVbjdc1MEgQ.text: Atmosphere wasn't very authentic. It looked like a British pub that they took over. Waiter was very friendly and helpful. Prices were good. Food was tasty. The 3 is just because I wasn't overly thrilled with the presentation or the variety most Cajun restaurants have bigger variety.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s8rF4WjE1P_DRCT4_pt9VQ.text: Served frozen then microwaved chicken fingers and fries. Soggy po'boy no flavor. Service was good but food is definitely not a 4-star experience.

Tz8wmvxNiwqezZJGow4T7A.text: We love New Orleans style food and we've been to several NOLA style restaurants in many cities.  This was by far the best NOLA style food we have ever had outside of New Orleans.  Plus their menu is very extensive and give you lots of choices for plates or ala carte items.  We live in SoCal but will go back to Lola's next time we visit Las Vegas.

uChfsS-PAprEAubcM57y_A.text: On Dirty Dining!!!!! And I fucking ate here. Gross as fuck!!! Over 30 violations if I recall right.

nYi8x5s1gYCllTgv0NcfPg.text: Have been craving some Cajun food for a while so we went to check out Lola's.  Seated right away, atmosphere was warm, nice live piano music.  Server was friendly and knew the menu well, might have exaggerated the flavors slightly or the kitchen was having an off night.  We ordered a garlic bread to start along with a cup each of gumbo and jambalaya, gumbo was tasteless, more of a bean taste, needed hot sauce and seasoning.  Jambalaya was nice, has a nice heat level.  Bread was dropped off, it was crunchy yet soft and quite nice, however we could not taste any garlic.  Turned out it was a table bread and server forgot our garlic bread. I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with blackened chicken, was told it was rich and creamy and the chicken would be Cajun spiced.  She was right about the creamy sauce, however the super thin sliced chicken was dry and tasteless, had no taste at all to it.  Johan had the beef and gravy po-boy, it again was on the bland and dry side.  Server did not once check on our meals, not during appetizers or entrees. Will give the place another go sometime.

-Tm6AxZQotXNghu5-alAqg.text: I ordered the catfish poboy with French fries my sandwich was skimpy the fish had no taste and most of my fries where burnt on the other hand the server was very attentive and nice over all the food was a disappointing and  flavorless

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hs0vtVnRAhrmG69PDFtleg.text: Great food and service. Red beans and rice was totally perfect as was the gumbo. Worth the drive.

gfLy55YTwozypcY3_Ve8rA.text: Etoufffee, Jambalia, Gumbo, Oysters, Salmon, Po Boys, Bread Pudding...  Fresh ingredients (some from Lola's garden) prepared by a supurb chef, served by confident professional employees in an inviting space is a success formula that works every time!  Thank you Lola for creating the perfect gathering spot.  Kudos to you and your team.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N64BtjXGQeuYYv7Npup5Ag.text: We were so disappointed with our visit to Lola's this evening. We have gone here many times before and the food seems to be getting worse with each visit. My fried chicken breast was completely flavorless and my green beans were hard to eat because they had not been cleaned properly (strings still attached to many). My wife's barbecue shrimp had to be sent back because the shrimp were so tough that it made them inedible. They even started charging for bread unless you purchased a 'soupy' dish. The only saving grace was our waiter, Tony. He was extremely friendly, apologetic for the issues, and on top of our table even though he was bussing his own tables and running out all food. He even had the shrimp dish removed from our bill and the bread charge waived because we got so much. He will be the reason we give Lola's another shot. We really hope that next time will be better!

AOs5sV3b6rPqFAlsvLElRA.text: Had dinner here last night and yummy!! I had the Blacked Chicken and Shrimp Fettuccini Alfredo. So tasty and cheezy. My husband had the Blacked Shrimp and Grits. They were the best creamiest grits I had ever tasted. The ambiance in this place was soulful. It was like being in the south. Everyone had a smile on their face and greeted you at every turn. The staff was eager to make sure your experience was pleasant. The piano player was the topping on the cake. Good food and good music!!

6d-vFEEftpOAeUW_NnAL4Q.text: We went Here today for Father's Day! First, they were very accommodating with our reservation when we wanted to change our reservation from 3 to 7. They have the table set up for us when we got there and we had a private little area in the back room. The food was amazing!! Most importantly, my dad had his bananas Foster's French toast which gave him a great Father's Day! We will definitely be back here and seriously love the food!

DWda1lLbpVwHmLROPSDGWw.text: Great food, decent service, moderate-high price, but LOVE the little parking lot garden.   I've been twice now, once for brunch and the other for dinner.   Brunch: Great! I had the catfish plate that included two sides of my choice (Grits and Green beans) oh and all you can drink mimosas. Our server was pretty good with the mimosas constantly returning to refill them.  Dinner: OK. We first started in the bar area because it looked cozy so we sat there, they checked our IDs and my friend was searching for her in her purse. Before she could even come to the conclusion she didn't have it the bartender started stating of nevada state liquor statutes. He was so rude. I would have expected him to say, "no worries, you can still dine with us in the dinning room." but no, so i was really not thrilled with him. I chose not to drink in the dining area just because of him. Our dining room waitress on the other hand was lovely and took care of us well.   *Very disappointed to see that Grits is no longer an option as a side for the dinner entree's. You have to purchase a small bowl of it from the grits section for almost $7. It ended up being cheaper for me to purchase the catfish and grits meal with a side of vegetables.

GEofU8TE3ZTBMcG9VrvXVg.text: Love this place! A must visit every time I come to Vegas. You need an Uber or Lyft to get here but it is definitely worth the trip. Try the gumbo,  and the red snapper and grits and you wont  be disappointed. The drinks are good too.

UhlRgcG9FiihpnnKCg6EPA.text: Had the Shrimp Remoulade:  "New Orleans tradition! Shrimp dressed in a traditional Remoulade sauce, served on a bed of shredded iceberg " which I really enjoyed! It was light and fresh and had plenty of delicious shrimp.  I love the decor here and the outdoor patio was very inviting even though we decided to eat inside. I was visiting a friend and she took me here and I am happy she did!

5qBAAfO-5puqiT_rIcSF4Q.text: The food is outstanding and the service is great!  However, the servers looked more like homeless people. Unkept hair, tatoos all over the place, unshaven faces and dirty clothing.  It makes you wonder how often they wash their hands and what the kitchen looks like.   I'll give it one more try in a couple of weeks and If things haven't changed, I won't go back.

EkXXhn7mdR74zBVvMMXXKw.text: Typical southern cuisine but a lot more expensive than the south!  Came for lunch one day and we ordered a bunch of food to share. Got the fried platter which came with 2 of each of the fried catfish, chicken and some other things. The ingredients were of low quality and not very tasty at all. We also ordered the gumbo and the flavor were ok just waaaay too much rice.   Service was also pretty spotty. The outside patio area is very nice on a cool fall afternoon but probably not good during the winter or summer.

XeEL7D9vSeo7W2UN9FFPaA.text: One word:  overrated.  It's expensive and the cook must have retired.

HBI76bf96j4N6W7thBkBBw.text: Lola's has an amazing environment and a great wait staff. We were cared for well. The food was a trip down memory lane of his 'Mawmaw's' cooking for my Cajun husband. Could not come with a stronger recommendation. Chandler took great care of us!

RCFY82bMHqwJcXPfXezyow.text: I think this is the best place to eat in Las Vegas!! If you want something like mom made in the kitchen. Please, please check out Lola's Kitchen... the locals really know where to go for great food!! The staff is great and Lola is there sometimes cooking herself!!   Thanks for the great food and great service.  Mr & Mrs Parker , San Diego CA

jSHXP01d6XCBJHlHs42IrQ.text: A little off the beaten path in Summerlin, but well worth seeking it out for authentic bayou food. Catfish, shrimp, crawdads, mussels among other Louisiana delectables with a choice of down home sides are the mainstays here, prepared most any way you like it.  For real authenticity try the bronzed catfish with grits and andouille sausage -- my favorite.    You won't go wrong with any of their menu specialties.

DAIdb1pm3gpJHHzA_DVZqA.text: My tastebuds are telling me 2 stars, but it could be a 3.  I went to Lola's for brunch a couple of weeks ago. The decor is... random. It was if I was walking into my great Aunt Sally's house who had inherited chairs and tables from thrift shops, garage sales and family members. Maybe that's the theme they were going for?  I was really underwhelmed by their menu selection, but per the waitresses suggestion, I settled on the catfish and grits. I have never had grits in my life, but cheese and starch didn't sound terrible. The catfish and sausage ragout were amazing. The only thing standing in the way of my appetizing dish were those nasty cheese grits! They tasted like salty baby food, just awful!  Service was unmemorable. The portions was pretty small for $16.99, but did I really want more cheese grits? Nope! I hear the bananas foster chicken and waffles is good. I'll try that next time.

HfTisk8Jcr3hNuLafHW6jA.text: With the closing of Commander's Palace in Las Vegas, I thought I would never find another good Cajun/Creole restaurant in town....until now.  The roast beef Po' Boys are better than what I've had in New Orleans!  Lola's makes the best banana pudding I've ever tasted. No soul food restaurant in Vegas can compare to their heavenly banana pudding.

YkYOPADAVyOOKQfr5bD6FQ.text: Don't get the crawfish puppies... they're over priced and bland tiny little balls. The crab cake was good value at 6.99 for a nice size. Crawfish ettouffe had no flavor. Shrimp and grits were good but a bit in the salty side. The garlic bread app was grilled bread with no garlic flavor and was overpriced. Good service and nice ambience but food was mediocre at best.

M3oYuyriS8j_TSYBW6gstw.text: Left a bad taste in my mouth. Went here 5pm Sunday drinks were fine, ordered wine and a beer and ambiance inside was nice. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. Husband ordered crab cakes which is his go to when available at a restaurant and said was one of the worst he had ever ordered. I ordered blackened chicken which comes with two sides. After checking list of sides I went for grilled veggies and beans and rice. Chicken was just ok, didn't taste any different than the Cajun spice you buy at the grocery story. Nothing special and definitely not restaurant quality. Up to this point I would give 3 or 3.5 stars.  Bill comes and I see if was charged $4 for an extra side. Assuming this is a mistake I let our server know who takes the check away apologizing that she will sort it. She speaks to Lola who tells her that it is correct, I ordered a premium side and I need to pay for it. I re check the menu and it said 'you may be charged extra for premium sides' which, fine. But don't send uninformed staff to tables for a normal order and not inform? Also.. how is paying full price for a side while not getting the two that I paid for fair at all? $4 is not the end of the world but it's the audacity and poor customer service that left the bad taste. I didn't receive what I paid for and was charged extra for something that was not clear. Wanted to return to try the poutine but forget it don't want to give them my business.

UDlV9HhzgmrdLJpHlWcYew.text: Sweet potato pie anyone? If not, then go straight for the handful of bread pudding options, sure to add a few inches around the waistline. But lets not get stuck on the dessert menu... Amazing food and a dangerously addictive house scotch will leave you in a heap of trouble, as you attempt to eat your soft shelled crab and shrimp etouffee through the bottom of your 4 empty glasses. Trust me, this scotch is THAT good. I am convinced some magic's are involved in the mixing of this drink. If you do manage to pull away from the drink while still managing sobriety, you will also find the gumbo is quite tasty as well. Oh yes I know good gumbo, and they do it well here. Prepare your forks ladies and gentlemen!

5aJuajaQm2Q8rQJhADH22A.text: Great food and atmosphere, perfect for Mardi Gras Day!

p7U8Hl5oDs2oQ2O2rCkUVg.text: Food was great!  Owner and staff very friendly.  We will be back!  Oh yeah love the man buns! LOL

uaSzrwyarrnmSShwkTmjOw.text: Discovered this place by accident.....it was awsome! Shrimp and grits was the best I ever had.  Crab cakes were great, and the banana pudding was ridiculous! Top all that off with great service and atmosphere, this place is a winner.

5KUpyIDHGbX-3p3eBQEqSw.text: Here's my quick review of Lola's in Summerlin.  Yes, that's right.  Lola's has opened their doors in Summerlin.  If you've been to the location off Charleston near the Smith Center, then you know what to expect here and that's good grubbin' Nawlins' style.  Unlike the original location out here, this one has more space, doesn't seem to be as busy, and is a lot cleaner.  That being said, I'm still a fan of the original.  However, if I have choice, I'd make my way here when I'm craving the authentic stuff from Louisiana.  We dined on a mid-week night and it was far from busy.  Our servers were pretty good too.  But let's discuss what's really important and that's the food.  I got their the crab cake and their Bronzed Shrimp & Grits.  This was my first time trying their crab cake and it's huge, a creamy for a crab cake, and packed with flavorful crab.  As for their, Bronzed Shrimp & Grits, still as good as it get.  You get huge pieces of shrimp on top of their grits, sausage, and mushrooms.  This was seasoned just right and you can't go wrong with this dish.  In fact, this is the only entree that I have ever ordered when I dined at the original location.  I guess I should be try something different like their Po-Boys, the chicken & waffles, their jambalaya, or their oysters the next time I'm in.  But then again, it's too hard for me to pass up their Bronzed Shrimp & Grits.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bronzed Shrimp &amp; Grits
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cake
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Menu

p8TsctJmbmQt-NIwr2JOQQ.text: Have been here several times.  We WANT to love it  as we have a sentimental connection to NOLA.  Yet, as hard as we have tried, it continually falls short.  The food is decent but I'm sure any New Orleanian would say the same thing:  there's just no genuine Southern hospitality or love.  It seems to come from the owner Lola.  She offers no "warmth" to the guests or even her staff - just cold.  If you sit in the bar, she just broods and frowns and makes it feel like any other faceless, cold bar in any town.  Nothing is genuine New Orleans except Dominic the bartender ~ he's a gem.

nQSDTOiK58MD-cJH15SEbQ.text: Items Selected: Beignets Cinnamon Roll Baked French Toast with Norris Cane Syrup Andouille Sausage Leidenheimer Grilled Garlic Bread Fried Chicken and Fresh Baked Waffle with Roasted Pecan, Fig, Strawberry Butter Bronzed Catfish and Grits over Gouda Grits with Andouille Sausage and Mushroom Ragout Bronzed Shrimp and Grits over Gouda Grits with Andouille Sausage and Mushroom Ragout Sweet Potato Pecan Pie with Chantilly Cream Louisiana Chocolate Cake with Vanilla Bean Ice Cream Bananas Foster Bread Pudding with Vanilla Bean Ice Cream  Owned by Lola Elizabeth Pokorny, with one successful spot already located downtown, Lola's: A Louisiana Kitchen in Summerlin opened without much fanfare amidst the hubbub surrounding the 'new' Downtown, but with the mall mobbed by crowds a short drive up Town Center Drive found Ms. Pokorny's renovated space to be a pleasant experience - the truncated and unannounced 'weekend brunch' menu aside.  Apparently once a Ruby Tuesday, with a sunny patio offering an al fresco option to those not sold on modest Mardi Gras decor, our party of three was sat quickly at a cozy four-top and with the dining room mostly empty while the bar bustled with football our service could not have been better, a duo of young ladies eager to answer questions and seek feedback while beverages remained brimming.   Happily conversing beneath upbeat Cajun instrumentals it would not be long after ordering that the first round of food would arrive and although beignets were a bit too 'bready' while Leidenheimer French Toast proved overpriced and underwhelming compared to the restaurant's signature bread pudding both the supple cinnamon roll and spicy sausage were excellent, the later a recurring theme in round two.  Admittedly a bit disappointed in the lack of oysters on the brunch menu, but soon to find solace in items offered as "signatures," it was with two plates of creamy gouda grits that the meal moved on and with the stick-a-spoon-up-straight base punched up by rich mushroom gravy and snappy Andouille both the shrimp and flaky fish equally shined, an order of chicken and waffles entirely forgettable in the face of such greatness as I mopped the bowls clean with complimentary grilled bread loaded with garlic.  At last arriving at dessert, the full menu offered in addition to two specials, it seemed only proper to select the items designated as Lola's signatures and although the soft chocolate cake was light yet intense while the hybrid pie was truly a 'best of both worlds' amalgam of sweet and savory neither could compare to the bread pudding - a steamy block of custard teaming with cinnamon beneath praline crunch and brown sugar sauce tinged with rum.  Long lamented for being a cookie-cutter planned community where PF Changs and Olive Garden continue to generate long lines, Lola's is a welcome addition to the area and the sort of place I can only hope continues to proliferate West as "Downtown Summerlin" develops.  Obviously new and still finding its footing, particularly with regard to a 'brunch' menu that seems muddled and poorly conceptualized in its lack of NOLA favorites like oysters or crawfish, I look forward to seeing how the restaurant evolves over time and only hope that the unwieldy location does not prove too daunting for those preferring to stick to the same ol' same ol' spots further south.

gIp-mFnfMtCepnFJ84M2Kg.text: Very disappointing Louisiana style food, especially at these prices. I tried the Gouda Grits, which were mouth puckering salty. I tried the gumbo, which was a tiny little cup, and very bland. Seriously, if you need to know where to get some decent andouille sausage, I can show you. The red beans and rice was bland as well, probably due to the flavorless sausage again. I won't be back; I can get better gumbo and red beans and rice out of a box.

as1dC1dTx7fiph-gbL9ReA.text: This is the 2nd location, and they have a full bar and are open on Sunday's with a brunch menu that I love!  Reasonably priced brunch items include my fav, the soft shell crab Benedict.  They also do fresh made beignets on Sunday for brunch only.  Yum!!!!

hR9I50cm5I5Msb5iML0aYw.text: Same foods, same great flavors, same menus, but a more comfortable setting and a full bar.  I do enjoy stoping by when I'm in town

qbazzqtVYRlNgAoaqvVAzQ.text: First time here for my birthday and I will definitely be returning.  My friend and I split the bronzed shrimp and grits and the soft shell crab po boy.  Shrimp and grits were to die for!  My son ate every last bit of the soft shell crab platter and my daughter enjoyed the fried shrimp platter.

MI6TpUOUUuFaD9xehpuBGw.text: This place has excellent food, desserts and service. Full bar with TVs for entertainment, good for large parties, seems pretty relaxed, but nice enough place for a date. Has a separate dining area from the bar,  and has a large room for large family gatherings or corporate lunch meetings.

o5mCg6KTwMJ_gmV-PxhVHg.text: My husband's family is from Louisiana so he is a tough  critic....And he says it was the most authentic he has had outside of Louisiana...leave room for the bread pudding it is the best!

YPk_TTy6Gl0aqqlG8coQ0g.text: Lola's shrimp and Gouda grits with ragu is still on my last meal menu.

kcrg8LUQL5eVHQykqsYhjg.text: We tried a little of everything. Purple Haze on draft, crawfish puppies, chargrilled oysters, red beans and rice, pecan crusted trout with Gouda grits, and ettoufee. Banana fosters bread pudding for dessert. Everything was amazing! I would recommend everything we tried!

euEA7LPmVHD2HWigGns7Ag.text: I came with a fairly large group of people... Half of them loved their meal... Half of them were lukewarm. I had the crab cakes made with lump crab, and I have to say there were no lumps of crab to be found- these were mostly filler and highly disappointing.

yqIu8H16K5AeGIYL00M1PQ.text: Atmosphere was very relaxed and was not too loud. There was very nice live music that was calming and did not interupt conversations. The food was above average. Favorites were the oyster poboy and soft shell crab. I thought the bronzed cat fish was over priced. A third of the dish was the sausage, another third was grits and the rest was the fish. The sweet potato pecan pie was not worth eating.  The whole experience was ruined by the waitress. The service we got from her was terrible. My son's ice cream has part of the plastic wrapper in it. When we told her she didnt even say sorry and just brought us another one. A sorry would have gone a long way.   I am disappointed with the whole experience at this restaurant. Again, my experience would have been better is we got another waitress. Everyone else was very nice.

FCAmwykZeHSrbP_eBWUShg.text: Just a top tier dining experience. Excellent and attentive service by waitstaff, have recommendations and was friendly throughout the time we were there. Kudos to the chef and bartender for the amazing creations that blessed our table!! We had the mandarin salad with grilled shrimp, the blackened catfish platter, crawpuppies, and the Bronzed catfish and shrimp Grits. Along with all that we indulged in desserts of butter pecan ice cream, decadent chocolate cake w ice cream and a warm and sinful bananas foster bread pudding. Drinks enjoyed were the Hurricane and the addictive Southern Hospitali-Tea.

OXK40E26lQQBaFNPy_ZeUw.text: Ordered the gumbo, obviously supposed to be fresh and hot but wasn't even luke warm. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits, he said they were okay. Service was okay. Will never go back for food, can find better gumbo @ other places.

nD8VojeWjKmG3kp_UCYTRA.text: Great pick for a Saturday night dinner. It's listed as a Louisiana Kitchen and they have a large number of Cajun dishes. I had the shrimp appetizer along with the red beans and rice. The drinks are delicious too. Great quality food at a good value.

QLjDr1Ha-8SyYzdjn3JjUg.text: This location was is decent, until last night! We got there just around 6 PM, not crowded as usual. Had some live music. We waited at the hostess stand for 10 minutes, no one else was waiting to be seated. Three employees made eye contact with us yet no one ever greeted us or seated us! Again the place was nearly dead, only a few tables seated and a few people in the bar area. Again three employees made eye contact with us, could miss us, we're standing right in the doorway at the hostess stand where there was a big sign that said please wait to be seated! While the food is good here, customer service sucks ass! Doubt will ever go to this location again! Waiting to be seated where restaurant is busy is one thing, but when the place is dead and you've got employees see you standing there yet they don't want to acknowledge your existence, and clearly don't want your business... This restaurant will never last! After 10 minutes we turned around and left and went to another restaurant in the area were they were happy for our business! Probably wouldn't have posted on Yelp, but I contacted the restaurant, to no avail. Clearly management there could care less about the customers, or lack of business, or more importantly their employees who do not provide excellent customer service! Way to run a business!

xjFBzLR9cDpshGIgx42Dyw.text: Items ordered:  Gouda grits - this was the first time I had ever had grits. They were quite tasty. If definitely order that again  Shrimp remoulade - shrimp was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Very flavorful  Cheeseburger - cooked as I ordered. Definitely a homemade patty. Very good.   Shrimp Po Boy - shrimp was cooked perfectly. Very good except brea was over toasted so ends were way too hard.   Ate at the bar. So was entertained with conversation with the bartender Lora. And she made me a Malibu Bay Breeze, which I hadn't had in years, and it was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ujk-nO_uoL2E7vbsBqIWFA.text: We had Jambalaya and Gumbo. Both were delicious. Alex was our waiter. He did an amazing job!!! We WILL be back!

Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya is delicious!!!

6CPgEinH1EyvnsTIKFAXxA.text: Went there for Saturday lunch and the place was empty.  Should've gave me a hint.  The jambalaya was terrible.  Seemed like it was made out of canned tomato sauce and rice was hard.  Ice Tea was warm.  Not compared to Lola's at Charleston.  Chicken Strips were hard.  Fries were over salted.  Waiter never checked on us.  Burger was okay.

2RFzOQCwJK03B6pm5ao7Iw.text: Visited last week after showing up last Saturday only to discover, once there, that they opened at noon. Anyway, ordered bread and was informed that they now charge $4.99 unless you order certain meals then it's included. I ordered the loaded jambalaya. What I received was a serving of regular jambalaya with three shrimp and some fried sausage slices added to the top. Not much effort put into that dish. And I think the portion, about 8 ounces, was rather small for the price. Let the new manager/partner know of the error of the posted hours on the website and Google and he felt the need to prove me wrong about the website. Okay. I was wrong about the website still being incorrect. Was proving me wrong in that way worth losing me, my family, and anyone I talk to, worth him proving to me that he was right? Maybe I'm overreacting, maybe he could have been more appreciative of the info I was passing along.

yfuD5RtZZ-4EAhIN9Dw8uA.text: Spicy! Seasoned vs blackened you're dealing with a different spice palette. The grits were delicious and the shrimp was tasty. I had mine without the ragu & it was still too spicy for my taste, but cooked well for sure. We also had the crab & artichoke dip which was super yum, a couple glasses of wine & dessert. It was a great ambiance (you'd never know what the place was before if you hadn't ever been there) and our waiter was hilarious and attentive. They let us linger long after dinner to finish watching the game. All in all, good food, especially if you like spicy, good ambiance & wine. A tad pricy, but nice for a special occasion.

y4zopekSxgaqOWJ-r3xJjA.text: As I am writing this review, I am waiting for service with my pregnant wife and sister in-law. We frequent this establishment a lot and have nothing bad to say about it's good food and Great Desserts! Today sitting here watching this bartender serve everyone but us is becoming very annoying and disappointing. I am not lying we are sitting here for about 20 or so minutes waiting to be served by someone with no personality and completely rude! As I am finishing this review I am walking out the door and will never be back again. Hey you need great people working for you as well, even if your food is good. I am sorry but you lost me after we waited and was not even acknowledged, you were good before but today this taste is something I do not crave or deserve.

8V_zZl78XVeqnQYAeBIcVw.text: This place is fantastic! Every single item we ordered was delicious. The shrimp and grits (what I ordered) was so flavorful, I ate every last bite. I tried a little from everyone's plate, which included fettuccini Alfredo, salmon, and jambalaya, and all was delicious. The bread pudding was just right to end the night. I am definitely coming back to this restaurant.

HcOiH51v0myPRFSKPpQiyA.text: How we managed to get lucky enough, to have a place like Lola's right up the street from where we live, I'll never know. I'm also smart enough to know not to question it - just to be grateful and reap the benefits whenever we can.  And we DO!  The staff is as warm and friendly as the food is out of this world.  No matter WHAT it is you're getting, may I suggest one of the most heavenly side dishes you will ever eat...the Gouda Grits with the mushroom ragout.  Chef Lola was inspired by the divine when she whipped up that one.  It's not just good enough to spread onto a shoe and eat; I jokingly told her once that if I ever hit big money at one of the casinos, I want to fill up a bathtub with it and just dive in!!!  As for the other dishes, this is authentic Cajun/Creole-style cuisine.  I can remember having this kind of food when I was in 'Nawlins' last, so prepare yourself accordingly.  If you prefer your food on the milder, even blander side, this probably is NOT the place for you.  Though as far as my experience goes, nothing here is spicy enough to send you to the ER.  But this ain't bowls of Cream of Wheat, either.   My typical meal there always starts with the Hot Crab and Artichoke dip.  Served with the freshly grilled Garlic Bread, the creamy, salty goodness of the Dip, with hearty chunks of lump crabmeat and tender artichoke pieces is hard to go wrong with. I usually pair that up with the spicy, savory Crawpuppies.  To be honest, dealing with the real 'crawdads' freaks me out more than a bit, so it's nice that they infused the sweet, briny meat into these perfect spheres that marry it with a really good hush puppy recipe, served with a tasty aioli dipping sauce.   My favorite go-to for the 'Main Event' has become the boneless chicken breasts, which you can have one of four ways.  Mine is usually Blackened (with outrageous Cajun spices) or fried, with a choice of two sides. I would strongly suggest the aforementioned, nectar-of-the-gods Gouda grits, and the Low Country Greens, seasoned to a level that ALMOST rivals your Mama's. (And if it does, you already KNOW BETTER than to admit it!) The Country Potato Salad is also guaranteed to bring tears of joy to your eyes. But one of those two paired with any of the stunning veggie or french fry offerings will give you a tasty meal to remember.  And to insure that it stays in your memory banks for a good little while, save room - even if it means taking doggie bags with you - and go for one of Chef Lola's positively sinful desserts.   I shouldn't - and won't - list the sins I might be willing to commit, for another taste of that Bananas Foster Bread pudding.  The Bananas Foster and the Bread Pudding, separately are enough to make your stomach do the happy dance.  But COMBINED? If they served it at a NATO "peace summit", who knows? We might actually HAVE world peace, and Lola would be up for a Nobel Prize! And don't forget to pair it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.   Running a close second to that is the Fig Delight, a sumptuous serving of sweet, baked bodaciousness that came THISclose to unseating the BFBP as the ruler of my heart. Also good with that ice cream.  To sum it up, one visit to Lola's will tell you why we, and so many other people, have become regulars.  Nobody else in the Valley or outside of it is doing food like this, and we wish for a long and happy run for this restaurant...and plan on continuing helping it along that journey!

EaKxnhp_K5dl98sxBL0a-w.text: Wanted to try this place out again and they still have horrible service. Great food but service needs some improvement.

aFtXCt-Tn_pJkMhlsZy2ig.text: Lola: Sydney and I decided to try your Summerlin location this Fat Tuesday, same great food, a great atmosphere,  as we expected.  Erin our waiter was accommodating with just the right mix between attentiveness and leaving us in peace to eat.  Gilbert, the bus boy, was great as well, keeping drinks flowing and the right things off the table.  I know you read these so, congratulations to you on the Summerlin location and your excellent choice for staff and your proven menu.  Tell Matthew hi.

KC7tvoETChda8VgC0cmpdg.text: The food was good but the portions were small. We started with the crawpuppies which were tiny but the Cajun aioli was delicious. I ordered the shrimp creole which was tasty but I have a hearty appetite. Finished off with banana fosters bread pudding. The portion was large and very satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp creole

GyEAYAvohfk5uJwU7VFxSA.text: Unbelievable. When you just need a solid meal with quality ingredients and serious authenticity ... Lola's every time . The Bronze shrimp and grits will change your life .

Rk9YeFaI8jtNNHe6vx1trg.text: We have been to Lola's several times and I have to say this was not one of the best experiences.  As an appetizer we ordered the char broiled oysters and it was a disappointment because it did not come out as described on the menu.  The description read "Oysters on the half shell, flame flavored with a lemon garlic butter marinade, topped with Pecorino Romano cheese. Sizzling in the half shell straight to your table" but when we got them there was an unrecognizable taste that I didn't care for.  When the waitress came to take the plate away I asked her and she said that the marinade included their house dressing and I pointed out to her that the menu did not say anything about that.  Because we had eaten them they could not take it off the bill but they did offer to buy us dessert.  I just think that any item on a restaurant's menu needs to be described with everything that is included in the preparation. Thankfully we only ordered 1/2 dozen. My husband had the catfish with red beans and rice and I had the etouffee  and both of them we very good.  We took home the bread pudding for dessert.

jY3UqFQAiXEuUfoXoyc3AA.text: First day in Summerlin, we went here because it was across the street from where we were working. New Orleans Cajun menu, I had the Jambalaya with a side of red beans and rice. It was good but not great. Service was very good and they have a nice little bar.

js-Pqv-dScjKtm9Zx4vMQw.text: Food and service was great! Waiter was Kyle & he was very helpful to such a big party! Also the drinks were BOMB! Would definitely recommend :)

OxfzYlCkjpYMr439vn2DIg.text: I'm going to say if you haven't had authentic creole food or know how to cook you'd probably like it. It's mediocre for me. Me and my girlfriend went. We ordered soft shell crab appetizer to start it was bland no seasoning and it's one crab. Ok next we order a cup of gumbo that was more like a gravy sauce then a gumbo and not that flavorful the rue didn't cook long enough and it was thick. I ordered the Blackened Shrimp and Catfish & Gouda grits combo....that was an epic fail. The grits were good but I couldn't take more than a bite because the catfish was undercooked ... I sent it back and ordered a fried shrimp poboy ...at this point my palate for fish has been ruined so I try something fried it has to be fully cooked right ??? Well it was cooked cake with a side of home fries. The shrimp was plain not a drop of season nothing Cajun about it ..and with every bite the shrimp popped out the breading  ... needless to say I sent that back too. my girlfriend ordered Mississippi Deep Fried Catfish with a side of mixed greens and a baked Sweet potato ...alll basic as hell unseasoned. I wasn't charged for the shrimp amd grits but I wqs for the po'boy. At that point I just wanted to leave they can't help it their food just isn't it that's all. The service was also mediocre, we had to ask for silverware and napkins ...we never got the napkins. Safe to say I won't be back. I'm going to Emeril's next time I get a Creole craving or I'll drive to Arizona for Pappadeux's

kFQr25kbNl9LRTRJmPgxKA.text: The artichoke dip appetizer was yummy yummy. There were four of us. We had shrimp Po boy, catfish Po boy, a grilled shrimp dinner with sweet potato fries and bronzed catfish over grits. Everything was perfect.

XVbjscmI-SWyYlZq_gt3jQ.text: I was a little worried when we got here, it was really busy and the waitress seemed stressed.... But I was so happy when we left! We did have an appetizer go missing but the main courses were absolutely delicious. We've even lived in New Orleans and I can say for sure the food is great, we had the red beans and rice, gumbo, etouffe, catfish and grits, and some really great wine by the glass. We were lucky that we were there during Mardi Gras so they gave us a free slice of kind cake because of the appetizer. Overall great dinner and it's a very cute restaurant.

yeUJzj47sn-_PMMd3qXPeA.text: I was out of town and had Lola's on my GPS  it was ok but I really wanted lolo chicken and waffles

2eLdVoLCfjc0sOvD7BO1NQ.text: This is a good place for lunch. I've been there several times and the shrimp poor boy is delicious.  Portions good. Service good and ambiance is great. Especially if the weather permitting is great.

cQxd4lH3Wdpq9LIXSWujVQ.text: I am so happy that they opened this location. The other location is always busy and cramped. This location is in a nice area and I've never had to wait for a table. The food is excellent. It's top of the list when I'm craving cajun/creole which is not very easy to find in Las Vegas.

TJCtmd-MNc5Z4Ouhh2cQkA.text: 1st time at this location.  Ordered the Roast Beef D Brees.  The sandwich lacked the lettuce tomato, onion and definitely didn't taste the creole mustard or mayo!  The only savior to this sandwich was the gravy. The coleslaw was average.  I won't be ordering this again.  The decor and ambience was nice.  Our server was excellent.

aN9iBnVJnmsKbaqg_tefmw.text: Great service great food!  Thank you for such a nice dining experience we will be back sooner than later :)

DrNApTfKNrwoqXP1Ip-fSA.text: Husband has been wanting to come here in forever. Actually, it's the Charleston location that he wanted to visit. However, with two babies in tow and knowing space is limited...Summerlin location is the best fit for those who have stroller aged children. It was rather slow when we arrived. I clenched my butt as it was Father's Day and I was expecting chaos and a wait. But just as I told my husband on the way...nobody gives a shiz balls about Father's Day. Lol. We had reservations and so we were immediately seated. Probably because it was slow. The hostess was very welcoming and pleasant. I can only offer a 3 star rating because for one, I'm allergic to shellfish. Gumbo, and all that you come for gets thrown out the window. So, I opted for the blackened salmon with green beans and rice. It was literally a 2 star dish to me because my blackened fish, personally, was overcooked. Nothing exciting about it all. I mean, twas salmon. Tis all. I didn't expect my green beans to be like mush. It was like collard greens, bit made out of green beans. Perhaps I'm not as thoroughly familiar with southern food as I thought...but I really disliked the mushy green beans. Though, I ate the thing anyway because Iz wuz hungray. The husband ordered a small cup of their gumbo and had their jambalaya. He's such a whore to such dishes. I was hoping he'd ooh and aah and spice up my yelp review, but as much gumbo and jambalayas he's had...no oohs and aahs. He said they weren't bad. Just alright. Okay, if his fatass says just alright, then it's just alright. On a sidenote, he also had his eyes glued to the start of the game 7 nba finals so maybe he wasn't fully being one with his dish. BUT! BUT! If it was something that locked his jaw out of goodness, no NBA game could.prevent that. So I'll have to have faith in his just alright. I thought they'd bring out bread or something as you wait...I even thought they'd give bread with their gumbo or something, everything we ordered was literal. No garnishments to make it look fancy. No side pieces for flavor enhancement. You order the fish, you get the fish. While delicious food should not need fancy garnishments or bread to.scrape.your soups with...the fish would've tasted alot better had it had a lemon near it or something. I literally thought, I could've did this shhh...myself. We also ordered their fries which came out last! Seriously. There was a whiny baby with us who clearly NEEDED his fries because his life and mother's sanity depended on it. Hahaha. Their fries were pretty interesting though as there were different sizes of fries. There were thin and thick cuts and I feel like not having the monotony of same size cuts of potatoes is what made the fries. Weren't bad at all. Our server wasn't bad. He just gave off this I'm a new guy vibe so he seemed timid? Hesistant? Not sure. We asked for a high chair but my husband ended up grabbing one ourselves because our waiter clearly forgot. I think he was the bartender as well? Either way he served his purpose. Good enough. Overall, we spent 50 bucks on 2 alcohol beverages, fries, cup of gumbo, jambalaya, and salmon. It wasnt a complete satisfying-rub-my-belly-wholly-crap that was awesome 50 bucks, but we went out...we ate...it wasnt busy...staff was nice...they had the game on...we had a nice time anyway, so mission accomplished. Would be come back? Perhaps. Wouldn't go out of our way and probably wouldn't be on our list of "we should go to........" I will note that the front of their restaurant is their garden so it's nice to see fresh tomatoes growing knowing they're self-sustaining to a certain degree. Definitely kid friendly. Highchairs with working buckles, yay! Certainly stroller friendly if it isn't busy in there. If you need a southern fix that's not some.hole.in the wall...I'd recommend them.

My husband is originally from Georgia and as a southern boy he loves the Sweet Tea. Its legit super SWEET. I will be returning next time to try the gumbo and to check out the happy hour! When we went on Saturday, the drinks were 2 for 1.

jYW1c0IXEeg9upXlgvfc2A.text: Louisiana cusine home away from home that's legit for sure.  Just love the atmosphere it's fun & definitely a place anyone that appreciates cajun & creole food would love.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is legit!!! Food is excellent...

SJ4iQwBeNE8ojRn1Kko-gw.text: I love this place! Everything is delicious and the staff are great!! The grits are sooo creamy and the catfish is always cooked to perfection. They truly know how to bring Louisiana to Vegas !

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can&#39;t go wrong with the Tchoupitoulas... it&#39;s amazing EVERY TIME!

rYyuOERV7JLt7EFZ-i9llw.text: My sister sings along with the pianist sometimes. She's a grown adult, so that shows that they'll go along with most anything. It's my first time having good shrimp and grits in awhile. They grow their basil fresh, they're trying their best to grow tomatoes in Las Vegas, and you can tell they value freshness. The patio is lovely, the staff is kind, Lola herself is often telling fun stories at the bar. One time I went and someone with us had just been through some insanely difficult life events, but we were all sitting under a giant umbrella, trying each other's meals, singing along to 40s hits, having a blast. It's a nice little escape with real good food.

56UV4FMLiinf-NkYuaxw_Q.text: Repeatedly had to ask for water, never gave us plates when the food came, brought the food out at strange times, never brought us sugar when we ordered coffee twice, one of the food runners spilled coffee all over a stack of spoons and napkins and didn't notice (we asked for more and  we did not get any more spoons or napkins), same food runner spilled water all over my friend's shoes and didn't notice either. All over an mind-boggling 2.5 hour brunch because the service was so slow.  Gumbo was good, crawpuppies were good, french toast was good, Andouille hash was good (came out cold), po'boy was good, praline bacon was good, bananas foster was great... Overall food was good. There was an amazing live singer - she was great. Wouldn't come back for the bad service though.

EkrKmKuZ71g7uNlLmb1g2w.text: This place has good food. They have a bar if you want to eat there too. I love their crab cakes here! I usually only eat their red beans and rice or their jambalaya. Once in awhile I'll eat their gumbo. The restaurant is tidy and the service here is pretty quick.

Ydl047vZtReTDwI1rn2vAQ.text: Went to have an early Mother's Day brunch with my mom... place was pretty busy around noon on a Sunday, i was seated pretty quickly by the lovely hostess. I guess they were short one server we had to wait a bit to get drinks ordered but we were in no rush. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my mom ordered the jambalaya everything was pretty flavorful. Ordered the banana fosters bread pudding for dessert. Would definitely come back!

-j-KL1QQ_eV4Q8-FOCc-zQ.text: Meh, definitely not impressed with this place. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner since he's been craving some Creole/Cajun food and man, we were pretty disappointed of our meal.  We came in around 5pm which was during their happy hour and though we wanted to order from their menu (drinks are half off) they didn't allow us to order if we ate at the dining area which was a bummer so we didn't end up getting anything off their HH menu. I don't understand why it was an issue to order at the bar and just drink the drinks at our table but we just went with it.   We went for the gumbo, crab cake, and the etouffee with half crawfish and half shrimp.   Gumbo: 2/5 - felt like I was just eating soup from a can and I barely tasted any shrimp at all.  Crab cake: 4/5 - probably the best thing we ate out of all of the food but the portion was very small, not shareable at all.  Etouffee: 3/5 - very bland. We had to add salt but it barely helped. The shrimp was good but definitely wasn't satisfying at all.  Service was good and we got complementary bread before our meal. Not sure if I'll try this restaurant again but it definitely didn't hit the spot we were hoping to fill.

s15j_4_AVIyxRprIc8hpdw.text: Second visit in a row that was bad. Crab cake was ridiculously salty. Sent it back. Salmon was mushy. Should have sent it back. Disgusting. They got the order wrong. That's enough for me to never go back. There are MANY much better restaurants in Summerlin.

uXSpLXgs0ycOKw89E_iXEw.text: The food I found to be bland. Service was okay. The price was definitely on the expensive side for what was received. I won't be going back

yUwA0j6SWtBMKhjDEuKcYg.text: The holes is very nice bartenders good but my drink special margarita I am not satisfy with the taste overall the restaurant is very nicely decorated

VE5YlyWzUYHG8fwsAoZO_Q.text: This location in Summerlin is not quite the same as the other location on Charleston.  We went for lunch on a Saturday about 12:00 and the dining room was pretty empty, only two other tables of patrons, never a good sign...... Service was friendly and timely.  We had the Blue Crab Cake as an appetizer. It was tasty, a fair amount of crab. The lettuce it was served on was sad and wilted. The Soft Shell Crab Po Boy was good. Not great. Crab was nice and crispy but toppings were very sad ( same wilted theme from the appetizer) and this really took away from what I was hopping for in the sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft Shell Crab Po Boy

l3wFmkpermcqXp0412uiPg.text: One of those places you want to keep all to yourself, but cannot help raving about. The atmosphere was filled with a relaxed fun energy, and the live music was amazing. It seemed as though everyone in the building was grooving.   But the food! Oh My God, the food!  My hubby took me here as a result of my craving crab cakes. So, we had a crab cake as a starter and I almost died of delight eating it.  For our main dish, I had fried catfish with veggies and sweet potato fries. It was fantastic. My hubby had Blackened Chicken Alfredo. He's an  Alfredo Connoisseur said it was the best he's ever had and that next time he probably won't even order it with chicken, WHAT? That good? Yeah, I tried it and died. He was right. THAT GOOD.  I am going to go back a lot. The bar area looks like a lot of fun, and the drinks were some sort of delicious mixology wizardry. I think we'll eat in there next time. ....  So, I'm giving this a whole lot of stars, because this is the best Alfredo Sauce in town, the best crab cakes on earth, and the atmosphere was just cool.

AYvc2yr37yDQjIN1rycYsg.text: a True hidden in summerlin! very fresh, great taste. the entire place is wonderful.  friendly staff. I had the shrimp & grits. WoW.! if you love southern/ cajun food,i highly recommend Lola's. to me there is no better place!
