59cJaDsKVj2NGPtrlyyMOQ.text: Husband and I went there Memorial Day after 4:00pm and nobody had their A game on , when we got there; the hostess/ server was cooking Oysters on 1/2 shell on the grill and we got seated ordered the  1/2 doz oysters they were ok at least they were hot but we also ordered crab cakes  we were waited another 20 minuets no crab cakes re server kept saying they'll be right out we got tired of feeling like we were in the Twilight zone and couldn't get out we finally asked for the check !! That took to long too We finally got the HELL OUTTA THERE! We won't be back ever  We're very glad we didn't order a full meal, I've never been in a Louisiana restaurant that didn't offer Blackened anything chicken or shrimp or Catfish

d2bGrSDbdH5dNtJIkDQjqg.text: WE LOVE LOLA's.  "If you love it so much, why don't you get married there?" WE DID. My husband and I have been frequenting Lola's since they opened their summerlin location, casually making our way through their entire menu, sampling their specials, enjoying their friendly staff, and maybe more than enjoying a beverage or two. Not once have we been disappointed by the food or service, and every time we leave it's with smiles on our faces.  When we decided to get married and skip the whole "big wedding" thing. We wanted something small, just us, our parents, my kids, in a place that meant something to us. And that was Lola's. Their patio is beautiful, we all fit at the big table, we all ate whatever we wanted. Everyone raves about how good the food was, and how wonderful it was for us to be able to share that moment with friends and family.  Obviously I recommend it for date nights, family dinners, st. Patrick's day celebrations, birthdays, anything. Go there. Eat anything and everything. Drink drinks, watch a game, enjoy live music. We will visit Lola's as long as she'll have us. Hopefully we see you there!

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ra2UYzN5dYCvYBviFWjemA.text: Came with such high hopes for eating some home foods. Reviews were great. Unfortunately, the experience fell way short of expectations. Services were terrible. Not sure the full restaurant and busy hours are good enough reason for delayed responses and food prep. The foods are cold between the presentations. All the dishes were too salty. Not enough flavor and fire for the foods. Definitely not as authentic as we remembered (since we live in the area for the last 10 years). Reconsider before you go!

Q_5_YlqUSiTkjow_t0eZUw.text: I had the sample platter I think with catfish and shrimp and crab cake.   Ok so the crab cake - I felt like saying "Can I have some crab with this stuffing "   This is crab cake made with a stuffing and it just is not tasty to me at all. It was mushy and the flavor was not great. I felt like I was eating a stuffing patty with crab mixed into it. Overly stuffing.   The fry on the catfish and the fried shrimp was On point perfection.    Now I am a salt sensitive human I detest overly salted anything.   That being said the catfish and seasonal vegetables had Zero salt or flavor. Like add some salt.   My brother had the Shrimp Creole it was tasty.   Coming from a family of fine diners and my brother being an executive chef formerly of Rosemary's who had the best food in town I can't say this is the best I've had because it is not.   I've given it a higher review then my pallet would normally suggest because instead of now basing my review off of just the food or just the server I'm going off of my whole experience.   Here are some negative remarks   1. Why are you in the edge of summerlin with a restaurant setting yet not 1 manager came to our table to greet us or to see how things were going. If you want to charge people the finer dining prices or the lower end of that, then you should probably practice the art of fine dining in your restaurant.   It's dark there , there's no real flow to a theme just Knick knacks everywhere which the eclectic is fine however not 1 personality or any brightness of cheer in human form exists in this facility.   It would be so cool to see people happy to see other people and not just working and doing their jobs. Tell some of those men to tuck in their shirts as well.   2. When people order salads etc and a server suggests something they should probably describe in detail what it is they are suggesting. I like the house vinaigrette did not let me know this vinaigrette is overly sweet and packed with about every herb you can imagine giving it no real direction as far as flavor is concerned.   3. I even saw the owner there and she did not make eye contact she did not say hello or anything. Very rude and very uninviting. I own a few businesses and never would I not say hi or anything to anyone contributing to my success. Ever just horribly rude.   Positive Notes :   1. The server was very polite and she was attentive.   2. The food didn't take forever to make.   3. Even though the catfish lacked salt the fry on it was impeccable and the quality of the fish and shrimp was magnifique.   4. The Veranda looks quite lovely    Honestly I can't say much more. There are too many things I found mediocre.   I'm sure if the manager had greeted the table considering there were only 5-7 tables filled that afternoon that would have raised it another star for me.   If you want to be in the restaurant biz have hospitality in every aspect with every employee. I couldn't even tell which was the manager apart from everyone else.

G4E84ag7nMCclbycZKU3pQ.text: Fuuuuuuuuccccccckkkkkk!  The food is amazing!!! So much freakin tasty!  Shrimp  Sausage  Chicken  Bread  Catfish  Rice  Spice  Jesus fucking Christ is is fuuuuuuucccckkkkking delicious.

9xEj0A2wrc77wS-v3n05JA.text: Delicious food that is authentic. The waitress was very nice and was willing to help me find something for the baby to eat. Baby-led weaning friendly place. I got grilled catfish and white rice for the baby. All free of salt. Food was delicious. Only downside is that it is kind of pricey for some dishes. Bathrooms have a diaper changing station. Super family friendly!

1-cpvTkKUTxlOicgLjx84g.text: Food is great, music on the weekends is a bonus. Usually great customer service. My only complaint is the menu lists one platter at $11.99 including two sides but if you choose a regular side and a premium side, you are charged full price for the premium side. So you may as well choose two regular sides and order the premium side a la carte.  ** update: 05/27/18 you can no longer order red beans and rice as a side...   **update number 2, the bread below looks like they cleaned the grill with it... burnt.. gray/green... I would've been embarrassed to set this in front of my customers. Also have been waiting 15 minutes for a drink ordered at the bar & it's no where in sight.. **once the food finally arrived (around 8:30 even though the restaurant was supposed to close at 8, we found out two chefs had just quit) I stopped eating my chicken half way through because my stomach hurt. My date finished his bronzed catfish and grits and even ordered the bread pudding. He enjoyed it. Later that night/5am he felt very sick. Neither of us ever actually got sick-sick but experienced extreme discomfort. I feel bad writing the review bc the staff were very nice and this used to be one of our favorite places but I honestly don't see myself going back here anymore.

M4EGuilU_qKZM-_OP0nxnQ.text: Everything was super YUMMY!!!! The Tchoupitoulas I had was so flavorful!!!! My wife had the shrimp and grits and she absolutely loved it! I am not a grits fan but really liked the grits she had!!! We will definitely be back!!! Great food, great staff and great prices!

UiKmr7WqZJE17DbMKL1Qlg.text: Great environment, even better food. Our waitress went missing a few times, but when she was present she was excellent. Definitely adding to my "spots to show off" when family and friends visit.

nKiA1GvlVZGE_KBcMNVadQ.text: Ehh... I have mixed feelings on my first visit to this restaurant. Positives:  The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very attentive and friendly. They had live entertainment which was also very nice. The fried puppies appetizer came hot and fresh and I thought  they were a great concept. They made a good Moscow Mule and had some interesting beers on tap, including a beer only made in the Louisiana.  Negatives: I got the chicken and sausage jambalaya. I was enjoying it very much, until I bit into a piece of chicken. The chicken had that awful flavor that it gets when it sits in the refrigerator too long. The chicken definitely was not freshly made. This was very off putting. Also the garlic bread barely had a char on it. It tasted like buttered bread.

hu76QbXndD2Do0Q37JvzzA.text: I had heard of this place years before in New Orleans and I was pleasantly surprised when I saw one open in Vegas.  The restaurant is located in Summerlin, a nice town just outside of Vegas.  The ambulance was laid back and the music was fantastic for a sleepy Tuesday night.  Lola, the owner, was present and greeting each guest as she made everyone feel welcome.  The bartender seemed to call ever patron by name and even had their drink orders memorized...  I had the catfish and grits and the pecan pie for desert.  They were both excellent choices.  Full of flavor and pleasing to the eye.  I will most certainly be back whenever I'm in Vegas

cFVfLwxQPRtM5cj3fUU-lw.text: I called to check if they have live crawfish. They told me they have it so I went. Crawfish was dry, too dry.  It's so dry there's no juice in the heads at all.  I just couldn't suck the juice out of the heads.  I eat fresh crawfish enough to know the difference between frozen or never been frozen. I've been going LOLA during crawfish season every year to eat fresh crawfish for 20yrs. I didn't go this year so I've decided come here. Last crawfish I ate tasted like shit so I spited out and went to restroom to clean my mouth. I couldn't believe they serve this.

zIIOED75VoT068WcTBPT7A.text: The food here is AMAZING!! This was the first time in a long time I ordered a second round of appetizers. The patio dining is beautiful and comfortable. The staff is very friendly...server was extremely cute too. oj-KMccDLkIJdQliZR51BQ.text: ATTENTION HORRIBLE PLACE AND OWNER:  Took my partner and my newborn baby and my niece to Lola's Louisiana Kitchen for my partner's birthday. I had ordered close to $100 worth of food to go and the food was under seasoned. They say the're a Louisiana Kitchen but when I had called to complain I had spoke with Lola and told me to came back down. I told her there was no flavor or seasoning and Lola stated and I quote" If your looking Popeye's experience don't come here you won't find that here"  I told her that you at least need to put salt and pepper because there was none she came out rude and belligerent and smelled of alcohol. My partner as well as myself have Louisiana and creole blood and have been to Louisiana and know how the food should taste. I know she only said it cause were black/African American. But they make the food bland for all the old people who come here. No young people were found. Good spot to go if you have no taste buds and like talking with business owners who drink (drink and drive)on the job I can't believe people love this place. The atmosphere is a mess no real theme Mitch match decor. I can't believe it was on Diner, Drive ins and Dives. Never trusting the food network again. Stay away from the crab cakes they are inedible and on the menu it says lumps...there are no lumps but you can sue because u will have crab shell to pick from your teeth. Better off getting crab cakes in the frozen section at the market

ZKzTMAW1M-P6wOW7JZ1p4A.text: We went to Lola's for crawfish.  It was simply great , just enough spice .  You order by the pound and it comes with the potato and corn .  My wife had the shrimp and grits ( she always gets that) and she enjoyed it as well.  End the night with bananas foster and chicory coffee in a French press. Great friends for dinner at a great place with awesome food

GHwO7W7nHE8otpHwBFlPSw.text: Last night my wife and I went to Lola's for dinner and were basically refused service.   We arrived at 8:32pm and waited at the front to be seated, after a few minutes one of their people came up and told us if we wanted to eat we would have to eat at a small table in the bar or at the bar that they stopped seating people at 8:30.  I told him that the closing time on the door was 9:00pm nothing about 8:30 and that we wanted a table.  BTW there were people still eating in the dining area.  He refused to seat us and escorted us to the door.  Lola's is across the street from where we live and it is unfortunate that because of poor management they have lost another loyal customer.

OMm-ByJHnpoNP_IbiGKIwQ.text: I give this place 4 stars for a couple different reasons. I liked the aura of the whole set up. It was very elegant and peaceful, very beautifully designed and you almost felt like you were in Louisiana on a nice warm day. I ordered the crawpuppies, Shrimp & Grits and the red beans and rice. My favorite out of them was definitely the Shrimo & Grits, seasoned very well and very filling! Their sweet ice tea was amazing as well, not too sweet and you can still taste the tea. Overall this place was awesome, service was good and food came out fast!! I will be going back to try the other items on their menu

gbcoadk3VM8vKE8bxFY7hw.text: When you visit a restaurant you're paying for time convenience and great service otherwise you'd cook at home and deal with yourself. Usually my experience at Lolas is ok nothing spectacular but today the energy was off. I asked for a table for 3 and the host asked if we'd like to sit at the bar, it wasn't busy so we did not understand why she asked that. That was odd. I told her no and we sat down in the dining area. We sat down a few minutes before 2 and by the time the waitress came it was 2 on the dot and unlimited mimosas were over. We didn't complain and ordered the mimosas a la carte. There was a mistake with the mimosa order and I joked with the girl who brought them out that she can give me two pineapple mimosas for the price of one after she insisted the order was correct,  and she returned a rude face and smart remark. The energy was so OFF in this place especially for it to be a non busy Sunday. Lolas usually delivers ok to good service but there are far too many restaurants in Vegas for me to spend money at a place that has many employees not delivering great customer service at once.  The food was good as usual. I ordered the shrimp and grits.always a good choice.  Kelly I believe her name was Kelly was the most friendly. I would prefer her (the waitress) to bring my drinks rather then someone who is rude and looks unhappy especially when the customer isn't complaining about the mistake that was made.

J78dl35aNZzbVvMwo-l5ng.text: A fun change of pace for foodies in Vegas.  I had the shrimp and grits and they were on point.  The bread isn't as great as everyone claims,  but it could be that it arrived between lukewarm and cold.  The Jambalaya was also tasty!

GkKlAThVQrvqGtzK7Ii84w.text: Not good for large groups. We called and warn them that we need to large tables and about 15/20 of us were coming. Only after we settled in the bar area did the agree to move us to tables.  It took over an hour to get food, I'm sitting her still waiting. My order of ceaser shrimp salade came out with chicken. 5 60 minutes, Sent it back and still waiting.  We will not be back horrible service.

XBXN4v54ziMBiEfhYU2EFA.text: I'm not sure why it took us so long to mosey our way down here since this location is closer to our home.  So we decided to make our trip down on Saturday night.  If you haven't been to either Lola's, you're missing out. I feel as though this place is a staple for Las Vegas. There aren't many Lousiana style food restaurants here. But this one takes the cake.   This location, I prefer. Mostly because they have more options for alcohol, bigger, nicer and they have a live pianist that plays on Wednesday's and Friday's. You best believe I'll be going there for that. We were warned that Friday is usually packed though.   The bartender, Dominic Trupiano was awesome. You can tell he loves what he does, and he's very good at it. He was super friendly and quick to serve. He also was extremely knowladgable in his liquor, so it was nice to have someone be able to pick something we'd really like. He had be try Haig scotch -- because I like more of the floral notes. It was excellent. And it's David Beckham's scotch. Nice work, Beckham.   For dinner we had:  -Shared Cesar Salad. Always excellent.  -Their amazing crab cake appetizer. This is one of my, if not favorite thing here. It's always crispy on the outside, and packed full of crab. This is hard to find with crabcakes. They're usually filled with other things, such as corn meal or breading so they don't have to use as much crab. Lola says, "No"...apparently.  -Shrimp Creole. Man oh man, was this good. I hadn't tried this yet. It was so spicy (which I loved because I've been sick) and full of peppered flavor I loved it. The only thing I don't love is the pre-cooked rice. I don't know if this is a Lousiana thing. I'm assuming it is because I've been to Lousiana a few times and a ton of places there used pre-cooked rice. Being Asian, it's one thing I will always stand against. But, the dish was still excellent.  -Bronzed Shrimp & Grits. If you didn't know, these grits are with gouda cheese. Which happens to be MY FAVORITE cheese in the world. These are the best damn grits I've had in my life. This is one of their best dishes, and it's very easy to taste/smell why.   This place is just great. We'll frequent here more often for sure. So if you haven't been and you like Louisana style food, this is your place, my friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Lola's A Louisiana Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lola&#39;s Crab Cake appetizer. Delicious as always.

A0HibLYdVEcvobQ70cBNeA.text: This place is below average. I have been a few times and have yet to be impressed. Because the location is convenient for me I want to like it, but never enjoy myself. I'm scratching my head at how this place has 4 starts. The food is mediocre and the service is pretty bad. I swear I always get the waiter that's about to get off because that would explain the rushed, half ass treatment I get every time. I give up. They've convinced me they won't get it right!!

7U7XKV8a5rr3Sk2OQsZsOw.text: Outstanding, service and atmosphere!  We had the gumbo to start and my husband enjoyed the Seafood Platter with the Soft Shell Crab added and I feasted on the Jambalaya with extra sausage and shrimp.  The food was seasoned to perfection!  Just the right amount of spice without burning my tastebuds.  Truly loved the piano bar and after dinner we enjoyed time in the bar just relaxing to the great music!  This local gem is perfect for foodies, couples & families!

a30U1jwaEc3We0JTTHiCWQ.text: I was in town for business last week, came in Monday night (boss remembered it from previous trip) and enjoyed it so much we brought clients back Thursday.   It's a great place out of the way, service was excellent (Ruth, you're wonderful) and the food.....I think between all of us we tried almost every dish on the menu except oysters.   My boss grew up in Mississippi and one of the clients was from Louisiana, they both thought it was on spot and loved it. My favorites were the BBQ shrimp, the grits (I could eat by the bucket), and you have to save room for the banana bread pudding with bananas foster on top. I had mine with a coffee stout of some sort (sorry, bad with beer names) that worked perfect with the food.   The best part was we had a friend from Switzerland with us and it was his first time having any of these dishes, he doesn't eat seafood (I know, right?!) but he was enamored with the grits.   This is on my must visit list any time I got to Vegas now.

DkRKB9tA0nlI2PL-bQqQVw.text: We had a wonderful experience. The ambiance was great, the live music was a nice touch and the service was wonderful. We had shrimp and grits and a fig dessert and it was all delicious! We will be back on our next visit to Vegas!

6j6a9SYVMSbScLLC_XJ4cA.text: Food is cheap and has that "out of a can" feel.  Service is overly pushy.  I saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive ins and Dives and he didn't appear very impressed.  I can see why.

MgGJq_Pp3PVTSnj-3NTQ7Q.text: We loved this Cajun gem. Had a WONDERFUL watermelon salad, oysters, jambalaya and roast beef Po' Boy. All were great. Wait staff were very friendly, knew their menu well and attentive to our needs. Couldn't ask for better.

wQTHEY1inoulwR8yjX_Xcg.text: This is for take out since I haven't ate in here yet.  Their take out is pretty good and placed in good containers that's able to hold good portions.    Their rice and beans with extra sausage is really good for the price.  Every time I come here to pick up their always dead ? Hopefully they don't close cuz the food is good!

xwkOkwqYqtt_4-lELV_aYg.text: This place was amazing! We went for crawfish and we were 2 days two early, they were not available for purchase, we were all very sad but Lola came out talked with us and brought us a pound of crawfish! So Good, and such a nice thing to do! Restaurants could learn a thing or two from Lola! Please if you are in Vegas do yourself a favor and visit one of the two locations in Las Vegas!

OKg9Bza-4H_aV_Gvn6uqLw.text: Cold sides , cold shrimp , stiff grits ; ordered 2 desserts cause the pumpkin bread pudding is usually our fav and both were cold as well . They messed up the sides and gave us the wrong ones as well . It was a pick up order and we had to wait 10 minutes to pick it up so you would think, that we were waiting on our food to be finished right ? Got home and as you read everything wreck .  We spent about 70 dollars on a dinner for 2 people and it was waisted . Hopefully the desserts microwave up decent or something cause this was terrible . We were frequent flyers with Lola's until now .

YKodv_fsXYVGpWBTM0YgJA.text: I absolutely love this place the owner and the bartenders always make you feel like you belong there. Great wine selection great food fun music. Probably the best part about it is there's no gaming on the bar so people actually talk to each other and socialize. Dominic is a great bartender say hello and get the Grits they're to die for

xv9LBC2hDKPd-_2Srvf1xQ.text: Heard about this place Lola's from a golf buddy, so I decided to try it. I made a phone order for two pounds of crawfish and Jambalaya.  When I arrived to pick it up, they weren't aware of my order. Apparently, I called the other location. I asked the hostess if she can call to cancel it for me, since this Town Center, Summerlin location is nearest and it's almost closing and she obliged.   After waiting a few minutes, food was well packaged and I excitedly took it home.  Crawfish was so salty, it made me shiver! I couldn't get it down. I tried to avoid the seasonings on the outside, but the salt was well within the meat! It was so disappointing, especially since I ordered two pounds.  The Jambalaya was pretty mediocre, especially for the price. But I did agree to extra sausage.  Never again.

E5mcpuBnUrEFeGsEo3Amfw.text: I was not impressed with the service nor their food... The waitress was inattentive and the black eye peas not cooked well enough.. They were still hard... The crab cakes were full of breading.. The crab was not in chunks.. It was mixed heavily in the breading... The sweet potato pecan pie was bitter and not a lot of flavor... I can tell the potatoes were over boiled and chunky in the pie.. The pie crust tasted like it was pre-made and frozen... It had that odd taste to it... I'm a cook and I make all of these items homemade with a certain approach at home and I must say I do an excellent job.. By the way my husband  ordered the spicy chicken wings.. Not crispy but breaded with sauce doused in the wings... They were frozen wings that came out of the bag..

6LGzS9KjJCOcqBwD_Trx9w.text: Once again we dined at Lola"s and the service and food were outstanding. We just love Lola"s

ynh6s5ydxUzkT6Wq6XGgSw.text: Dining at Lola's is always a treat!   I celebrate special occasions here all the time.  Today, my friend specifically requested going to Lola's for her birthday lunch.   We enjoyed the crab cake appetizer, shrimp and grits, and the tasty beignets!   The service has always been very attentive. I love the fact Lola's is our little neighborhood restaurant here in the heart of Summerlin

EtXhKrRnRKXC5pP-Cw3OHA.text: Food was just ok.  I had much better at shanihan in forest park,Illinois  Service was great and that's why I give it the extra star. Would I got back ? Probably not.

88PFlQ-zhP15-9vtyeIqOQ.text: It is always great to eat here. Service is always on point and the food was delicious. It was not as busy yesterday, but I do recommend making a reservation because it can get very crowded.  My friend and I also had a couple of cocktails and they were great too. They waitress was very attentive and she was very careful to note that my friend has a shellfish allergy. All and all a great experience.

2NiXeoVNsbS6PEdxuBrOVw.text: For outside of Louisiana on a Sunday at 2, this place was great.  Much better than expected. My buddy from La agreed it was pretty legit. Gumbo was pretty darn good.  Crab cake was excellent,  and the jambalaya was exactly what I was looking for.  Great service,  nice ambience as well. I'll be back here for sure. And get the fig dessert if you like fig Newtons... It'll blow your mind.

jEUFum2o-Rc0wjfhdyLWag.text: Lola's has never disappointed. I love their grits!!! I order the bread pudding prior to dinner, it's just soooo yummy. The staff is beyond nice and really look after you. I am Highly recommending this restaurant. Tonight they even had live music.

7XASebR3wojYSi39G1z5zw.text: Delicious food, the grits are insane!!! The staff is so kind and very social. Love, love , love this place!   Who Dat!

Uu0LYwT-daQUYVy9RxRhzA.text: From the waitress to the food, I did not enjoy my visit. The crab cake was over cooked and looked nothing like the pic in the menu. It looked more like a flat hamburger patty. The roast beef debris poor Bo' had no flavor at all and the bread was hard. The soda was flat. I ordered a side of their grits and it came out in one of those little bowls that sauce usually comes in. It was tiny. Two spoonfuls and it was gone. It was the only thing that was decent.  I was so upset by the food, I didn't feel like being disappointed by the dessert. Our waitress was Emily W. and we saw her when we ordered our drinks and lunch and when she brought the check. She never came and checked on us and didn't thank us when we paid or when she saw us leave. Not returning

kL_LrAXSjW1Af1biUmwp7w.text: If you want authentic NOLA cuisine then this is the place. Totally took us back to our trip! The Charbroiled oysters were outstanding, just as good as Dragos! Hubby and I split our meals. The Crab cake dinner was delicious! We had never had crab cakes on green, but the flavors were amazing. Also had the Beef D Brees PoBoy, all I can say is I CANT WAIT TO COME BACK!!!

weTC09nI3GP8lW0E8JGeAw.text: Went there pre dinner as reviews say it gets quite busy at dinner hours. Ordered the char broiled oysters and was somewhat disappointed as the oysters were small and still connected to the shell, for the price..2 bucks an oyster, it would have been nice to not have to use the little 3 pronged fork and tear the heck out of the oysters. I ordered the Bronze catfish and grits which was also raved about. The cajun catfish was good and spicy but the gouda grits were over cooked not like the southern grits I am used to. Randee, our server, was excellent.  One more note, happy hour drinks prices are only given at the bar, what is that about?

ZYqNDa-4lNCJydPbsPbThw.text: Best "soul food" in Las Vegas Southern style!!! And both locations are simply wonderful!

JUuRuNlkzaUL4YoFNq4lgg.text: Excellent fish and grits every time I go. I love the toasted bread too and the staff is always courteous. If you like Lousiana food you'll love it there.

_WhJyPzkH0DPoiARLMOV2Q.text: This was a yummy place!  I am not really a cajun food kind of girl, but everything was delicious!  I tried the catfish on a friend's recommendation.  I don't like catfish because it always tastes "dirty" to me.  This did not.  It was fresh, cooked to perfection and was wonderful.  I didn't know what I was missing.  And the cheesy grits!  I don't like grits either, but these are fantastic!    If you want to try a little down south food and hospitality - head to Lola's.  Oh - and by the way - if you are a New Orleans Saints fan, you will have a great time!

MgvCgsfML2VI43A9wV0rPw.text: Confusion and mediocre food. The only saving grace was our server - Kindra. Our visit was on Feb 26, 2015. We have been to the East Charleston several times and loved it. We were looking forward to visiting this location for some time. When our city councilman scheduled a meeting there it was the perfect opportunity to go. Arrived an hour before the meeting around 5 for an early dinner.  I told the hostess we were there for the meeting and dinner....confusion.  She  then escorted us to a nice long (high) table in the bar area and said 'They are going to meet here'. No menu's. A server stopped by and asked why we were sitting there so I pointed in the direction of the hostess.....still no menus. The bartender asked us what we would like to drink and recommended the Hurricane. Asked for a menu and did not get one...he also asked why were sitting there. Mind you the place is empty at this point. Now there is a major discussion amongst the troops. Finally our server brought our drinks and whaa -la...menu's. BTW the drinks were horrible @ $10 each. Not even close to Pat O'Briens.  I asked if we should move. "No, No you guys are ok there."  Next to visit our table was the bar manager asking the same question. Ugh. We about had it with all this confusion. We ordered; Craw puppies..they were rather bland but saved by the dipping sauce ($5.29), a crab cake appetizer which tasted like tuna...no chunks of crab ($6.99), and finally to complete the misery Jambalaya which was so dried out and gummy. I think it was leftover and warmed in a microwave ($10.29, plus $4.29 for three shrimp) The dish did have nice seasoning and chunks of sausage (not cajun) but rather dried out.  Now the place is filling up and four additional folks were seated at our table. Which was fun at first...until the (older) gentleman started complaining out loud that he got there an hour early to sit at 'this' table. The two ladies that he was with were rather embarrassed. Guess who stopped by next? Lola. She stood by our table and asked if we were going to be done soon as there was a large party scheduled. I mentioned what had happened earlier and that we were questioned about our location. I also stated that most restaurants have a staff pre-shift meeting to go over specials, parties, meetings....etc so at least her hostess would know what was going on. We then ajourned to the meeting room and had a nice time with our city councilman.   Our server was fantastic and the only saving grace for the evening. She knew the menu and visited our table several times. I did mention the 'food' and she offered to adjust the bill but we declined and just recommended that she speak to the cook.   The final masterstroke of confusion was this; By the front door was a chalkboard announcing that there was going to be a dinner with a wine pairing featuring Lohr wines for somewhere around $30/person. Nice. I asked Lola on the way out what was on the menu for the affair. She did not know....."call back".   The place is big with a nice bar. There is a grill where the servers prepare the garlic toast. The meeting room is large with easy access to the bar and dining area.  Overall it's a typical Summerlin/Sun City/Denny's kind of place with marginal food but great service.  Sorry...but this location does not hold a candle to the east Charleston eatery. BTW...the 'large party' was Purdue alums there to watch a b-ball game.  Sorry for the confusion.....
